Reviews.Title: “Lot better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pr_usa
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say that staff is very kind and helpful. Check in process was very quickly and honestly I was surprised since they had free "cooked-to-order" breakfast, they gave me free tickets for two drinks per day, also they have happy hour from 5:30-7:30 for any drink you want...yes free (Something you don't often see in US territories hotels). Pools is very nice, specially for kids. Beach is just OK but there are other public beaches in Dorado that you can go to. Hotel has a new Casino which is very nice, golf course is very nice and the new oriental restaurant is awesome. Self parking is $10.00 per day if you have a rental car. Around there are a lot of places you can go for dining, shopping and entertainment. Went to Made in Puerto Rico which is about 5 minutes from the hotel and food was very nice puertorican style plates. Attendants were also very funny. Hotel stay was very good and will be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rene B
Reviews.Content: The check-in was easy and timely, the resturant and bar staff was friendly and the food was very good at both the in hotel resturant and accross the drive at the chophouse/oriental grill. The rooms were nice for the price. The pullout couch bed was not very comfy but it was a standard mattress. Managers receptions, that we made it to, served rail but drinks were good and plentiful. Our view was great as we could see both the ocean and some of the golf course. The course t-boxes and fairways could have used watering, however we lost enough balls in the water hazards argh. The only think I would have added was more activity. It would have been nice to have group water areobics or some poolside activities. They had music on weekend but otherwise not much to do after dinner and the area didnt seem to have too much happening.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: quinellax
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, great value and terrific service all in one. This was my first trip to Puerto Rico and I booked in Dorado to be near to my husband's family (he's from the Dorado area). We were bowled over by the warmth and helpfulness of the entire staff. Everyone spoke perfect English (which was a concern for me, not my husband!). The valet staff (even though we didn't use the service) were super friendly and very helpful with places to go, etc. We didn't meet one staffer of the hotel who wasn't very warm and friendly. It elevated the luxuriousness of our stay tremendously. The room was big, clean and comfortable. My daughter even said the sofa bed was very comfy. The breakfast was fantastic and the Manager's reception every evening was a nice way to end your day and begin your night out! The pool and beach areas were phenomenal. The breakers made the private beach your own private lagoon. The waves (when there were waves) were very small, which made it the perfect beach for kayaking and paddle boating. The only negative I can think of, and it was minor, was the hotel restaurant. We ate there the first night as we arrived sort of late. The food was pricey, the selection was small and everything was extremely over-salted. Service was great, and the drinks were mighty fine! Lunch at the outdoor bar and grill was a different story....reasonably priced and very good food. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. I am already planning a return next year and have every intention of spending more of my time enjoying the resort amenities and less time sight seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location and Terrible Beach”
Reviews.Author: mdmachlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Dorado back in November 2009. This was our second trip to Puerto Rico and I have to say that I was very disappointed with the Embassy Suites. My in-laws are Marriott Timeshare owners and they decided to stay at the Embassy Suites because we would have kitchen areas to prepare our meals in. The first issue is the location of the Embassy. Because it is on a large property it is almost a mile walk to get to the main street. A car is necessary to get around everywhere. We really enjoyed taking walks at night and walking to the local restaurants during our first stay. This was not possible at the Embassy. The beach at the resort is absolutely awful. I am from Florida so maybe I have higher beach standards than others do? The beach itself is small and there are not many spots to lay down a towel. It is nearly impossible to swim in the ocean unless you are a skilled swimmer. During rough currents you are smashed onto rocks. Because the beach is terrible everyone goes to the pool and the seats are all taken by lunch. Go to the pool early or be prepared to not get a lawn chair. During our trip I got a rash all over my body. I don't know if I had an allergic reaction with jacuzzi outside or the fabric detergent on our sheets, but needless to say I spent the majority of my trip taking benadryl and misserable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: rvbolorin
Reviews.Content: Just arriving back from 3 nights stay with husband and 2 teenagers. Breakfast buffet and evening recepction with free unlimited drinks were very good. Pool area a little bit crowded but we enjoyed it. The room was spacious and clean, staff very helpful. The beach is small and the bottom is full of weeds, not good experience. The public beach Cerro Gordo is about 15 minutes by car and it was not crowded and had security/police so we enjoyed it. We rested a lot. You need a car to stay here. Food is expensive but there are several options around but you need a car. Room has microwave. Walgreens and Cvs also nearby. Live music on weekend nights.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Buckoranch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dorado del Mar back in February of this year while on a business trip and I liked the hotel enough that I would book it again for either business or leisure. Although the hotel is not exactly new, everything was very clean. The staff were friendly as well as helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean. I enjoyed the manager's reception that is held every night for the guests. The outside area is set up nicely. There was plenty of seating availble both in the sun and in the shade. The complimentary breakfast buffet in the morning can't be beat. There is a chef ready and waiting to prepare any type of omelet for you. There were plenty of choices besides omelets including pancakes, bacon, fruit and more. The food was very good. There were only two things that kept this hotel from being excellent, the long drive to get to the hotel and the parking garage. After going through the security gate off the main road, it seems like there are about 20 speedbumps before actually getting to the hotel. It made me think twice about leaving the hotel once I got there each time. The parking garage is not attached to the hotel itself. The garage itself is nice and valet parking is an option from the front of the hotel. I chose to do the self parking, and it took a couple of minutes to get from the garage to the hotel, not the end of the world in nice weather, but in the rain it was not as nice. There is a small casino between the garage and the hotel which looked nice from the outside, but I did not go in during this visit-maybe next time. Like I said, I would stay here again because the few items that were not great were also not that big of a deal to begin with, especially considering all the other great aspects of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Kathy/HoustonSuburb
Reviews.Content: Typical Embassy Suites layout of hotel and room with a great exception - the pool. Resort style outdoor pool with separate warm water spa and separate children's pool area. Beach is nothing special. Staff very helpful with local restaurants recommendations and directions. I wouldn't recommend staying here without a car, there is not enough to do within walking distance. Staff is very helpful suggesting things to do and how to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: boandjill
Reviews.Content: Overall, it's a nice hotel. Things I liked: 1. The room was nice 2. There is an adjacent casino, but you aren't required (and can't) go through the casino to get to the rooms. 3. Breakfast was good 4. Managers reception included liquor (see other comment below). 5. The Orient House restaurant next door had some of the best food I've had in quite a while. 6. WiFi worked great on the 5th floor. Things I didn't like: 1. TV stations are lacking and there are no HD channels. 2. Room AC temperature could not be regulated. You get high/medium/low or off. The thermostat did not work. 3. Beer selection at managers reception was limited to Bush light. Really? With all the good local beers, Bush light was it? 4. Music was always too loud at the restaurant. It's a restaurant, not a dance club.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close”
Reviews.Author: scarlet0817
Reviews.Content: I'm stealing the title of a book for this review as it fits perfectly with the situation. Under no circumstances should you stay at this hotel on a Friday or Saturday night. Unless you don't mind crackling music blowing out your eardrums even behind the closed door of your room. All the rooms in Embassy Suites face the lobby. The music in the lobby is so ridiculously loud you can't hear your companions speech in your own room. This goes on until 11 p.m. and then the pool bar takes over into the wee hours. Additionally we reserved a partial ocean view and confirmed this with 3 separate phone calls. We wanted to assure the two reservations were linked - one with points, one paid. We didn't want to move. On 3 separate occasions we were told all was well. When we arrived lo and behold we were given a room right smack in the middle of the noise because of a "conference." We had to move the next day. The front desk was rude, as if this was our fault, and we were demanding mainland tourists. We asked to be refunded that first night. After 5 nights and no call from the manager, though that was promised on 2 occasions, they agreed. We are still waiting for the credit to appear on the card. Jury is out. Outside at the pool we were sitting at the edge watching the little one swim when we (and others) were asked to move so a guy with a high powered hose could clean the area. It had rained the night before, it was already washed clean by fresh water. And why the high powered hose? What an incredible waste of fresh water. At any rate, shouldn't you do this before the guests come out for a swim? The hotel is poorly managed. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: katandliz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find, we had a room that was like an apartment. We had a balcony with ocean views, full kitchen, living room and separate bedroom and bathroom with a hot tub in the room. It has a couple different pools, a bar and grill, restaurant and indoor bar. The golf course members lounge had lunch specials everyday, we only went once but it was awesome, great deal! There is a casino on the grounds.The only thing I didn't like was having to pay for parking, and they charged a deposit fee at check in, because nobody told us about the extra charges but overall a great experience and good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: STL_Jayhawk
Reviews.Content: This is the best Embassy Suites I have stayed at. The hotel has a resort feel. The rooms are very nice and with most having an ocean view. The breakfast is very good with the best "hotel" coffee I have had (strong with hot milk, very Latin). The pool is a nice size. The beach is very nice with palm trees for shade and breaker walls to make a nice beach and swimming area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Week long vaca”
Reviews.Author: berry4428
Reviews.Content: This is a nice location but it is a standard Embassy Suites when you are indoors. The pool area was nice and the beach was not too bad. It has a lot of things available to do depending on your likes; Golf, Casino, Beach etc.... Some say it is far from everything but in reality, PR is a big island and no matter where you stay you will be far from something you want to visit. We enjoyed the hotel and the island and hope to return to see more of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: nelly362
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at this hotel a group of friends and I stayed here and was very pleased you cant beat the breaksfast and the happy hour. the rroms were very nice and the views were amazing will come back again

Reviews.Title: “EdandNan”
Reviews.Author: Ed S
Reviews.Content: The warmth, caring and helpful staff at this hotel is second to none. We have traveled to many locations but this hotel keeps us wishing to return and that is exactly what we have done for several years. It is a pleasure to enjoy the immaculately clean pools and hot tub all in a lovely beach setting, Great happy hour daily but the breakfast buffet is a favorite. The new casino is a fun way to spend some time. The golf course onsite is challenging and one of our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TexasAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Traveled here over Spring Break. It is an older hotel that is maintained extremely well and is on the beach. I can not say enough about how clean the room is and how nice all of the staff is. The General Manager, Marisol Colon goes above and beyond in making sure all of her customers are taken care of. She is a great manager and you could not ask for anyone better. We spent 7 nights here and highly recommend it. The room was so comfortable also and it was quiet. You are in close proximity to many things. If traveling to Puerto Rico, make sure you get a rental car if you want to see the island. Included in your rate is a free hot or cold breakfast, free wifi, and a manager's reception each night for 2 hours with an open bar. I have stayed at Hilton properties throughout the world. I must say, I highly recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JAXTRAVELLINGMOM
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect for the great price-134.00 a night plus parking. Includes breakfast and two bottles of water a day and two cocktails a day at the managers reception in the evenings. The lobby has a nice area where you can eat and listen to a lady sing in the evenings. They have people selling homemade goods and crafts as well. The overall atmosphere is vibrant and fun! I would not want to stay on a low floor though if I wanted to turn in early b/c it is a bit loud until about 11pm. The pool area is awesome! The have karaoke at night and during the day great music and an excellent walk in shallow area for the kids with a small slide area. The beach is public with a few rentals. In the morning the sunrise is beautiful and you can get great photos on the rock formation that extends over the ocean. The area may be a bit dangerous though b/c the water is rough. I would not let my kids go out in the water alone at all. There is a bit of barb wire fencing all around which also makes me wonder if the area around is very safe either. Outside of the resort the town has a lot of barb wire fencing and bars on windows which confirms my worries. My stay in the tourist areas of San Juan next time and pay a bit more money for safety. Overall I liked the resort atmosphere just not the location-is a hike into San Juan too and it took us 2.5 hrs from the airport during rush hour. It is only 16 miles form the airport!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not our Favorite in PR-Lacking WOW factor”
Reviews.Author: JDPOW
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days here at the beginning of March. We had 5 in our party (including 2 small children and a grandma). The hotel's pool is nice and has a lot of features that are good for kids; kiddie pool, wade-in pool section, and playground. Compared to the other resorts that we have stayed at in PR (Rio Mar & Grande Melia) this resort has a serious lack of the WOW factor. Mainly the hotel itself needs updating. The hotel opens into a grand atrium so that you can here the 'karyoke' from the bar singer throughout our entire room. When we booked this trip it was listed as the same place as the Rio Mar. . . comparing apples to apples we would definitely go to the Rio Mar instead. What we liked: Having a suite so that we could close the door to the bedroom was helpful with small kids napping. The rooms also have a mini-bar with frig, sink, and microwave. Our room came with the daily breakfast buffet and evening managers reception. The hotel was very close to downtown Dorado and convenient to the highway. Free parking. Even though the hotel was near full capacity, it was easy to get a chair by the pool. What we didn't like: Other than the breakfast buffet the only place at the hotel to get food is at the poolside bar. The service was okay but VERY slow. . . and we are regular island travelers. Traveling with kids the restaurant situation was too slow. Even if our kids weren't in tow, the restaurant would get old after a couple of days. More choices are warranted. The hotel did not have the overall vacation feel. The hotel is more suited for a business meeting than a real vacation, in our opinion. Having carpets in a beach hotel rooms are less than ideal. Feels grose. We requested adjoining rooms and were told that they would be available for us (b/c can't leave small kids in a room by themselves). At check-in we were told that adjoining rooms were not ready but would be available to us the next day. The rooms became available but d/t 'high occupancy' they would then decided to not let us change rooms. The house keeping services were the worst that we have ever experienced. Our room was not 'cleaned' until 5pm. I use the term loosely b/c my husband and I keep a VERY clean room, even so housekeeping did not even wipe down tables, empty the trash, or vacuum. They only seemed to fold the towels. Overall, I would receommend this hotel only if it came at a significant cost savings compared to the other two hotels (Rio Mar & Grande Melia). If you do stay here, we strongly recommend a rental car. The hotel store has VERY little and the restaurant will get old quickly. Across the street from the hotel is a sushi/hibacci restaurant which is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Charles17887
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel during a work conference. The room was huge, the bed was clean and the view just breathtaking. Also I love the fact of the open bar until 7 pm with free brevages. The pool was beatiful and the beach was great. Definetly this resort is a dream. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite”
Reviews.Author: 95rangerover
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice resort. You will not be disappointed. Pay extra to get ocean front, if the view from your room in important. The resort is right on the ocean and the pool complex is really nice. The price includes the best breakfast buffet I have had, including omlets made to order. There is also a 2 hour manager's reception from 5:30 to 7:30 with free drinks. Staff was great. Rooms clean. The pool is not crowded. There is an open air pool bar which looks over the pools and ocean. Order the Cuban sandwich. Nice restrauant on property. One nice asian restraunt right across from the entry drive. Casino on property. Lots of local restraunts within 1-2 miles (but too far to walk to them). The reviews for this are uniformly positive and well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Rayeniska
Reviews.Content: Its a beautiful hotel, very clean. The breakfast was complete and good. The room was very comfortable. I recomended

Reviews.Title: “"HOME AWAY FROM HOME"”
Reviews.Author: verag11541
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Embassy Suites Dorado del Mar Beach & Golf Resort from FEB 8 TO FEB 22 & for 2 WKS,We were treated royally by the entire staff. The Embassy is simple yet elegant,tranquil,tropical & immaculately maintained. We want to commend Marisol,Raymond,Nilda,Ivan,Noel & the entire staff. It's no wonder the Embassy is so well run,you're like a family. Thank you again for a wonderful time,We'll be back,VERA & JIM

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities”
Reviews.Author: SeeGodsWorld
Reviews.Content: About 30min from San Juan. Nice golf course. Rooms are clean and have so much in them, frig, microwave, 2 tv, great shower pressure . Pool is really nice. Not a big beach area. Can't take a stroll on the beach since its land locked. Fabulous breakfast and staff. Great room service . Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had a really nice stay. Easily recommended. Smiling helpful staff. No complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy to report that we did not experience any of the negative things others here have commented on. Our check in went smoothly upon arrival on Saturday evening the 11th of Feb. There was no wait. The hotel was sold out for the night so we checked into a room facing the East on the 4th floor. Being Hilton Gold members, we were entitled to a room upgrade so we were told not to unpack because we could move the next day. It was an 8 night stay so we decided to just leave everything in suitcases for the night. There was loud music until 11pm that we could hear in the 1st room but not in the bedroom when the door was closed. We woke up early and had a great breakfast at 7:15am (not crowded at all for a Sunday morning at that time). Actually, we never waited more than 2 or 3 minutes tops to place our breakfast order every morning. Perfect eggs over easy when I requested them too! The grapefruit was so good too! Fresh fruit every morning that I am missing now too. Our 1st full day Sunday we drove into old San Juan for some sightseeing and when we returned at 4pm, were able to receive a room upgrade to the 7th floor on the west side with a partial ocean view. It was a very nice change and a beautiful sunset view every evening. The room change meant we no longer were disturbed by the music and heard the frogs each night as we went to sleep. The bed was nice and comfy, shower worked great and we really enjoyed the pool and beach areas too. We never took any valuables down to the pool or beach area but never felt there were security issues either. We spent about an hour in the pool one day and everything was exactly how we left it so I don't know why some people thought there was issues regarding that. Towels could be returned until 11pm so we never had an issuer there either. Everyone on staff we encountered was friendly and very attentive to any questions I had. What impressed me most is the man (sorry I don't remember his name) who actually remembered my name and greeted me by name one evening when I was asking about local restaurants. I didn't even know his name yet he remembered mine. Something small like that goes a long way and really made a positive impression on me. About the only disappointment was that we had to leave before breakfast on Sunday morning the 19th and they don't have breakfast bag options available like a Hampton does (my only suggestion for improvement at this point.)

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: ASN1972
Reviews.Content: We didn't have any problem with bedbugs. Bed linens were very clean, and 2 weeks after our trip none of us have any itchies or rashes or anything. This is a nice resort. The lobby is impressive, but could be more beautiful if the interior was painted cream or ivory, and not a miserable mustard yellow. The skylights were thick and dirty so could not see natural sunlight or sky, which would have been outstanding. The suites were also painted a dark yellow so the sitting area/living room, was like a dark dungeon. The room was nice enough since we paid an extra $15 for a higher floor with ocean view, which is breathless and we rarely buy hotel rooms with a beach view since we are usually thrifty so it was nice to have it for 4 days. The buffet was ok. We were excited the first day, but the omelets are tasteless. The potatoes are hard, dried, and not hot enough. However, it's pretty good for a free breakfast, but would have been nicer if there were Puerto Rican foods. The pool area was spacious and beautiful. Kid had a blast. We were there 2 weeks ago, and even though the weather was in the 80s, still felt too cold to go into the pool or beach, which felt frigid. We never went in past our waist in the pools or beaches of PR. Water felt too cold. The beach area at the resort is very small. Good for little kids since shallow and calm, but no where to walk, stroll, or explore. Sand here is dark gold so the water is not crystal clear like in some parts of PR like Luquillo Beach where we went to [far end of public beach]. I was paranoid about having our stuff stolen from the silly stories written by other reviewers. I did not see any hill where another reviewer said she saw hoodlums running up the hill with a back-pack. I felt perfectly safe lying on the beach alone on a weekday while my husband and child were at the pool. There were maybe a total of 6 people on the beach that morning. I had a $1200 camcorder and a $1200 digital camera, but I kept it within arms length. I didn't really go into the water b/c so frigid, but as long as I kept it within my vision 10 feet away on the sand even if I did go into the water, there's no way I felt like anyone would have stolen it. The other reviewer must have literally walked away from her stuff for a good 30 minutes or more not within her vision. Who in this day and age would not keep expensive camera paraphernalia within at least 10 to 15 feet away without watching it. I did the same thing in Luquillo Beach, where there were more people and no one fishy came even close to my bag. You have to be vigilant. This city is a good 35 minutes from San Juan, but it was fun driving back and forth to the Plazas America Mall or to Pinones [Loaiza] where we always eat the acapurrias. It's also located in an area where there's a CVS and Walgreen's across the resort. There is also a supermarket and fast food so you don't have to eat at the hotel. We have been to Puerto Rico 5 years now, and we always rent a car otherwise we would be bored stiff just staying in a resort with no access to come and go as we please. I am not a resort person who can lay around the pool all day or stay in a dark suites so 2 days here would have been good enough. Not likely to stay in Dorado again since the beach and water are pretty to look at from your room, but the actual beach is not that great. The parking garage was a close walk and affordable at $10. The hotel is not stupendous or new, but it's above average so I gave it 4 stars. Another great thing is the laundromat in the basement. That allowed our family of 3 to bring 2 carry-on's for 6 days in Puerto Rico. Not bad doing laundry since it only kills 2 hours of your evening. A bad thing is that there is no prime cable like HBO or Showtime so it got boring at night. I found myself going to bed at 8 or 9 pm, and waking up at 5 am it was so sleepy and boring in this part of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Matt L
Reviews.Content: I was here with my family and the room was perfect. The two queen beds and the living area was a perfect amount of space. The beach was quite and relaxing, no load boats or jet ski's. The food was great and staff was extremely nice...all in all a nice hotel. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, affordable getaway had everything we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Off2thenext
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected from an Embassy Suites- helpful efficient staff, hot breakfast included, parking garage, convenience store, bar & restaurant. Also, a clean suite, plenty of room for 3 women in their 40s, it even had a balcony with 2 chairs...it had a refrigerator(empty, I have no idea why another reviewer thought it would be stocked, that is called a mini-bar). The atrium is airy & nice, and glass doors open to a meandering patio with a few steps and ramps, shaded by palm trees, to the pool and the beach, reminiscent of a very fancy hotel in Miami Beach. The beach was very pleasant, the cove was built so the water was calm & shallow, towel service was great, there was no lack of lounge chairs that could be pulled over to the shade, used on the grass, or in the full sun. We ate lunch nearly everyday at the shady pool bar, the waiter even took our drink orders on the beach one day-this did not seem to be a regular thing, which was fine, I would rather eat lunch at a table than on a lounge chair. Parking was $10 per day in the most roomy parking garage in PR it seemed-the one in Old San Juan had steep turns! It is about 35 minutes from the airport or Old San Juan, w light traffic. We did the drive 3 times, with mixed results, but it was worth it to be away from the city and have a private beach. Spa & Exercise room: Massages and other services are done on the lower level by an outside vendor, with whom there was some scheduling confusion with the front desk. Services were very good, tho, and prices comparable to what we were used to. Gym is great, but it would be nice if it had a view. Dining: all food was good, nothing spectacular, but no need to go anywhere else if you don't want to. In the town of Dorado, 5 min away, there is a tiny, but fabulous, Italian restaurant called Grappa. Across from the entrance to the hotel, we had great sushi at a place above the golf club. There is a casino, but we had no interest in that. Lots of people there, all the time. The pool got busy on the weekend, lots of families, but not too crowded. There are 2 infinity pools, a child-friendly sloped entry area and separate wading pool with fountain. Also, a shower area as you came off the beach, and bathrooms convenient to the beach. We really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, with a few qualifications”
Reviews.Author: M J
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms are spacious and clean, although they are smaller than rooms at any other Embassy Suites that I've stayed at. The pool area is clean and very nice. The beach is small but great for wading - it would be a great beach for young kids. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. But, there are a few negatives: You have to pay $10 a day for parking, but the parking is in a deck that is a short walk from the hotel - it's a pretty inconvenient situation, especially since they are charging you for the parking. Also, the furniture in our room was a little worn-out, not bad, but it should be replaced. And the lighting in the rooms is dim and they have put the bright-white flourescent bulbs in the fixtures, which make the rooms look cold and sterile. The hotel is surrounded by the golf course and several villa communities, but each of the villa areas have their own gates and are typically surrounded by fences - so there aren't any decent routes for walking around, especially at night. The weekend crowd was large, but the pool and beach had plenty of room for everyone, and the crowd was never too loud or out-of-line, very family-friendly. We had wrist bands to identify us as hotel guests around the pool, but I'm not sure if the staff was paying any attention to them - but, like I said everything was very pleasant, even with a large crowd. The beach could have been cleaned a little more thoroughly - but it wasn't bad. The hot tub was great a few of the nights, but towards the end of our stay, the water was only warm, not hot. I would highly recommend renting a car - while Durado is a great town with convenient drug stores, grocery stores, and restaurants, most of the tourist activities are in San Juan or farther east. Again, I would recommend this hotel - the location is great (but a little away from the tourist draws), and the staff and facilities are top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OCCTRAVELE
Reviews.Content: Great location. Hotel is close to restaurants, and downtown and a small casino. Since it is located on a golf course, afternoon and morning walks are great. The exercise room is also well equipped. The room was a little dated, but was well maintained. The view depends on the room location, the higher the better and beachside is best. The beach was small but sufficient for the average person. Staff friendliness varies-Nadine (?) the afternoon bartender is a real gem. She is the star of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again, #1 in Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: MarciaS8
Reviews.Content: We have made this hotel our Puerto Rican destination for the past 4 years! Yes, the beach, the ocean, the pool, the restaurants, the free daily breakfast, the lunches at the Blue Seahorse Restaurant (especially the hamburgers!), the free evening Happy Hour, the Paradise Cafe dinners, are all SPECTACULAR! The most important reason we return year after year is the customer service! Every staff member we encountered on this trip (9 days) was smiling, friendly, and offered their assistance should we need something during our stay. This attitude is directly attributable to the leadership provided by the hotel's general manager, Marisol Colon. We have already reserved rooms for 2013!

Reviews.Title: “So far so good”
Reviews.Author: ninanader
Reviews.Content: we arrived by taxie from the airport. Staff is lovely and the room although may need an update is very clean and the bed is very comfortable. Hector the bell man is very helpful to get us a car and book excurisions. The beach and water is very beautiful,but could use some raking. the pools are lovely and a very nice hot tub as well. I had a few problems trying toschedule time at the spa, but all worked out. The girl was very quiet but gave a great peddy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location But food and drink quality hurt experience”
Reviews.Author: barbara5650
Reviews.Content: The location of Embassy Suites in Dorado is beautiful. Sadly though the food and beverage directors need to reconsider juices from mixes and poor quality of breakfast food mostly but food service overall was below average

Reviews.Title: “hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: Heather R
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst resort experiences I have ever had! If you are looking to go to a resort on the beach, don't come here. The beach is dirty and it is a small cove. You cannot walk on the beach at all. You are charged a "maid and bellman" tip on your bill whether you like it or not so don't tip them on your own. I made an appointment for a massage. When I got to the "spa", I was taken to a makeshift room off of the workout area. I could hear the machines going, people talking, the TV, etc. I finally stopped the massage because it was a terrible experience and the woman berated me for it. This hotel is dated, the service is bad, and if you are unhappy with something, keep it to yourself because they DO NOT CARE!

Reviews.Title: “Stop off and have breakfast in between Greens at Dorado Beach”
Reviews.Author: BryantheViking71
Reviews.Content: Played golf at 8-00am with friends before it gets too hot...a round takes upto 5 hours as you can also have breakfast between Greens whilst you play. Sand in the bunkers is so fine it makes getting out easier...but watch out for the Alligators when near Water hazards !

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice stay..”
Reviews.Author: Heather W
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. You have to go through a security gate to get in which didnt make me feel very "secure". You can just drive up and say you are a guest at the hotel and they dont even ask your name or room number. Makes me wonder if their are just random people coming in who arent staying at the hotel, using the pool and other things. You are suppose to wear an arm band at the pool so they know you are staying there but we never did and no one questioned us. THe managers hour (2 hours of free drinks a night) was nice but it was the same drinks EVERY night and the same snacks EVERY night. After 4 nights of the same food and drink, we started skipping "happy hour". The continental breakfast was nice. made to order omlets, fruit, bacon, eggs, sausage, cereal, yogurt, oatmeal, juice, coffee.. a REAL breakfast! :) The hotel staff was very nice and the rooms were nice as well. The hotel stay overall was OK.. we will probably stay somewhere else on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach hotel south of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: tonytigerjaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter enjoyed this very nice secluded hotel. The hotel was south of Old San Juan. As usual all Embassy Suites included a full breakfast. Service and the beach were great. Luckily we rented a car so we were able to visit Arecibo and downtown San Juan. We even visted the adjacent Hyatt hotel, which was larger and even nicer, but, more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scope123
Reviews.Content: We needed to do our annual winter getaway and decided to go to Puerto Rico this year. We spent 3 days outside of San Juan and then 3 days in the city. We chose the Embassy for our non-city location because of the reviews we had read on Trip Advisor. We were very pleased with our decision! The item we liked most about this hotel was the service. Each and every employee we encountered gave the impression that they really cared about helping you. You never felt that one more question was too much. The other reasons we wanted to stay at the Embassy Suites were because it is an Embassy Suites. This hotel has great benefits: two room suites, free full breakfast, free managerâ€™s reception, and free Wi-Fi. How can you go wrong? As other folks have mentioned, the pools were great and the beach area was also very nice. Some people mentioned that the beach needed to be cleaned. We found it to be in great shape each and every morning. By the end of the day there was a bit of debris but nothing to complain about. The beach is protected for the ocean because of two large barriers so it was very calm and fun to swim in. We also rented a paddle boat one day and had some fun with that. A couple of reviews said that this hotel is out of the way and difficult to find. We found exactly the opposite. Yes, it is outside of San Juan and that is why we chose to go here. Our GPS with just its US maps had no problems getting us to the hotel (or anywhere in Puerto Rico). The hotel is about 30 minutes from the airport and most of the trip was on a freeway. The location for us was great and we used it as our hub to sight see on the Northern half of the island. We went east to El Yunque rain forest and hiked - awesome. We went west to the Arecibo Observatory and learned about an incredible telescope - amazing. There was also shopping nearby and many beaches. We also hit the casino one night at the hotel and actually broke even!! We really enjoyed the food at the hotel as it was very reasonably priced. Our first day we had sandwiches at the pool, one night we had room service deliver a pizza and club sandwiches, and then there is the breakfast. We also enjoyed other food while we were in Dorado. We went to a small restaurant in Dorado called Antojitos del Kitrinche. The food was excellent and very reflective of Puerto Rican Culture. Kitrinche is reviewed on Trip Advisor and people said the service was slow. And it was on "Island Time", but you are on vacation.... The food was well worth the wait. We went to Puerto Rico wondering if we would want to go back again. The overall consensus was "yes" and that we would definitely stay at the Embassy Suites as well! Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, Fun Stay in Beautiful Dorado”
Reviews.Author: Carolina-Sean
Reviews.Content: As a couple, we spent the second week of January at the Embassy Suites in Dorado. We had a perfect experience from the time we would get up (ready to enjoy the made-to-order omelet breakfast) to the time we would turn-in after a full day. Highlights of the resort are the immaculate, clean grounds, the lagoon pools, the nice beach with a shallow reef area (looks perfect for snorkeling), the amenities of the hotel and an extremely friendly staff. Special mention to the new food and beverage director, Mr. Bonafant, who always had a kind greeting to us and inquired about our stay. Other friendly staff members were Brenda at the front desk, Adrian at breakfast, Lynette at the pool, our waiter George at the restaurant, and all of the friendly bartenders and manager's reception happy hour hosts. We also enjoyed the new casino (plenty of penny slots for the thrifty gambler), and the restaurant Orient House (both just across from the hotel), and we really like walking into Dorado, trying a number of friendly bars and restaurants (Made in Puerto Rico and The Crazy Bull were both really good). Thanks for such a nice, relaxing stay. We cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a w\eek in January. There are many benefits to this hotel (free breakfast, very clean rooms, good 24 hour fitness center, large pool area, direct access to clean, quiet beach, children' s area of the pool, outdoor courtyard, free happy hour/manager reception, quiet rooms). The staff was also very helpful with directions to nearby attractions. I would definitely recommend renting a car. Self parking is convenient and cheaper option than valet. In Dorado, you do have quick access to shops if needed (CVS, Walgreen's, Starbucks, Subway, grocery store, etc). They are about 1 mile away so a car wouldn't be needed for that but for any excursion it would be. I think I'd only change a few things (like the number of speed bumps to the gated hotel and a few healthier options for breakfast (unsweetened cereal, oatmeal w/o coconut milk). Overall we had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcmbdm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 2 days at the Embassy suites in Dorado. The room was very nice and the beds were the wonderfully comfortable Hilton beds. The pool was very well designed with lots of separate areas to provide some privacy and a great kids play area. Breakfast is included and was typical fare. We had lunch out by the pool, tasty but service was a little slow. Evening manager's reception with free drinks and snacks was nice. Golf course associated with the hotel had an interesting layout but wasn't in very good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Marsha H
Reviews.Content: We visited Dorado Del Mar for 4 nights to celebrate our anniversary and took our 3 children with us. We paid a great deal of money due to booking last minute- but we wanted a nice getaway since we have only done this once in the last 10 years. We normally love Embassy Suites and ONLY stay at that hotel when we travel, but was less then impressed with this specific hotel. The beach was public use and dirty/littered and the chairs were all over the place- the pictures on their website are not accurate AT ALL...it is full of rocks, NOT white sand, full of seaweed, and VERY small- be sure to take water shoes because after 5 minutes of standing in the water and on the beach the bottom of my feet were hurting! As guests of the hotel you had to wear wristbands - children included- to use the pool..however, there were TONS of people not wearing them and who were not guests of the hotel and no hotel staff were making them leave. The pool towel rental was ridiculous- towels had to be turned back in by 10:30 or a charge of $20 was added to your bill. Water coupons were given at check in but you only got 2 bottles of water per day! The managers reception was nice but the "bouncer" that monitored who went in to get drinks yelled at hotel guests to wait behind an invisisble line and if you crossed it you were told very nastily to step back. You could take food back up to your room from breakfast but variety was not as it usually is at other Embassy Suites- and cold- and there were signs all over the hotel that you need to be down to breakfast by 7am if you wanted a great breakfast- that if you came at 9am you would get a "busy" breakfast- for paying so much the entire time should be a great breakfast! Most hotel staff were ok, I heasitate to say friendly, but ONLY if you tipped them every time and for every thing. We found out the hard way, we when called down for extra towels and sheets and it took an hour for them to be sent up! Additionally,15% gratuity was added to EVERY bill we received from the hotel, regardless of what we ordered! We ordered an appetizer at the bar and after waiting an hour it finally came out, cold, and with the 15% gratuity all ready in the bill!! The resort fee is a JOKE! $17 extra dollars every day for things that at any other Embassy Suites would be included as part of your stay. Plus we asked for a partial ocean view room and were slapped with an extra $15 per day room fee for the "view" which overlooked apartments and if you were out on the balcony had the hotel's gererator running so loudly below you couldn't hold a conversation!! Dorado was convenient to San Juan but defintiely not a nice part of town!! Safety wise we made sure we were back in the resort before sun down. We regret our decision to stay in Dorado..if you want a GREAT family vacation (we took our 3 young children) go East from San Juan towards Farjardo- you'll get beautful beaches, great snorkeling, and the El Conquistator or Gran Melia resort slooked gorgeous and offered all inclusive deals- MUCH nicer and we wish we had stayed there, especially after spending SOOO much $$ on 4 nights! Thankfully, touring Old SanJuan and the El Yunque Rainforest made up for the disappointment in the hotel. Don't miss going to San Juan- it is definitely worth visiting!! We will travel back since it is was so easy to get to- we just will stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year at the Embassy Suites in Dorado Beach”
Reviews.Author: ptdmike
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay between Christmas and New Years day with my wife four daughters and my son in law. Great Hotel, Great Staff, (Marisol, all front desk and all service support team) Met all of our needs and felt perfectly safe. Gated Resort Area. Highly reccomend this hotel. It is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of San Juan but if you rent a car you can easily get around except for rush hour traffic. Plenty to do Zip Line tours, Beach, Golf, and casino. New Years Eve was awesome great party in Lobby or if you want you can pay for a party in the function room with great music and food. All followed by a Fireworks display outside the front door. Great Holiday vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Ahoberhol
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day visit in December. We had a very nice time, and the value for what we paid was outstanding. Breakfast was a plus, nice variety and it is complementary. Other pluses - very nice pool, nice scenery, great service on the pool deck, great daily happy hour, and an outstanding sushi and beni Hana style restaurant across the street. A less expensive restaurant on site would have been nice. Also one or two more things to keep kids entertained would be nice, like a miniature golf course or shuffleboard would have enhanced the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property-Inside Needs Work!”
Reviews.Author: DRODD1
Reviews.Content: Arrived a day early in preparation to depart on a cruise. The property is actually about a 45 minute drive from the airport (by taxi) and add an additional 15-20 minutes to the port. The staff is very friendly and the landscaping of the property is beautiful. The suites were a nice size (pleasantly surprised) but smelled moldy and the bathrooms/linens were not clean. The staff neglected to inform us that the oceanview rooms were almost impossible to get as members that have timeshares get first dibs, so although I requested the oceanview suite and/or pool view, I received a garden view room instead. Don't get me wrong...the view of the garden was OK, but it wasn't what I wanted. The rooms are exceptionally cold and there is "no heat". The receptions staff's only advice was to turn off the AC that was obviously left running all day and open the balcony door to warm the room up a bit. BTW, that didn't work out as well as I had hoped. We requested additional blankets and learned they did not have any additional blankets and when we ordered additional sheets instead, they were never delivered...only to learn that the reception staff had gone for the night leaving a security guard to try to assist us the best he could. Oh, and did I mention that as some of my party did not arrive at the hotel until past midnight, they arrived to no check in assistance either...and they had a confirmed reservation. The linens on the pull out sofa bed were filthy...we had to obtain additional sheets from the security guard to make up the bed for our children to sleep on. My teen boys were still not overly comfortable with the lack of cleanliness and they were cold. The food was so-so (and this was the consensus of all members in my party...me, my mother, father, husband, 2 sons, my brother and his wife), but we all agreed that we did love the grounds. Overall, I would say if you don't mind the cleanliness issue or the cold, distance from the airport/port, and somewhat moldy smelly rooms/hallways, this is a perfect place (for short stays). Although, the price was reasonable, I cannot say that I would ever stay at this resort again. Keep your expectations reasonable/low and you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Philly-Phoodies
Reviews.Content: About a half hour taxi from airport. Accommodating staff. Very reasonable prices available with nice value- free tickets for water bottles, free cocktails at happy hour- 5:30-7:30. Buffet breakfast with made to order omelet station. Free wifi. Nice pool and easy access to adequate beach. When extra towels and pillows were requested, were brought promptly. Across road from entrance was a surprisingly good Sushi restaurant with cooking on tables- most entertaining hibachi style we have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But !!!”
Reviews.Author: dteckie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights 12/6/11- 12/10/11 Hotel was nice, but security is questionable. Wife had her wallet stolen from room safe. She put wallet in safe upon arrival and never took it out till checkout it was gone. Remote possibility it may have fallen out but doubtful since we would have seen it on floor. Lost all her cash and credit cards and other important documents.put a damper on vacation. After coming home we found out that some hotel safes have a security default code of 0000#. If your hotel safe opens with this code do not use it. I wish we had known before using the safe . We reported loss to hotel staff but no results.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, View and Service”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee134
Reviews.Content: Our trip was to celebrate 25 years together. We stayed 12/12-18/11. The hotel was very nice and the staff so friendly, patient, and helpful. Everyone spoke English and was more than willing to offer suggestions, directions, etc. The lobby is very attactive and was decorated nicely for Christmas. It was kind of quiet and not too crowded until mid week. The pool/garden area is beautiful. The beach is a small private beach, but beautiful except for the debris along the rock walls. There are plenty of lounge chairs and towels are provided. The free breakfast provides a good variety of hot and cold selections; however, the food wasn't always very hot, and the meats were always over cooked/almost burnt and dry. The Manager's reception of free drinks and snacks was nice, but the same snacks (popcorn, pretzels, a prtezel/cracker mix, and chips and salsa) were served every night. We never used the fitness center, but it looked well equipped. The spa was never open, but we never inquired about it either. The garage was a little walk from the hotel entrance and got very busy/crowded in the evening from the Casino goers. The Casino was fair, but very cold and very lound when a band was playing. The golf course was overpriced, even with the hotel guest discount, as the greens are not well kept. It was fun to see all the iguana running around - they are as plentyful as squirrels in the states. We couldn't have asked for a better view from our room! We enjoyed the balcony; however, a small table would have been nice. The A/C never went below 70 no matter what it was set on. It would have been nice to have a ceiling fan in the bedroom, but the suite was very nice with lots of storage space, a wet bar, mini refrig and microwave. The refrig really kept our drinks cold, not like most hotel refrigerators. The bathroom was spacious with plenty of counter space and good lighting. The shower control was reversed, so when it was all the way on H for hot and cold, it worried me at first. Once we figured out it was reversed, it wasn't a problem for us. The suite was clean and comfortable with 2 flat screen TVs. The restaurant had a fair selection of foods, but would have liked a few less expensive choices. It would have also been nice if there were a food pantry in the gift shop, although the gift shop had plenty of toiletries, souveniers, junk food snacks (chips, candy, etc.) and drinks. The location is about 45 min west of San Juan and from the airport on the north side of the island. Most the tourist activities are on the east side of the island. It takes at least 4 hours to get from one end of the island to the other - lots of traffic. Overall, we were very happy with the hotel and our room. The view was exactly what we were hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Luis N. VÃ¡zquez, truly a 5 star Resort Manager”
Reviews.Author: william a
Reviews.Content: I'd like to compliment one of your Resort Managers, Luis Nazario VÃ¡zquez, for the excellent service he provided us during our stay. My family and I recently spent a week at the Aquarius Vacation Club, a time share resort located at the Embassy Suites in Dorado Puerto Rico. After having been a time share owner for over twenty years, I must admit I was initially disappointed with our choice. Upon our arrival, we upgraded from the studio efficiency we had booked to a larger room. Unfortunately, it was far from what we hoped for. The stove wasnâ€™t working, furniture appeared worn, and matteresses needed to be replaced. Suffice it to say, there were quite a few descrepancies. I quickly contacted ther front desk and asked to speak to the resort manager. Mr. Nazario was very pleasant during our conversation, and listened intently to what I had to say. He immediately made arrangements to have us moved from the sub par accomodation to a more comfortable dwelling - no questions asked. Apparently, he was more concerned that we have a great vacation. Mr. Nazario's professionalism and ability to resolve situation quickly exceeded my expectations. Not only did he upgrade my room that same day but was attentively to anything else my family and I might need. Such a commitment to great customer service is to be commended. You can be sure that I will continue to do business with the Aquarius Vacation Club in the coming years. Mr. Nazario is truly a 5 star manager and an asset to the resort! Sincerely, William Acevedo

Reviews.Title: “Fun, relaxing, pleasant staff. Great hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Jrosado5rx7
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at an Embassy suites in DC for the first time recently and really enjoying it, I decided to see if the chain had a hotel in Puerto Rico. To my amazement, I found the Embassy Suites Dorado online through Travelocity. This was a last minute trip. I was celebrating my 20th anniversary and needed to get away. Upon arrival the staff at the front desk was cordial and professional at their duties. The positives were; + Great price for what you get. + Excellent service and friendly staff. + Great adult drink service at the nightly manager's reception. + Clean rooms and common areas. + Clean pool area. + Friday and Saturday live entertainment + Local artisans on ground selling Puerto Rican souvenirs and candy. + Excellent breakfast with many food options. + Casino on site. + Close proximity to beach. + Beautiful grounds, especially in the evenings while listening to the Coqui frog. + Shallow pool for the kids to play in. Some negatives... - Loud outdoor cooling fans - Parking at the local garage frustrating at the beginning as it was not explained properly. - Local beach could use some TLC Recommendations... * Add local foods to the breakfast options such as platanos, tajadas and empanadillas * Provide guest with tourist information of what Puerto Rico has to offer. I didn't see any brochures. * Offer better snack selection at the manager's reception instead of eating popcorn, pretzels and gold fish every night. Overall.... The place was great but could certainly be better. There are many short trips guest can take to visit great places like El Morro in Old San Juan, Bacardi Factory, Arecibo Observatory, Arecibo caverns, Utuado Taino Indian Ceremonial grounds and many others. These are all less than 2 hours away. I will certainly be back in a few months to enjoy the Embassy Suites again with my family. One more thing.... I grew up as a poor kid not far away from the resort area. Having returned after 30 years and seeing my old neighborhood was emotional for me and pleasing at the same time. Thank you Embassy Suites for providing a good value, entertainment and a memorable experience for me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: ed1788
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend staying here on a trip to PR. The location near the beach is very nice; however, it is off the beaten path and tour companies will not pick you up here. Your only option is to rent a car. The car rental place is only open 8 am to 5 pm. The food is awful and there are no good restaurants on the property. At night, there is loud music streaming in the lobby until late at night. You can hear loud music and clapping in the rooms. You can definitely find somewhere of better quality for the same price in PR.

Reviews.Title: “Thx for continue the very good service”
Reviews.Author: andreas_schuck
Reviews.Content: When I made my schedule for my trip to Puerto Rico, I was looking forward already to get booked into that place again. I feel really good and cared here. I enjoy the view out of my room and the hospitality of that hotel. The people behave nice and the housekeeping does a very good job. Since I travel really a lot, I am able to compare the places and I have to admit that this hotel is one of my favorite spots to stay within America. I read the reviews here of others. Sure, everyone has different requirements but it is a Golf and Beach resort so of course there is nothing around and you will need a rental car to get somewhere.Â  About the reviews I read about the restaurant. I just paid $58 for a few shrimps, two beer and a steak. Sure it sounds pricey but the food is good and healthy and you enjoy the environment and entertainment so you shouldn't expect that they charge you like McDonalds. I want to thanks the hotel staffs and look forward to be back the week after Thanks Giving.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: kgstevens
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort because it looked nice in pictures and I thought it would be nice to stay away from the city "stuff" of San Juan. I reserved a king suite, and though I brought my printed reservations, I was told that they couldn't accomodate my reservation. Instead they said they could give me an "upgrade" as compensation. I got a partial oceanview, which could be seen by leaning out over my balcony railing (NOT safe though, as the railing was loose in places.) We then got to sleep in a double bed which was uncomfortable, so we had to sleep apart... When I walked by the front desk, they actually asked me if I liked my "upgraded" room. I told them that I was not impressed and explained why, but never did they offer to relocate us. I have stayed at numerous Embassy resorts, but this one was by far the worst and I don't believe they should have a 3 star rating in service, cleanliness, breakfasts, upkeep, etc. The room had a foul odor and was not cleaned well throughout. They had a nice pool and we enjoyed the iguanas on our evening walk by the golf course. Other than that, it was not a good resort. I would not recommend anyone staying here. I know we won't again. If you choose to stay here, check your bill carefully. I was mischarged and though they eventually fixed it, it was the frosting on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “no surprises”
Reviews.Author: sunshinelover_11
Reviews.Content: Room's okay (large,clean but poorly decorated), pool's okay, breakfast is okay( beach is less than okay) , service is okay. Shortage of personnel in the spa is a given (two people for all spa services: manicures,pedicures,massages). The only better than average thing about this hotel it's cozy size. You won't need to walk for more than 3 minutes to reach the elevator, the pool, the garage or the restaurant. Check in and check out is a breeze. We had no time to experience nighttime ambiance as we were in a meeting that had it's own parties; but on halloween night, no special activity was going on on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place and very good care of staffs and house keeping!”
Reviews.Author: andreas_schuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed now a couple times at the Embassy Suites there and I am very pleased every time with the room, value and surrounding there. The b'fast is amazing and the Bar a good meeting point. I will return in November there and look already forward to it. Thank you for a very easy and relaxing environment.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Stay, Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BT1_Tanner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Dorado for 2 weeks in September. The staff is very professional and attentive to the needs of the quest. The Embassy Hotel and surrounding grounds are kept in very good order. The restaurant serves really good food and the service is great. The complimentary breakfast is better than I could describe. I even attended a special event hosted by the hotel for their 10th anniversary and met the hotel manager, Marisol Colon, she is very dedicated to the satisfaction of the quest and emanates a welcoming experience. I look forward to returning for business.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Best toddler beach and pool”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M
Reviews.Content: My 2 year old really enjoyed the pool (zero depth zone and kiddie pool) along with the protected beach. With steps between the pool and beach it was no problem to visit both several times during each day. The staff was friendly and helpful (sometimes getting the question across in english was a little difficult). A great place to take small children for an enjoyable time at pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: bigdcobia
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Tues Sept 27th thru Sat Oct 1st and had a great time. The room was very nice with the exception of the couch sleeper bed...The mattress was about 2' thick and you could feel every bar thru it. but then again I have never slept on a comfortable sleeper bed. (made the kids sleep on it he he ) The daily free breakfast was excellent, the managers reception for 2 hrs was also great. Try the red snapper in the restaurant it is awesome. Played a little in the casino on the slots, played $.40 a pull penny slots and made $20 last almost an hour so not bad. If you are going to old San Juan take the Ferry trip over and save the driving. Traffic is horrible near and in San Juan. The front desk has great directions preprinted for all the great attractions and the Ferry. in old San Juan there is a free trolly that takes you all around the Forts etc. The rain forest was excellent, the Bacardi tour was cool. Had a great time. Thanks to the hotel staff for the extra pillows and towels as we where a party of 5. I would recommend this resrot to all!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: hilsman
Reviews.Content: I have been to this property 5 times over the the past 6 years for 4-5 day stays. It is the perfect place to go and just relax. The pool is always inviting and the poolside resteraunt is excellent. I love their signature red snapper. The beach is rocky and is just so so. Breakfast is great, like most emabassy suites. It is attached to a timeshare that has use of the resorts pool so there are alaot of locals at the pool. It is a fantastic hotel but it is beginning to need some updates.

Reviews.Title: “made businees trip great”
Reviews.Author: cttraveler51
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the embassy dorado during Tropical Storm Irene. We did loose power for a day or so but survived well. Putting Irene aside Embassy Dorado rates up there with other Embassy ive stayed. The pool and beach in Dorado is great, of course the managers coctail hour each evening made Irene tolerable. I would recommend Dorado to couples and families looking for a place to stay and no have to leave unless you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “A nice quiet spot off San Juan”
Reviews.Author: michel_josee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy suite Dorado while travelling for a business trip. The rooms very very large and all well located with an ocean view, they have nice pool outside, the beach is small but cosy and very clean and protected from big waves bay a small wall of stones...very nice spot next to a golf club - sushi restaurant next to the hotel is fantastic. I told myself what a nice spot for a winter break with my teenagers and husband - about 20 min drive from downtown San Juan...

Reviews.Title: “The Best Experience”
Reviews.Author: Anthony H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truely Grand, we enjoyed our stay, everone one was wounderful, clean rooms, clean hotel, great food, and grounds, the location has easy access to San Juan and Carolina PR. I give this hotel 5 Stars...on my next visit this is where I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: HokieComm
Reviews.Content: We chose the Embassy Suites for a family trip in early May largely because of the value it offers. With the great breakfast they include, it allowed us to keep food costs down...as we generally ate only two meals a day. The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful, especially with advice on activities on the island as well as good local restaurants. They provided great service as far as room maintainence and in the restaurants. The only place we has any disappointments from a service perspective was at the outdoor bar. I felt like the food at that bar, especially the alcohol, was really over-priced. But, you can make up for that with the Manager's Reception each evening. The pool has a lot of space around it to relax and there's a nice-sized beach area. But, it you're looking for waves, you won't get them, as the beach is in a man-made cove. The only real downside we had at the hotel was something that I really can't blame them for. We checked in on a Friday in early May and, it turns out, that is Junior High Prom time. Friday and Saturday nights there were kids running everywhere and tying up the elevators. But, once we got passed breakfast on Sunday, they were gone and things couldn't have been nicer. Don't let the looks of the in-house restaurant fool you. It doesn't have a traditional look as it's housed in the breakfast area. The food we had for dinners was as good as any we had on the trip. We especially enjoyed trying some of the native dishes. Dorado is a great place to get away from the huslte and bustle of a big city...we were about a 35-45 minute drive from downtown San Juan. We also took a couple of trips to the Farjardo area for scuba diving and other activities...it was less than 2 hours and didn't feel like a long drive. We would stay here again in a heart-beat. But, would probably avoid a May weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel served the purpose quite well”
Reviews.Author: readingpa
Reviews.Content: As Hilton Honors members we considered to stay with either Hilton Caribe, El Conquistador or Embassy Suites Dorado and decided for the last one which served us for our purposes quite well. Easy access to pool and beach (good for small kids) even though not top notch but reasonable. We used the hotel as base for day trips throughout the island. The staff was at all times very nice and helpful. When we arrived and got to our room we smelled mildew we immediately informed the front desk and they gave us another room without hesitation (thanks, Peter). The breakfast is good as we knew it from other Embassy locations. A little bit annoying was the fact that the multi-level parking facility was some hundred yards away (behind the small casino). All in all we would recommend this hotel and we would use it again when traveling to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, did not Love the location”
Reviews.Author: MAbelini
Reviews.Content: Overall - very happy with our choice for price and quality. We are a family of 5, with kids aged 20,18 and 16. Most hotels won't allow 5 in a room - the suites do and also offer a free breakfast, so financially this made the most sense for us. Rooms: Very clean, soft, comfy beds. Our room was on the 6th floor and was upgraded to partial ocean view - gorgeous view from balcony. Living area had TV, pullout coach, eating tables/chairs and kitchen area.The pullout coach was okay for comfort -not as comfortable as 2 doubles. Mini-fridge, microwave, sink, tea bags, hot chocolate and coffee provided. Bedroom had TV, 2 dbl beds. A/C good in both areas. Bathroom clean and good size. In-room safe and enough storage for luggage. 5 adult sized people fit well. Housekeeping was timely for regular cleaning, however we had to request twice the first night for the sheets etc to make up the pullout coach before they delivered them around 11:30 and I left notes for extra towels each day and were never given any. Lobby: check in was quick. Good English skills at the front desk. Beautiful lobby with 3 glass elevators, water features, plants - lovely. No specific concierge at own desk - had to use front desk employees instead - directions to places were somewhat sketchy (bring GPS!! bring maps!) Business room had 2 computers with printers/fax/- all free. Used it to print boarding passes and info on tours - very helpful, no one else in there. Resort fee for us was $20 daily. Breakfast: On weekend, it was extremely crowded in the hotel and they set up extra food stations to cut down on lines. On weekdays, it was much quieter and they had the one made-to-order food station, one dry cereal station, one drink station (juices, water, milk, coffee, hot water), one bakery (toast, bagels,danishes). On the slow moving made-to-order station, you could get made to order eggs, and already in warmers - scrambled eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon,yogurt, cantaloupe, apples, grapefruits, & hot oatmeal. Food was plentiful and tasty. Would have liked more variety of local fresh fruits. Hard to get our kids up by 9:30 on the weekdays to get down to breakfast. Are requested to eat in dining area and not to bring food up to rooms. At check-in, each room is given tickets for 2 water bottles per day - great for outings - get them outside at the Sea Horse so they will be cold. Pool/Beach - The pool area had lots of chairs, a nice snack/bar-SeaHorse. Was a lovely free-form pool with different sections separated by small waterfalls. A small kids area and climbing structure on the side for little ones. Towels could be signed out for the day easily. We were not as happy with the beach.The water was not raked for seaweed, so after going into the water a short distance you were walking amid seaweed. This was not the clear aqua waters you expect in the Caribbean. But Water was delightfully warm and we did use the beach, but it wasn't beautiful expansive sand/water like in Isla Verde. There were 2 stone jetties keeping the area nearly enclosed and waves to a minimum (we like big waves). Beach lounge chairs are set up & free on the sand (big plus) and you could rent paddle boats or kayaks. Golf course and casino- we did not use either, But walked about the golf course because it is full of iguanas & ducks and I got lots of photos of iguanas sunning themselves - very cool! Parking: Self park is $10+tax a day in a garage a short walk away. Easy to access though. The driveway into Embassy Suites & several villa/condos is long and gated like many places in PR. Location: This was the only real negative of the Embassy Suite Dorado. We spent 2 days in the Fajardo/ El Yunque area - minimum 1 1/2 hour drive each way to this area. We ALWAYS got lost - even with our GPS - easy to miss exits. So, we did not get to do/see as much as we wanted because our travel time was so great. We did drive to Isla Verde one afternoon to swim on their gorgeous beaches, but we couldn't find any public rooms to change in, so had to use hotel's bathroom... at busier times this might be difficult. The Bacardi tour is only about 15 minutes though from the hotel and there is convenient ferry to Old San Juan from there - so that is a plus. Can' imagine staying in Puerto Rico without a rental car. In the immediate area, there are many fast food chains and several PR dining places - but would be along walk. Summary- wonderful hotel, priced reasonably especially for 5, but lot of travel time to see other areas of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Not like it seems”
Reviews.Author: Megan O
Reviews.Content: The people we were with made this better then it really was. Each staff member was rude or confused when asked questions. We would ask about taxis and it took 15 minutes to get a simple answer. There isn't any options for food so you're stuck. The golf course is not associated with the hotel and across the street. If you are going to see the island this hotel is away from any sights. If you rent a car they charge for parking and you have to use them because there isn't any other option. The pool is nice and the hotel is on the beach but what they fail to mention is that the hotel is also part timeshare and they are allowed to use the pool so it gets very crowded. The fitness center is also used by the timeshares and the equipment is broken. They only good thing was the free breakfast and drinks and the managers special.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property and Service”
Reviews.Author: Mychael67
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the wonderful staff at the Embassy! The property is beautiful, our room was clean and fresh and the food was excellent. Breakfast is perfect, delicious...and what a variety!! We love the Manager's Happy Hour! Kid friendly. We enjoyed the large pool with day and night swimming while the pool lights changed the waters color. The Casino was a fun addition to the trip. Won some...lost some...bat had a good time. We love the Embassy...we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: I was just reading some of these reviews, and am very surprised at the negative comments. I have never stayed at an Embassy Suites which I didn't enjoy. First if you are looking for a good beach area, Dorado in general is not it! These realy arent swimming type beaches, go a bit further south. The young man that greeted us for our car was very friendly. The man at the desk, Israel C. was very warm and attentive, our room was not ready when we arrived, so we left our bags and went to tour the Bacardi Rum DIstillery which is about 20 minutes away! We were called on our cell phone about an hour later to tell us our room was ready. When we returned we went up to our room, the door didn't work properly, but was fixed in about 20 minutes, all very quickly and personably. The beach is nice for sitting, listening to, and day dreaming. The pool is a large area, and the children's area of the pool was very busy. The wine/drink hour was very nice, usual type fare for the Embassy. I was happy with everything I experienced and saw. I loved the beds at this property!! There is a casino which recently opened just outside the Embassy and that was fun! The morning breakfast was the usual fare, omelets, cereals, juices, etc. All very well maintained, and good service. There was nothing to complain about. We did valet parking, the young man got our car, and we were on our way about 10 minutes after we checked out! A very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Golf Resort - Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: boysmomVa
Reviews.Content: How disappointed we were with this Embassy Suites property. I've always had extremely positive experiences at Embassy Suites hotels, but this one failed. It was beyond capacity and totally understaffed. We had to wait to check-in, wait for the manager's reception, wait for breakfast and then listen to kids running through the halls all hours of the night. We found that the only time to go to the pool was about 9am. We actually cut our stay short, when packs of youth baseball leagues invaded the hotel for the weekend - unbelievable. Here's one of my son's impressions: One word. CROWDED! I guess it was just a bad first impression, but I checked in, had to wait an hour for my room to be cleaned, then, once I got outside, the place was PACKED! If you wanted go into the pool and get sunburned, you couldn't. It appeared that you couldn't even make it down the steps of the pool, because the kids were just chilling there, despite the fact that the whole thing was pretty shallow. Anyways, I sat in the lobby until 5:30 when the Manger's Reception occurred. At that point I went and got some popcorn, which there was no line for. There was however, a line for the free drinks. A big line. If you've ever been in an Embassy Suites lobby, you'll know that it's huge. And the line stretched the whole way through. That night, I did manage to make it into the pool, when it was less crowded. I slept well, I guess. The only problem was that there were some people down in the lobby who probably had one too many drinks. The room quality was good, and the bathrooms were quality. Anyways, the next day, I had a delicious breakfast of pancakes and bacon and what was possibly mango juice. I never really found out, since I'm not exactly fluent in Spanish. I quickly jumped in the pool, which wasn't crowded yet. I made a day trip out to the Arecibo Observatory to get away from the crowds. I came back and enjoyed the popcorn at the Manager's Reception again, and only then did I realize the reason the facilities were so crowded! The pools and beach( which I did not use) were also shared with the Aquarius Timeshares! My family and I made a snap decision and decided to leave the next day. And I'm glad we did. Because right then 4 baseball teams showed up, and made more noise. I was able to go in the pool and relax a bit again that night, but it was still a bit crowded. I left the next morning after another pool visit, and I was kind of glad I left. Again: One word: CROWDED!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Txgirl9226
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Dorado last week of July. We had a great time. We were very satisfied with this hotel.
