I chose it because it had a seperate bedroom since we were traveling with two teen sons. They slept on the couch. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were very soft. We had oceanfront and the view was amazing. It was great to sit out on the balcony with a pina colada. I wish the rail was a little higher cause it blocked my water view but can't control that. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. The front desk staff seem to have everything you might need. If you need directions to any of the attractions, they pull out this little box and give you a small card with printed directions. I asked for those a couple of times to Fajardo and also to the rainforest. I even forgot my razor and they gave me one. The breakfast buffet was also nice. Get there early or the omelette line gets long. Otherwise you can just get the regular buffet. The beach is nice and clean. The water is green and clear. However there is alot of seaweed so you are limited at how far you can go in. If you want a really nice beach nearby go west to Cerro Gordo. You can even snorkel there. It was perfect. The pool was very nice but a little shallow. It's only 3'6" at the deepest so my sons were a little bored. It is very big and is usually full but if you just like to sit and relax then it's perfect. I didn't use the golf course but it looked very beautiful and you can actually see iguanas when you drive by. It was so cool! The casino was nice. Small but just big enough to take all my money. :) The parking garage is behind the casino so you have to walk a little to get to the hotel unless you want to pay $18 for valet. The Asian restaurant onsite was very good. We paid $100 for 4 (without alcohol). I had a great time at this hotel and would love to come back. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT Return”
Reviews.Author: dot11do
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations very last minute and they continued to mess them up. We had 3 rooms for diffrent days and they finally got it right but two couples had to share the last night because they cancelled our reservation. The SERVICE was awful!! We were not able to take advantage of the spa as they were understaffed. The staff made no apologies....One of the three elevators was down and so getting to and from your room was a nightmare. Breakfast was completly unorganized.....I not sure if its the hotel or the entire island as we stayed in three diffrent places on teh island and the service was the same AWFUL! The pool was filthy Imean REALLY REALLY dirty. We had kids running up and down the hall all night and when I informed the front desk he shrugged his shoulders and said sorry! UGH! REALLY!! The positive beds were comfy, breakfast was good, the view was amazing and teh casino was decent.....I will say the staff at the casino were the only bright spot to this property.....the pit staff were friendly and amazing!! We won't be returning to PR.....My husband is from teh island and was very dissapointed at our overall expierence also. The best part of PR is the food!! It was delicious NO MATTER where you ate side of the road or 5 star eatery!!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par for Hilton family resort”
Reviews.Author: monsieurlatour
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly typical Embassy Suites hotel, but not what I am accustomed to with Hilton family resorts. The staff was friendly, but overwhelmed by the crowds. The tennis and golf facilities are shabby and seriously in need of maintenance. We were so disappointed we checked out and went to the Waldorf Astoria El Conquistador in Fajardo for 3 nights, then to the Caribe Hilton in San Juan for 2 nights. Both had much more to offer. I highly recommend either of those resorts instead, or the El San Juan or Hilton Ponce which we also looked at and found to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with lots of perks”
Reviews.Author: Viajera172705
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children (ages 8 and 10) stayed here for 5 nights over spring break. We absolutely loved the wonderful breakfast! The food was delicious! I didn't expect such an elaborate selection of breakfast items when I booked the hotel. All of the staff members that we encountered during our stay were fabulous. We also enjoyed "happy hour" with the complimentary drinks and snacks -- added bonus! The lobby is very nice with lots of seating and a glass elevator. Our room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The carpet was a little outdated, but not a big deal. We rented a car while we were there, and the parking garage was nice and close. The nice young men outside greeted us each time we entered the resort. The beach is not the greatest on this side of Puerto Rico, but the pool makes up for that. There were some shady young people on the beach one night who were not from the resort that wandered up to the towel station (which made me a little nervous as my children were near there), but security escorted them back to the beach and they were on their way. The food in the restaurant was great. I tried a plantain for the first time, and it tasted wonderful. I would definitely stay in this resort again!

Reviews.Title: “What a trashy dump!”
Reviews.Author: monti25
Reviews.Content: I vacation with my wife and kids to the carribean twice a year and got bad advise to stay here. If you like beaches without seaweed and rocks you need to be near San Juan Ocean park or East side of the island, and no where near Dorado. The rooms and beds are very nice and comfortable, but the beach connected to the hotel has tons of seaweed and rocks. You have to pay a 12% room tax and 10 dollars to park a car in the overcrowded parking garage connected to the casino! Yes, they truck in old timers and the hotel and casino gets packed. The restraunts are too small and have huge lines in the morning, plus the food is limited and yuk! Cons: Beach has seaweed and everyone cluttered the clean area. 1 beer is 8 dollars Pools too small and no swim up bars! No tourist desk to suggest where to go. If you speak central or south american spanish you wont' be able to understand their spanish slang! My wife is from Central America and she couldnt get directions! They don't pernounce their S. so if you want to say 3 it is tre not tres! Cracks bags on the beach! Trash on the beach and it is very small. Food is expensive in their restraunts. I paid 100 dollars without booze for 3 people! Parking is bad 1-2 hours to San Juan that is if you beat the traffic! pros nice rooms and comfortable beds. Staff is very nice golf course and casino

Reviews.Title: “IF U THINK DETAILS MAKES THE DIFFERENCE, YOU MUST READ THIS!”
Reviews.Author: VictorPr
Reviews.Content: This is how my rating system works: 0 = poor, 5 = excellent Bathroom clean? = ................ 5 â€¦pure white....i love it. Staff friendly & helpful =......... 5 Room layout = ........................5 â€¦.the suite layout super & came with 2 tvâ€™s Parking = .................................5 .. Parking is very near to hotel & multi level so ur car is always cool!!! Breakfast buffet & beach = ...5â€¦..both items gr8 Pool = .......................................3â€¦ Urgently need â€œpool umbrellasâ€�. I found a priceless shade under a palm but when i realized 5 families were basically over us , come on! Security = ...................................0, yes a 0â€¦there were some guest looking dangerours(doubtful reputation) and only a super skinny guard walks by ocassionaly. Recommendations: 1.To place â€œpool umbrellasâ€� across the pool area so people wonâ€™t be fighting for a shade 2.Proper security guard must be hired so guest feel secure. No excuses specially during summer time. To those in future providing your reviews kindly care to comment in these 2 recomendations as we need to keep a 'healty pressure' over hotel management which we all have seen she is reading this and hopefully this is taken care of this.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined all other hotel choices...Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: KooKoohead
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best my wife and I have ever stayed in!! The staff was so friendly and polite is was as if we were in a dream. The rooms were always cleaned daily and the service was prompt and courteous. The food was delicious,the drinks were fabulous and service was always with a smile. The beach and pool area were breathtaking and pictures do not show the full beauty only paradise can describe. Next year,we might even bring the kids....maybe not!!! This should be everyones once in a lifetime.....

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation resort!”
Reviews.Author: charl0tte86
Reviews.Content: These was the best vacations so far. I always read the reviews before I make my decitions on where to stay and this one didn't let me down. The hotel is clean and fresh, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and for the price is everything I wanted and more. The breakfast every morning was excellent and the afternoon coctail was a very nice touch. Makes feel the guest welcome and that they are thinking about their experience. The rooms are very nice, big and clean. Defenetly coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “After staying here, I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Timbo1978
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a relaxing vacation. For our first two days we stayed at the conquistador in Fajardo. Then, we came to the Embassy in Dorado. There is no comparison. The Embassay was head and shoulders above the conquistador for my money. The pool, the beach, and the amenities were far superior. I had a great time, and I would reccomend that anyone going to Puerto Rico should stay there. In the future it will be my first hotel choice for a Puerto Rican vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: mochocoly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel on business. Everything was nice,and the staff was very friendly from the Valet attendant, front desk staff, housekeeping. Has Laundry facilities on the premises that was very convenient. The pool area and the beach front are beautiful , too bad I did not get to enjoy them as I had too little time to enjoy the amenities. The only complain I have is the access to the area through the security gate . I finally got a " "Guest" sign for my car " 2 days after I checked in that gave me faster access at the gate . Management should look into a better system .( Check Marriott Hotels Miami Airport South in Miami ) . I would definitely stayed again at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff”
Reviews.Author: obapwn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Del Mar in Dorado, Puerto Rico for 4 nights at the end of March. We consider ourselves to be experienced travelers. We have never encountered hotel staff, from the front desk to the wait staff, to the house cleaning staff, who were as friendly and courteous as these people were. There was nothing "put on" about how we were treated. During our stay, the hotel was flooded by extraordinary rainfall. The rain storm caused the pools to be shut down and closed the golf course. Through all of the difficulty, the staff of this hotel performed brilliantly.

Reviews.Title: “the most welcome and beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lansky61
Reviews.Content: The decor and grounds were amazing and clean. The rooms were fantastic and had the most comfortable beds ever. The staff were all smiling, happy and helpful. The free continental breakfast was well organized and satisfied every craving with delicious food. The Happy Hour (which was actually 2 hours) was a great time and limitless drinks on the house. The location was a short 15 minute walk into town to the nearest stores and shopping. Quite far from the cruise terminal but definitely worth the $60 cab ride from the airport and to the cruise terminal. All in all, the best place I have stayed in for a long time

Reviews.Title: “Best in Puerto Rico!!”
Reviews.Author: bluegrasspirate
Reviews.Content: As an independent travel agent I have been to many resorts in my time, but I have to tell you ,Embassy Suites Dorado Del Mar is indeed special! My wife and I have just returned from Puerto Rico staying April 6-15. The staff at this resort is by far their best feature. I can go on and on with the names of staff that made our vacation so wonderful that I know I would leave someone out ,but the following personnel need to be commended : I have been told that the first 6 seconds you meet someone it has a lasting impression that takes a long time to overcome if it is a negative one. This definitely not the case at the Embassy Suites Dorado. When we rode down the lane to the resort and were met and greeted by Juan Carlos Ramos; he made you feel like you were relatives coming home to visit! His help and positive attitude all week were beyond any bell captain I have seen. There were other visitors staying there that expressed these same feelings to me as well. Other staff that stood out and deserve accolades are Garry Rodriquez, Lisa Negron, those at the golf course, those serving in Paradise Restaurant, Happy Hour workers, and like I said ,many more at the resort! So, as you can tell, I think the quality , helpfulness, and friendliness of the staff, in which they all work multiple dutie ,ranks the highest in my opinion!! Next, the grounds are immaculate! I can walk out the front door and play golf on one of the most beautiful and challenging golf courses in Puerto Rico. I could walk out the back entrance and lounge on a beautiful beach or the infinity swimming pool which is perfectly landscaped! Also on the property, there is a new casino for those gaming types that wish to put down a wager. The Blue Seahorse Grill is by the swimming pool and you can get any type drink or food you desire. It is like you really do not have to leave the property if you do not want to ; it is all right here. The large rooms are very clean and are taken care of daily! I can go on forever about the service, but the staff here are worker bees and so friendly to go with it. 2 Plasma tvs in the suites, mini bar, closet space, great beds and tremendous view on the 6th floor!! What can I say? As you can see, I cannot say enough positive things about this place ! I can say this though, that I enjoyed my stay here so much! It exceeded my expectations and when I come back to Puerto Rico again, God wiling, I will be staying at the Embassy Suites Dorado Del Mar and you can count on it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mylo5765
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fun filled week in Puerto Rico. The Embassy Suites Dorado was a wonderful place to stay. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. I wasn't sure if staying here was a great decision or not when I made the reservation, but once we got there and explored San Juan I was glad we were out of town and in Dorado. There are lots of restaurants and shops right out side the hotel. That is a great benefit as we drove a couple of times to the other side of the island to the Rain Forest and Bio Bay tour and the driving was horrible and almost ruined our trip. So if you rent a car, be careful. This is a great resort for families. My daughter is 11 and an only child and she made several friends. We really enjoyed the manager's reception each evening as we would chat with the other families we met at the resort and talk about what we did that day and share tips. Overall, great place to stay if you don't mind driving 1 1/2 hours to the rainforest and Fajardo. TIPS: Take the ferry to Old San Juan. Also, drive to the Bacardi factory for a free tour. It is close to the hotel and would be great to visit if it is raining. Try the two restaurants right down from the hotel on a culdesac at Dorado beach. Both were close and had great food.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Resort that keeps me coming back”
Reviews.Author: ProudMommy4evr
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Puerto Rico with my husband and young children (ages 9 and 6). We were going to be in Puerto Rico for only 5 days, and just HAD to stay at the Embassy Suites in Dorado, again! Our prior stay was short and sweet, and we vowed to come back again. The drive from San Juan airport to Dorado is about 30 - 45 minutes depending on traffic conditions. There is a $1.00 toll if you take route 22 west to Dorado. The resort is located in the beautiful town of Dorado, within a gated community. Once you approach the security gate, they verify your purpose in entering the private community. Once passed the security gate, you drive through the beautiful golf course. You have the option to choose valet ($18 daily) or self parking ($10daily). The parking garage is located just steps from the hotel main entrance. There's a casino located between the hotel and parking garage. Our check in was a little slow due to the fact that the phones were constantly ringing and only one person working the front desk. They validate your parking ticket on the first day for your entire stay, so that you can come and go as you please for the one $10 per day parking fee. The Resort is very clean, and well maintained. Our room was on the second floor, and even though we were just above ground level, we had a great partial view of the ocean. Our room was very clean and well lit. We had only one king size bed, and a pull out sofa bed for the kids. There are two flat screen TVs in the suite, one mini refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave. On our first night, we drove to a town called Aguadilla which is located on the west end of the island, and its about a 2 hour drive with a handful of tolls, none being more than about $1.00 On our second day, we enjoyed the amenities of the resort, which included the 3 pools, kids play area and water sports. The pool was very clean, and well maintained. It is a heated pool which made it even better!!! The resort gives all there guest tickets for two free water bottles per day for the entire stay. You also get a daily bracelet that you must wear to identify you as a guest of the hotel while using the pool. My husband rented a small padel boat for $15 (30 minutes) which is enough time. The beach is very clean, and with no waves (safe for kids) Every night the 5:30pm - 7:30pm, the resort holds a managers reception in which you can get free drinks and snacks for everyone. Drinks include a variety of liquor and beer. The snacks include popcorn and tortilla chips with salsa. Drinks are unlimited during this two hour reception. We always tipped the bartender as a nice gesture. During our stay we had a terrible rainstorm sweep over Dorado, causing a lot of flooding which affected the resort pool and laundry facilty in the lower level. As a result, the pool was shut down from Tuesday night til about Friday afternoon. The Resort arranged FREE trolley tours of Dorado for those guest that were inconvenienced. We dined at the hotel restaurant on the night of the heavy rainstorm, because of the severe local flooding conditons. I have to admit, that I a little disappointed with our waiter because of the poor service we received and the over priced food. There's a local restaurant within walking or driving distance of the resort which sells PuertoRican cuisine that is very delicious, and very inexpensive. We dined there on our last trip to Dorado and so we had to go again during this trip. Breakfast was excellent throughout our stay, a wide selection of choices and omelletes made to order. Check out process was quick and easy. You pay the Resort fee and any room charges incurred during your stay. (ex: dining, water sports, bar charges, parking, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Family value hotel with terrific golf”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomcom
Reviews.Content: My teen and tweens liked that our room was actually 2 rooms - felt like more space. Incredible view of the ocean. The free cook-to-order breakfast was a huge hit and they loved the pool cafe & golf course. The first manager's reception was terrific - chips & salsa but after that they served cheap Costco type pretzel mix. We did not find the beach that enticing - small and rough but nice to look at. Love the local crafts sold in the lobby. The gym is gorgeous and clean, the staff is wonderful and the hotel restaurant is expensive but authentic and delish. Dinner at their new Japanese restaurant was entertaining and food was good but service and sushi need work. The location is remote so you need a car or plan to spend big bucks on cabs. A small town area is within walking distance where you will find Baskin Robbins, CVS, Walgreens and Martin's mafungo. They just opened a casino **We were guests of this hotel**

Reviews.Title: “resting in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: clearfieldtoothpullr
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went for a few days during her college break. The hotel is beautiful and the staff great. The general manager, Marisol Colon was extremely helpful. We wanted to go scuba diving and she had one of her staff Eddie Rivera arrange this for us. They really went out of their way. The hotel is not convenient to San Juan so we rented a car to use to and from the airport and for local driving. The traffic into San Juan is crazy and we didn't want to deal with it. Now if you are interested in scuba diving this isn't the hotel to stay at. I did not realize this at the time but it is a real trek to go. It took 2 1/2 hours each way to get to the dive boat. The hotel is wonderful for a relaxing stay at the beach but not well located for other options. Breakfasts are great and the happy hours excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzptaylor
Reviews.Content: We transferred to the Dorado Embassy Suites after a disappointing stay at another hotel and the Embassy Suites rescued our vacation. The rooms are clean an spacious and the property has a beautiful three tiered pool, kids pool, kids play area and beach access. This property lived up to traditional Embassy Suites standards. While encompassed in its own little golf resort and casino area, there are numerous restaurants (fast food, sports bar and nicer restaurants) less than a 5 minute drive from the property. Downtown Dorado is a neat little town. I would also recommend a nicer restaurant called Morena, which is a nicer restaurant located within a 5 or so minute drive from the hotel. The only downside is that it is set so far back from "the main drag" that you can't really walk to any of these restaurants/things to do - it would be a rather lengthy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax with your family”
Reviews.Author: Joe451
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for our Feb school vacation. We had a great time and really enjoyed the hotel. It is in a gated community, and seemed very secure. They have a casino that we walked past, but didnâ€™t use. Some reviews complained about parking, but they now have a very nice garage with plenty of spaces. The 3 things we like best about Embassy Suites are the Suites, the breakfast, and the evening cocktails. All 3 delivered. The suite was big enough for the 4 of us (couple and 2 teenage sons). The hotel was very clean and in good shape. The balcony was great. Only had 2 chairs, but there was plenty of room for 4 when we brought out 2 of the dinette chairs. The maid service was a little slow, but thet eventually cleaned our room and brought fresh towels every day. The breakfast was very busy over the Presidents Day weekend. Donâ€™t believe the comments about 45 min waits. The longest we waited for omelets was 20 min and that was only once. After the holiday weekend, the wait was 5-10 min. The breakfast was good (your typical Embassy Suites breakfast). They could have a better selection of fresh fruit. In a tropical location, it was a little disappointing. The evening reception was fine. Again the lines were long on the holiday weekend (10-15 min). The rest of the week it was 0-5 min. The drinks were good (beer, wine, and medium level liquor). Donâ€™t expect Dom Perignon or single malt scotch. The also have soda and juice. The food was very basic (chips & Salsa and popcorn) The pool area was great. It has a large general pool and smaller kiddie pool. The main pool is actually 3 sections. It was a little chilly, but refreshing in the 80 deg weather. On the holiday weekend, people stacked out chairs with towels early. After that we made sure to stake out our chairs after breakfast, but is wasnâ€™t much of a problem anymore. There were always plenty of towels available. The beach was a little disappointing. It is a small man made cove. The water is not good for swimming (corral, seaweed, and urchins), but great for snorkeling. We saw many tropical fish. I played golf one day. The course is nice, but not world class. It never seemed crowded. I played at 3:00 and played 18 holes with cart for $50. I was lucky to get paired with a local doctor who guided me through the challenging course (lots of water and other hazards). For the most part the staff was very friendly, and helpful. A few seemed a little grouchy (especially the older man working the towel station at the pool). We would definitely recommend it for a relaxing family vacation. Not much wild nightlife. Dorado seems to be a pretty small town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: ctfamily1234
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 night stay with our 4 and 2 year old sons. Pool and beach was perfect for the kids and just as enjoyable for adults. Our room had a few small cosmetic flaws, but nothing even close to major enough to warrant a complaint during our stay. Ocean view room was well worth the extra few dollars, best bet is to ask for a high floor (we were on 6 of 7) for the best views. Could hear the music from the lounge on Friday & Saturday night, but it stopped by 11:00 and didn't bother the sleep of the kids on the pullout in the least. Parking was no problem in the hotel's new parking garage and the free breakfast and happy hour were both great bonuses. Breakfast is definitely busy as the morning goes on, but we never experienced a lack of food or service. Both the pool and beach were much more crowded on the weekend and it did look like both were being used by some non-hotel guests. However, weekdays were quiet and very enjoyable, which made the weekend crowd much less of an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruthy01545
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, big, clean, and many ammenities. Hotel is set up with a large enclosed court yard in the middle and rooms surrounding it for 7 floors. Very nice pools, bars, and complimentary drinks "happy hour" every night :) One mishap: had my phone and camera stolen on beach. The "hotel" beach is public. Although the beach is pretty secluded, there are some small groups of teenage boys (2-3) that take advantage of tourists. Be ware, but don't let this stop you from staying here. It was my fault, I let my gaurd down cause I was having such a fantstic time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Dorado”
Reviews.Author: davey314
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at our recent stay at the Embassy Suites hotel in Dorado Beach. It's a beautiful property with a great, very friendly staff. We really enjoyed the full breakfast each morning - especially the cook-to-order omelets. And we also enjoyed dinner at the hotel restaurant and dined there on 3 of our 7 nights (the Churassco was excellent). One place we would NOT recommend is the asian restaurant that's just outside the hotel (don't know if it's associated with the hotel or not) - the food was not good and the service was worse. Our room was clean, comfortable, and roomy and the housekeeping staff did a great job. The pool area is well kept and clean and has a convenient bar for snacks and drinks. The sandy beach is protected by a jetty so there are not many waves (which was fine with me and my wife, but our teenage son would have preferred more of a surfing beach). We played at the casino a few nights. It's small, but not crowded and the dealers were very friendly. There's not a lot to see in Dorado (which was fine with us - we were really there for the beach and pool), but we had a rental car and went to Old San Juan a number of times (only about 25 miles to the east) and visited the rain forest and the observatory at Arecibo. We also visited the Bacardi factory (although the tour wasn't as good as it was on our first trip over 20 years ago when they actually let you into the factory). Overall, we had a great time at the Embassy Suites and would recommend it to other families.

Reviews.Title: “Family Baby-moon trip was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: hokie4beach
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites was an excellent hotel for what we were looking for. We didn't want to stay in San Juan or the bigger cities and didn't mind spending less to stay in Dorado and driving our rental around to hit the other cities. If you prefer to not get a rental car don't stay in Dorado b/c there really is nothing to do here. We loved the beach that the hotel was on. We loved the view of the water with the rocks surrounding it. Most of all we picked the Embassy Suites b/c we love their complimentary Breakfast Buffet that always comes with their stays. The omelette station is the best part. We rented a car to drive around PR. We went to El Yunque National Park to hike, toured the Bioluminescent Bay in Fajardo, snorkeled and raced on those inflatable speed boats....took the ferry across the water to San Juan and visited Castillo San Cristobal, went to Plaza Las Americas for shopping...we did just about as much as we could during our stay for 6 days. I would stay here again. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “good place, good people, I liked it”
Reviews.Author: numbas
Reviews.Content: Breakfast - fine, six kinds of juice, fruit, yogurt, pastry, bacon, sausage, eggs Free drinks, tip the guy and they will pour nicely Nice grounds, pool etc Parking $10.00 Rooms, good, nice, fine, OK Staff, good, helpful This is a nice place, I liked it, it was a pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with young children”
Reviews.Author: PickyMomVermont
Reviews.Content: Huge beautiful courtyard area with large palm trees, flowers, landscaping, plus four interconnected pools, a hot tub, and a poolside/beachside bar/cafe (no water slides). Nice beach with warm, protected water. Good golf course is right across the road. One suite works well for family with one or two children (adults in bedroom, children on pullout sofa in living room), door between living room and bedroom. Breakfast included in rate has cooked to order omelets, hot and cold items, fresh fruit, yogurt, strong hot coffee! A good value for a family needing separate rooms. We would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are seeking a paradise filled with wonderful people, come here!”
Reviews.Author: rohudd1
Reviews.Content: My husband, an avid golfer, and I decided to come to Puerto Rico to escape the cold, snowy weather in Boston. There were multiple options for us, but we chose this resort based on other reviews. The rooms were immaculate. The staff was outstanding! If you are traveling there, communicate with Juan and Hector, the bellhops. Not only are they knowledgeable, but they will seek out the answer to your questions if they do not have them. We are hoping that if any special offers are available, my husband and I can take advantage!!

Reviews.Title: “Close enough, far enough”
Reviews.Author: SouthsiEEED
Reviews.Content: The good: A magnificent place to stay if you donâ€™t need to be in the middle of the action. About a 45-minute drive from San Juan. The adjacent golf course makes it perfect for a getaway on the links, and the private beach and pool area are absolutely magnificent. Wonderful, professional staff. The bad: If you donâ€™t play golf, and you donâ€™t want to frolic around the water, your activities are limited. Plus, they charged a 12% surtax on top of the room rate and all the other taxes. But I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it said it would be”
Reviews.Author: justthetwoofus79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed from Feb 15th thru the 22nd the location was absolutley perfect we checked in and received the best service from peter at the front desk. super friendly and professional and he went above and beyond. Thanks for the late night snacks Peter! our bags were taking up by juan who was also super friendly smiled the entire time and gave us info about the resort gave us time to check out our room which was amazing with the ocean view. it was everything it said it would be. the pool is beautiful and the beach was just as great snorkeling is a must do there. the managers reception at night was a great added bonus which offered local beer and great wine. the bar offered great variety of food i fell in love with fried cheese and the puertorican chicken dish on their menu. Laura was our waitress in the bar area one night and she was great. offered great service smiled all the time she is a great waitress thank you laura. leslie in the restaurant should take some notes from her as we had her one night and got not one smile and she forgot my coke as well as to refill our waters never checked to see if our food was to our liking. i am a waitress here at home friendly service is everything and it was to us as well. the breakfast in the morning was always fresh and plenty of everything although i wasnt a big fan of the scambled eggs tasted more like powdered eggs then fresh but thte made to order omlets made up for that. overall it is a great place to stay and we plan on coming back. thank you for making our vacation one to always remember. your staff is a great staff and should receive all the credit they can get.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: cocktailmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2011 and it was a nice family vacation. I would recommend this to families - if they rent a car, couples not so much - as the night life is pretty much the casino on the property (which just opened). Our kids are 4 and 6 and enjoyed the pool, playground equipment and the rental whale from the pool shack. The beach is protected by a sea wall and is calm for little ones. The views were amazing from the balcony! The poolbar was nice, but expensive 4 alcohol drinks 2 adult/2 kid meals - $80 w/tip! Bottomline - this resort is older, but they are trying to maintain it well. Rooms are o.k. - it is humid there so they did not smell that wonderful - but we did not spend that much time in our room. Good value for getting a suite and a door so the adults can still be awake after the kids go to sleep. Internet was spotty. Housekeeping was very nice! All the staff members were very nice. The breakfast was worth every penny - and take advantage of the cocktail hour! Dorado is small, not lots to do. There are stories in the strip mall if you forgot something - Walgreens/Supermarket to pack a lunch for any day trips. I heard Grappe was nice, we never made it here. We did not like the Sushi restaurant on property. Other tips: you need a car - it is a good 30 minute drive in good traffic from San Juan. Go to El Morro is downtown Old San Juan in the am and then have lunch in Old San Juan. St. Germaine Cafe was awesome. Go to El Yunque, the rainforest. Plan on a full day out b/c it is on the other side of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for Anniversary Celebration!”
Reviews.Author: MarciaS8
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd visit to this resort, and the quality of service remains the best we have ever experienced! Marisol Colon and her well-trained staff made our stay a pleasure. Salvatore Moscato and the restaurant staff prepared and served wonderful breakfasts, lunches, Manager's receptions, and dinners. Pool, beach (which is public) and grounds are well-maintained. It is a testament to this resort that many we encountered were there for their 8th or 9th time! A wonderful mix of families, couples, and individuals! The new casino will add another activity to the golf and tennis courses.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Get Away!!”
Reviews.Author: Lic-KB2
Reviews.Content: We've been coming here for the past 7 years. My kids loves this hotel! I do too!!! The rooms are clean, the staff goes the extra mile and the breakfast buffet is excellent. The pools are great & clean. If you forget anything don't worry they have a little gift shop if not you drive 5 minutes and go to the shopping mall near by! They have a new parking lot and Casino for those who likes to bet. Can't way to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: jgeerlings
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled quite a few places, and we often use Trip Advisor to help in deciding which hotel to use. I therefore, felt obligated to write a review of my own since it has often helped us. We just got back from spending a week at this resort. We went with the expectation to relax, enjoy the food, pool, and have fun with our 1-1/2 yr. old daughter. The breakfast buffet was good, we especially liked the omelets and fried eggs. Our room was clean as was the grounds of the hotel, and the bed was comfortable. Our toilet wasn't flushing the first night we got there - the staff promptly sent up the maintenance crew to fix it - but then it continued to not work the rest of the evening. The next day the staff switched our room for us (no hassle), and even upgraded us from a golf course view to an ocean view - definite bonus points with us. The staff was also very friendly. We were pleasantly surprised and pleased that the pool area had such great amenities for kids - we really lucked out on that one. We also met many other vacationers that had been coming back to this resort over the years. The managers reception was good, in our opinion, at night. The snacks weren't anything fancy (popcorn and chips/salsa), but it was FREE...not too many hotels even give you a buffet breakfast these days...let alone free beverages and snacks. All in all, we had a great time and would think about coming back again in the future...which says a lot because my husband NEVER wants to do repeat trips (always liking to check out something new - which isn't bad), but he definitely said he'd want to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: cruisecritic201
Reviews.Content: It began to rain while we were lounging around the pool. We attempted to take shelter at a table at the open air bar, but were told this was not allowed because the tables were for paying customers, even though there was not a single customer in the bar area! We brought a beer down from our room to watch a game on the big TV in the common room adjacent to the bar area, but were told by the security guard that we had to buy drinks from their bar to sit there. We asked for the bellman to get us a cab to go into town, but after waiting 45 minutes we walked. As a result, we arranged our own transportation back to the hotel and to the airport the next day. Think we'll go back there? How 'bout nooooo!

Reviews.Title: “Value, comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: MCinAustin
Reviews.Content: Pros: roomy suite w/ separate bedroom, mini-fridge & microwave, semi-private beach, pools, free happy hour, breakfast, laundry, not touristy area Cons: No nightlife, grafitti and trash around semi-private beach, resort tax

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Roerck
Reviews.Content: This facility needs to be updated, it feels tired. Staff is very friendly, especially the front desk and valets. Every breakfast was short atleast one item; spoons daily, pastries one day, yogurt another. The Manager Reception was limited to house brands and poor "snacks".

Reviews.Title: “OK but Isolated”
Reviews.Author: MikeZDiver
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for young kids because of shallow pools, protected beach & play ground. However, for adults there's little to do unless you golf. I ended up renting a car from Vias in Dorado for $40/day. The small protected bay is too shallow for adults to swim, and it was too shallow and rough when I tried to swim beyond the breakwater. Also, the viz was too limited for snorkeling. The hotel is similar to any other Embassy Suites and breakfast + happy hour is complementary. There are good views from many of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC! Beautiful Hotel and Resort on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Lookin_to_Getaway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a Princess cruise and only stayed only one night. I say only, as we are already planning to return with our children at this terrific hotel. The staff was amazing (smiling all the time) and extremely helpful especially Israel Cordero the Front Office Manager. The rooms are big and the grounds are spectacular! Multi-layer Infinity pool, pool bar, shaded sitting area, beach, breakwater views, jacuzzi.. I could go on and on. We also loved spying on the iguana's in the area. The amenities like complimentary breakfast (not continental but complete with omelette bar) and cocktail hour were over the top. I especially liked the business center which allowed us complimentary use for airport check-in and printing of our boarding passes. If you are fly into San Juan, definitely stay here! Close to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MrsSantangelo
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for my honeymoon. It was highly recommended by a coworker and I understand why! First off, the price was great for the room. I literally could have lived in that room, and a balcony? Oh my heart just melted when I walked in! It was very nice to have a separate "living room" as my husband is an early riser, and I am not! The food was great. Not your average continental breakfast, the only thing I didn't like is that you can't take the food up to your room. I understand they run the risk of getting plates etc stolen and it creates more work for the employees, but it just ends too early for a late riser, and it would have been nice if my husband could have brought up my food so that when I woke up I could have re-heated it. Oh well! Happy hour was AWESOME! The drinks were amazing, the staff was friendly, popcorn was great. Only complaint on this is that the first night we had nachos there and it had cheese, and then the rest of the week it was salsa or chili or something. Would have been nice to have a bit of variety, but again, no biggy!!! The lobby area was GORGEOUS! We were allowed to bring our food over there and thats where we had our breakfast, and sometimes happy hour. We used the restaurant in the hotel. A LITTLE on the pricey side, but i would expect that from any hotel restaurant, and the food was AMAZING! Best part was that you could bring in your happy hour drinks so you didnt have to buy them which did save a ton of money im sure! We also went to the outdoor bar once, staff was VERY friendly. Did not eat out there, just had drinks. The pool was BEAUTIFUL and always seemed to be a good temperature. It was nice to have different levels of the pool, because we were able to have our own "space". Never got in the hot tub as there always seemed to be people in it. The towel guys could have been a little more friendly but you cant expect everyone to be perfect. The staff were very helpful! We had to get directions/recommendations at the front desk AT least once a day. They provided printed directions and menus, and wonderful restaurant recommendations. Even housekeeping, when we were given a not so nice looking sheet, came up and changed it immediately. The women who changed it was very angry at the staff who had put the stained sheet on the bed in the first place. I think it was probably an error that the stained sheet didn't get thrown away and the situation was resolved. We also had a rental so we parked at the hotel. The parking staff were very nice and very helpful. Also had to use the laundry facilties, and they were not wonderful, but who really cares? The clothes washed nicely. Overall GREAT experience. I plan on staying here again, and the few things I did mention were NOT enough to deter me from this hotel. If you are planning on going to this area, this is the hotel I recommend. (and the fact that it POURED all week did not stop me from loving PR or anything about it!!! the rain actually felt kind of nice!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid12345
Reviews.Content: We vacationed at this hotel for our 25th anniversary in early November. We are big Embassy Suites fans because of the consistent quality and complimentary breakfast and manager's reception. This hotel, staff and manager here were exceptional; the manager's reception staff provides speedy service on the drinks and the cooked-to-order breakfasts were delicious. We were greeted by Marisol Colon, the hotel manager and had a personalized greeting and treats in our room when we checked in. The staff and service througout our stay was exceptional, helpful and courteous including helping us get our car jump-started when we left the lights on. We came in the middle of the week and the hotel was not very full, but even over the weekends when there were numerous weddings and a very full hotel, we found the staff able to handle things well with no decline in service or attention. The lobby, atrium and reception areas, like most Embassy Suites, was inviting and nicely-maintained. The pool area is excellent with a very interesting layout and many areas to enjoy the sun. The beach area is also very nice for this side of the island because of the breakwater that has been constructed to settle down the breakers and form a very nice sandy-bottomed beach area. The temperature of the ocean and pool were nearly equal and comfortable. We had a tropical storm in the Caribbean to deal with which gave us many cloudy and some rainy days, but most days there was enough sun peaking through that we were able to get plenty of sunshine. Have seen some complaints about the cost to take a taxi. We rented a car in San Juan and monitored the prices as our trip approached and were able to rent a compact car for about $120 for a week which we would recommend for anyone staying in Dorado since it is about a half hour from San Juan. Avoid driving in or near San Juan and other sizeable towns during the normal rush hours of 7-10 am and 4-7 pm and you will be fine driving around. All in all, we had a very relaxing time and would recommend to anyone looking to find a quieter resort a bit out of the bustle of San Juan to look at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Golf Paradise at great Hotel was 5 star”
Reviews.Author: PenOfDen
Reviews.Content: Four friends were there to play golf and the course in Nov was wide open. The course is fun and challenging and the views were great. We felt like we were the only ones there, never seeing anyone in front or behind us. After golf the pool area was more then expected and the bartenders were friendly. The rooms exceeded expecations. As a business travelor for 35 plus years this would be the perfect place to have a combination business and reward for your staff. All four of us were impressed. Food was better then we all expected and the free breakfast and 2 hour open bar are tops.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Service Personnel were awesome - SO helpful !”
Reviews.Author: ValV0
Reviews.Content: We came to Puerto Rico for a family wedding. I would give this property an A+ . The rooms were nice, and the outside (beachside) was beautiful, but what I liked the most was the friendliness & helpfulness of the front desk staff. We didn't know our way around at all & found the area traffic difficult. Everytime we asked a question, they were so willing & ready to help, which went a far way to help relieve the stress level. Thank you so much !!!

Reviews.Title: “What a TREAT!”
Reviews.Author: victorgay
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this really very beautiful hotel. The staff is first rate,the outdoor areas are very well designed. My only problem the hotel provides no shuttle service to the airport,taxi costs $75 one way pretty steep indeed for those folks that have no car. The breakfast,newspaper,water,happy hour were really kool.

Reviews.Title: “Take advantage of the free Happy Hour”
Reviews.Author: wholisa85
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if they have this year round or only certain times of the year, but during my stay, they had complimentary breakfast and Happy Hour! The bartender was very generous in his servings and you can take two drinks at a time! Dorado doesn't have much of a night life, so a free happy hour was perfect! They also have complimentary breakfast with an omelet station and all sorts of other foods. Very tasty! The restaurant was quite tasty too. Their prices are a bit on the higher side, but I liked the quality. We ate at the pool bar one of the days and the service was so slow we were pretty upset especially since we were the only customers out there ordering food. Parking is $7.50/day for self parking and $15 for valet. I don't golf, but they did have beautiful grounds. The beach is a bit small, but they have a very large pool area. Be careful of the jacuzzi as it was too hot! I was in for about 3 minutes before it became uncomfortable. Overall, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough - It was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Philly_Dan
Reviews.Content: After visiting with family and friends on the island it was time for some family time with the wife and kids (4 nights 5 days) before heading back to Philadelphia. I got a great deal online by paying in advance. We are a family of 5 (3 children 11, 6 and 2) so I can't afford two rooms so I needed a suite. The breakfast was second to none. There was eggs, bread, bacon, sausage, potatoes, hot/cold cereal, juice, soda, tea etc. Staff was courteous and professional all the time. Checked into the two room suite and everything was in order, clean and comfortable. The room included a little living room with the TV, soft bed, table, chairs, sink and microwave. The bathroom was very spacious and well equipped. Bedroom had a balcony along with two full size beds and another TV. The various pool areas are just fantastic. They were about four feet deep perfect which allowed not worry too much about the two older ones. The beach which is a part of the hotel was just awesome. You are less than a five minutes drive away from Mc D., Burger King, Pizza Hut, Supermarkets, Walgreens, CVS and other US mainland stores/restaurants. Price includes two bottles of water per day and a 30 min tennis session. There is a time share property that shares the pool with the hotel. I did not have a problem with that. The only issue I had with the timeshare people was that on two separate occasions my wife and I got solicited to come over to their information session. The hotel was a little crowded and noisy the first day because of some guests and their parents (a bus load) from a little league baseball tournament but by 12 noon the next day it calmed down considerably. Had a small issue in the bathroom but maintenance and housekeeping responded quickly and professionally. Noted that I was charged 11% tax online in advance when it is actually was 9%. I was excepting a 3% credit adjustment but the front desk went further and reversed my 12% hotel resort fee for the whole stay. They are building a casino on the property not directly in the hotel (Thank God). I am a little worry that the hotel will lose its great family atmosphere but only time will tell. The exercise, coin laundry and game room was very well equipped. I really had a wonderful relaxing family time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Molarboy
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed at the Embassy Suites Dorado Del Mar this summer for our family vacation. We loved our stay. This is a very nice, typical Embassy Suites that you are probably used to - good breakfast every morning, manager's reception in the evening, and etc. Our room was nice; again a typical, clean E.S. room. We did have a view of the ocean and the golf course, which was wonderful. This Embassy Suites is located in the town of Dorado, about 45 minutes or so west from San Juan. The town is nice with grocery stores, Walgreen's, good restaurants, and etc. You will need a car to get around, unless you want to stay at the Embassy Suites and relax. Their three level pool is excellent, with a pool bar called the "Blue Seahorse" which was also nice. They do have a beach there, which is protected by a rock break so large waves do not come in. I can't say enough about how nice and welcoming each staff member was to us; Spanish and English is spoken. During our stay we went to a Bio Bay (really amazing), golfing at the resort (excellent course with sunning iguanas), explored old San Juan (my girls LOVED that area for the shopping), and hit several beaches on the North and East shores. Thus, be sure you rent a car. Crazy drivers in Puerto Rico by the way, but I got used to it. Anyway, I recommend you go and have a great time; and yes I would gladly like to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again! Perfect resort for teens and adults!”
Reviews.Author: arecibena
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived everything was just perfect. Check-in was smooth, Eliezer was very professional, friendly and full of information. When we arrived to our room it even smelled soo nice and fresh and the overall appearance was superb. Everything was neat, bathroom was nice and clean, decor was very nice too. All of it was just perfect. Lobby and public areas were always nice and clean as well. I enjoyed the full complimentary in the morning and free cocktails in the afternoon also 2 free bottles of water per day. Pool and beach areas very nicely kept. So for teenagers and adults this resort is a great option, my 17 and 18 years old loved it, made new friends and everything. I loved having internet in my room. My only complaint with this hotel is that they charge a 12% resort fee per day that includes the internet use, fax, phone and other stuff that i really dont use but i know others do i just think they should add the parking fee ($7.50 per day self parking) to this resort fee, that's it! I think it's more than fair to add it to the resort fee (this is the reason why i didnt give a 5 star but otherwise i would have), also free newspaper daily. We didn't use the restaurant in the resort because there are soo many cheaper options just a drive away that i just couldn't see myself spending the extra money at the restaurant. Pizza Hut, Burger King, Mc Donald's, Wendy's, Starbucks, Chinese, Ponderosa (i believe it was that chain or one like it), endless options just gotta take that short drive outside. Check-out was just as smooth and parking was always available and easy to access, definately a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: NYC099
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the San Juan area but wanted a change and booked 6 nights at Embassy Dorado. What a mistake! The hotel decor was mediocre. The person at the front desk was snappy and not very friendly. Went down for breakfast and stood on line for more than 45 minutes to find that there were no tables available and so on it went for the next 5 days. The hotel was completely booked and I swear from the looks of how packed the pool area was their must have been 10 people in a room. Had no hot water one night. No concierge to ask for restaurant suggestions. Beach was awful and because the hotel was so packed the pool was filthy. Did I mention the facilities are shared w/other guests from the time share next door? They had 2 weddings and the music blasted until 1am. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is not good, bad experience in this place”
Reviews.Author: johnnie224
Reviews.Content: this hotel was dirty, the parking is terrible is almost imposible to find one. In the night we couldn't sleep well, because there was people running, making noise, cursing, knocking the doors and bothering the people then running again. There was a few party it was night by night proms of high school students walking drunk and yelling at the people and it was like 4am I was calling on the phone people on the lobby and nobody was there, I was looking for the security and after a long time looking for someone we found only 1 for the whole building. In the beach somebody took from our seats a backbag and stole a video camera and a digital camera. I had to talk with the gm manager to complain about everything that was happening and he only told me that they will make some changes nd they only have 1 security man for the hotel. The was in remodelation but everything was slow. I don't think that this is a place to rest!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: VVGS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Embassy Suites - Dorado Del Mar during July 11-17 and let me tell you we had the best time of our life. This place is amazing. The staff is very friendly and always smiling. (Manager Marisol Colon,Isarael Cordero and everyone). Breakfast was great. I was impressed that everytime you call any of the hotel lines, they will address by greeting you "Hi Mr. _____ , how can help you". I would strongly recommend this place to everyone looking for a great stay in Puerto Rico. Location : Very nice location, right on the beach, away from traffic and 30 mnutes away from San Juan. Rain forest is almost 45 minutes away. Biobay/Fajardo is 1.15 minutes away, Camury Caves/Radio Telescope is almost 1 hour away. We stayed for 6 days and covered all the major attractions with a one day to spare which we enjoyed at pool and beach. We travelled with two girls (Age : 8 and 13) and they had tons of fun at swimming pool and beach, which are next to each other. When I go to Puerto Rico, I am definitely staying here AGAIN :) Marisol and rest, Thanks for the great services. Keep up the great work and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great American Quality hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: CrizM
Reviews.Content: Usually when I travel outside of the continental U.S., it's hard to find a hotel that shares the same star rating as the U.S. hotels. I was extremely pleased with the Embassy Suites. I had to work near Dorado, which is on the other side of Puerto Rico. There really isn't much on this side of the island that I had time to explore, but the hotel was perfect after a full day at work. I came back in time to relax on the beach before heading back to the lobby bar for cocktails. Dinner in their restaurant wasn't bad, but I did get a chance to visit a local restaurant that the concierge recommended. The rooms were just as large as a regular Embassy Suite. I think the best part for me was that it was on it's own beach. The staff was very friendly and the rates were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, decent price, but hotel showing its age”
Reviews.Author: rriospr7
Reviews.Content: First let me start with the pros/positive comments: The staff at the hotel was excellent...everyone we encountered greeted you and were aways curteous. Special kudos to whomever was handling the front desk on Thursday 8 Jul at 0620hrs, when I called to inquire about an error in my bill regarding parking charges. The gentleman who answered the phone did a quick review of my bill, noticed the error, apologized and offered complementary parking becuase of the error made by the accounting department. I did not ask for it, but he said it was the right thing to do....this to me shows treating the CUSTOMER right is the best way to go. The breakfast spread is standard Embassy Suites, which means a good breakfast that will hold you through most of the day. Although the hotel was extremely packed during out stay, I say the staff did a great job flowing people through the breakfast line as quickly as possible and ensuring tables were cleaned relatively quickly. Same for the manager's reception cocktail hr (2hrs). Quick flow-through allowed my wife and I to enjoy a few drinks and relax prior to dinner. Although the hotel now charges a resort fee of 12%/day, If you get a room in the $120.00 range, the 12% is pretty much made back with the breakfast and cocktailsyou recieve (based on two individuals in a party). Pool was extremely busy, but for the most part we got there early enough in the morning to have a lounge chair. Exercise room was decent, although two of the three treadmills were non-operational. Overall noise from the construction going on with the casino being built in the property was minimal and even with us staying in a front facing room near the construction area. Now the negatives/cons: The hotel, specially the room we stayed in (I assume this is across the board) is showing wear. This is our second visit to this property in 5 years and the furnishings inside the room were identical to what was there in 2004-05 time-frame. Our room sofa had stains and slight tearing along the seams were beginning to show. Bathroom needs re-caulking along tub and toilet areas as those become extremely "gritty" with dirt and begin to look nasty if you don't do so, specially in a sandy/beach environment. Also walls int the room, specially where the small table with three chairs are in the living/eating area need painting due to large scuff marks which take away from the cleanliness of the room. Recommendation for manager -- do a cursory walk through rooms and see if what I am detailing is across the board of just one isolated room so that it can be addressed in a planned manner. Places to eat: There is a great Reposteria (Bakery) just 1 mile from the main gate of the resort (make right at the traffic light and look for the Popeyes chicken and it is in the complex right next to Popeyes) -- do not be fooled by thinking this is just a Bakery...in a reality it is a full service restuarant which had some incredible dinner offerings at a much lower price than I expected. They have a full compliment of wines, beer, and liquor along with some of the best desserts I've had on the island. Dinner for two (with 2 local beers, and 1 dessert) came out to $39.00 with tax. Overall: Would likely stay again, but only with proof that rooms have been "updated". The staff are excellent and some of the best I have encountered during many of my hotel stays (business travel).

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel that I would definitely recommend to friends!”
Reviews.Author: NYCmomWifeTeacher
Reviews.Content: This is our second year staying at the embassy suites and we had a great time. The staff was great. Everyone from the bellman to the front desk to the security were attentive and friendly. The same people who were kind last year (Lynette, Israel, and Kalina) were attentive this year as well. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. The morning breakfast is crowded but well staffed! The coffee is delicious. If you want a relaxing meal you should definitely consider waking up a little early. Marisol, the operations manager, is especially attentive. She makes every effort to make her pressence known in the hotel. She is available to help with any concerns you may have during your stay. Overall, the ES is a very nice hotel for families on vacation in Puerto Rico. I look forward to trying out other ES hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome....”
Reviews.Author: dhvalentin
Reviews.Content: I must say that my husband was a little apprehensive because of the location. I thought it was great, easy access to Highways and local restaurants. What impressed me the most is how hospitable and friendly the staff is. I understand that they are in the hospitality business but, with that being said, many times you will encounter people that are friendly but are really fake. Not here at Embassy Suites, everyone from janitorial, to front desk, to beach attendant, restaurant workers everyone was very friendly and courteous. One thing I would suggest though.......providing better pillows!!!

Reviews.Title: “Here is what Embassy Suites Dorado Del Mar Beach Doesn't Tell you”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel30
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that the hotel cleanliness and staff service was what is to be expected from an Embassy Suite. No complain there. However, what you don't know from reading the Resort information....this resort is located in a gated community, with various surrounding condos and homes as well as having a Time Share Resort adjacent to it which locals frequent. Well, guess what? Everyone in that adjacent Time Share resort plus their relatives share all of the facility with the Embassy Suites. Although there did seem to be "security" people, they did not regulate who was and was not a guest at the resort. Plus, since the beach is "Public", everyone in the gated community comes to use the beach and then helps themselves to the pool area. We were there for 5 days and not ONCE were we able to use the pool, gym, or beach because it was so crowded, 24 hours a day. The guests at the Time Share portion had on wrist bands to be able to eat the breakfast at the Embassy Suites, so there was no "Wonderful" breakfast at anytime in this facility, it was always crowded and the food was cold because of the large quantity they had to prepare. And trust me, I tried different times between 7am and 9:30am. I had to pay a 12% resort fee for things I was not able to use or enjoy, however, the guests that came in for the day did enjoy the pool area and beach and they did not pay a dime for their little vacation day. Hilton will be hearing from me soon regarding this lack of information on their website. If you want peace and quiet, do NOT go to this hotel. Hotel staff were obviously over whelmed with the number of people that were always milling around all over the hotel area, but they did try to accommodate.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for families- would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Familyof4inArkansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over Memorial Day weekend and really enjoyed our visit. Here are some comments regarding our trip: 1) We rented a car. I would recommend this because there are lots of restaurants in Dorado including low cost places like McDonalds, KFC, and Subway. There is also a grocery store, so we stocked our fridge in the room with drinks and snacks. 2) We drove to the rain forest and visited the bioluminescent bay. It was a long day for the kids (ages 4 and 5), but they had a blast. It was well worth the drive. 3) The hotel pools (I think there were five in all) were great! None of the water was over the kids' head, so that made me feel better, but I did stay very close and keep an eye on them. If they were a bit older, say 8 or 9, I would have felt comfortable relaxing in a lounge chair because none of the water is over 4 ft. My kids absolutely loved the pool area and would have stayed there the whole time we were on vacation if we had let them. The pool was open 24 hours a day. Try to get out there by 10 am or so to get a spot under the cabana. 4) The beach area is okay. It was clean, and they had paddleboats, which looked really fun. 5) The food in the restaurant was good, and the free made-to-order breakfast was great! It was well worth getting up a little early to beat the crowd. 6) It was a short drive to the ferry over to Old San Juan. My kids really liked visiting the town. Overall, we loved this hotel. We are Hilton Diamond members, and we had enough points to stay anywhere on the island, and we chose this location (even over the Waldorf Astoria El Conquistador!) because of the friendly employees and great service. I was so impressed by how nice everyone was, and that friendliness even extended off the property. We ran into one of the front desk staff at the Fort, and she was just as sweet and kind to us there as she was on the job. I was super impressed by that, and by the responsiveness of the manager, Marisol Colon. I can't say enough good things about the staff at this hotel. If you are looking for a super-clean, family friendly hotel with nice amenities, this is a great choice. We will definitely stay here again on future vacations in PR.

Reviews.Title: “Might stay there again”
Reviews.Author: bajan74
Reviews.Content: Beware of this resort's strict cancellation policy - you can't change/cancel unless its 72 hours before arrival, and there is a $75 penalty if you check out early. I tried switching 2 days before arrival to the other Embassy suites which is closer to the city/airport since our flight was coming in after midnight. We were not excited about driving all the way to Dorado (1/2 hour from the airport) with 2 young kids that late at night. Unfortunately no amount of begging would help. I was told by the main reservation center and Henry the night manager that I would still be charged 1 night's stay. So I gave up. A few days later with our GPS and a few wrong turns we finally made our way to the hotel,,arrival time 1.45am.,,did I mention the few wrong turns? :)... The room was nice with all the usual amenities. I was not "WOW'ed" by the breakfast, but it was free, so can't complain. Most of the staff were friendly but nothing I can really commend the hotel for. I've been to resorts in Jamaica and other places where you'd swear the staff faces hurt from smiling all day and stopping to interact with the kids. None of that at this resort. One staff member at Dorado del Mar (Israel at the front desk) was very very friendly and helpful, he made up for the haughtiness of some of the others. My biggest disappointment was the beach, NO ONE could bathe at the beach of this "Beach resort", rocky sand and mucky seaweed nixed that idea in a hurry, you have to drive to another beach. The manager explained that the tide brought the seaweed in. Nothing they can control of course, but I wish I had known before booking. There were no planned kid's activities. The General manager herself was pleasant and interacted with the guests which was refreshing. The manager's reception in the evenings were a nice touch although the drinks were very light. Overall I "might" stay there again, because Dorado turned out to be a peaceful place to stay outside of the city, and the kids LOVED the pool, but we felt like we were missing out on the excitement Puerto Rico promises. One thing that did resonate was a previous reviewer's comment that the resort was a hang out for the locals. There is an ownership/timeshare part to this resort so I assume everyone else besides the few of us with a wrist band (given at check in) were the owners and all their friends/guests. Once you gave a room number you had access to everything. It was a bit confusing and crowded, but we got used to it. I would recommend to a friend because the rate was affordable and the hotel was clean and pretty. Get a rental, there is no other means.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the family.”
Reviews.Author: wilfredgarcia
Reviews.Content: the room was very very clean and this is what please me. good breakfast and service.the pool is exellent for kids but the beach is not much .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Top Courtesy!”
Reviews.Author: DMiranda
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the personnel's courtesy and superb disposition to help guests enjoy their stay. The excellent service started from the welcoming moment till departure time. The room was comfy, beautifully decorated and super cleaned. The pool area is divided in 4 swimming pools and a small, but cute jacuzzi. The main pool has a beautiful sculpture of a siren and a dolphin surrounded by rocks with streaming waters.The beach is just steps away from the swimming area. Every area is well distributed. The main lobby is decorated with tropical plants and water fountains which gives one a sense of calmness and well-being. The Breakfast Buffet offers a variety of food sure to satisfy any taste. The Manager's specials are awesome! Their Happy Hour at 5:30 pm is unbeatable! 2 thumbs UP!

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay for ocean view if you request 2...”
Reviews.Author: Mrsled
Reviews.Content: Don't pay for ocean view if you request 2 beds. We're overlooking air conditioners and roofs and trashy buildings and parking decks. Oh but you do see the ocean wayin the distance. Disappointing! Breakfast great. People nice. Housekeeping requests answered quickly. Managers reception ok. Long drink line and popcorn and chips are set out. Pool open to locals it seems and people from other resorts. Outside of building needs some maintenance. Overall it's okay. View most disappointing, especially since HH member.

Reviews.Title: “Relax all day on this quiet beach along the bluest "lagoon."”
Reviews.Author: mchcondor
Reviews.Content: From the delicious buffet breakfast's made-to-order omlettes to the superb dinner entrees served by friendly staff, the food's ab-fab. If you need directions to any attraction, stop by the front desk and ask the friendly, enthusiastic day-concierge, Israel. Looking to have an afternoon snack & cocktail, see the awsome Edward Reyes at the Sea Horse Bar. Swim among the schools of fish in the ocean's lagoon; then dip into the multi-level pool (after dark, multi-colored too). If you leave this resort only once, go to the National Rain Forest; you will never forget this once-in-a-lifetime experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: chescotraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay very much at this hotel. The hotel is about 40 minutes west of SJU. Traffic around San Juan is absolutely terrible during rush hour. The check in process was very smooth. We had requested a high floor and a crib, which was taken care of prior to us arriving at the hotel. The room was a nice size and clean. The pool is cleaned every morning and the beach is cleaned as well. The pool is only 3' 6" deep and has a bar and food available. The pool also had a play area and a pool for younger children. The pool is shared by another property but was not crowded at all. The beach does not belong to Embassy Suites as all beaches in Dorado are public. The hotel does take care of the beach by cleaning it and providing chairs. We found the beach to be clean and the water to be very clean. The manager's reception is a nice touch. They had pop corn and tortilla chips every night. They had wine, beer and mixed drinks. No frozen drinks! We also enjoyed the breakfast which had plenty of choices for a breakfast which was included in the rate. My wife got a massage by Joann, which she loved. Self-park is not an issue! It is very close to the main entrance and someone is always at the entrance to the parking lot. Isaias was great! He was extremly helpful in giving directions, suggesting restaurants and always had a smile on his face. He even asked if I could think of anything negative about the hotel as we were checking out. The other staff was also great! Dorado has many fast food restaurants (taco bell, pizza hut, kfc, burger king), Starbucks, CVS Rx, Baskin Robins and more. We did take the 5 minute ferry from Catano to Old San Juan. This was nice except the ferry station is not very well marked. This is definitely better than driving to Old San Juan. We would definitely go back but for fewer days and go to another part of the island for additional days.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous value but location not the best”
Reviews.Author: Kwtrading
Reviews.Content: Just finished 4 days of our 6 day vacation in PR at this great hotel. Have to say the value cannot be beat. It's very clean. Staff is very friendly. Breakfast is excellent. Happy hour is great. Yes the food is just popcorn and snack mix but we enjoyed it! You get just about any drink except frozen ones. I also recommend the rum punch. The pool is beautiful and very safe for kids as there are no real deep areas. Just make sure they aren't jumping or diving. The beach is guarded by a break wall so no waves but again great for kids to just hang out at. I did not find the beach dirty at all as mentioned in other reviews. Maybe it was a short lived issue years back. The temporary parking is not that far as some complain about. The parking garage will be farther if anything when done! If looking to experience true Puerto Rico this is not the place. There is little to do in town and very few restaurants other than fast food. If looking to get away somewhere off season when it's too cold on the main land this is a great place. My family loved it. I would go back but again for only part of my stay and would experience other places on the island. San Juan is close and I recommend taking the ferry from Catano to Old San Juan. Only a buck per person each way. We did the Bacardi tour in Catano first then hopped the ferry for the rest of the day in OSJ.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: foxpoint1
Reviews.Content: Staff extraordinarily helpful in every way. Property very well managed. Best value in history. Suites can accommodate two adults and two kids easily. Nice property, nice pool, nice beach, downtown Dorado one mile away. Big breakfast, bottled water, and free drinks between 5:30 p.m. and 7:30 p.m. included. Having a rental car a big plus. Parking garage under construction but parking, as things are, not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST spring break!”
Reviews.Author: chelst5
Reviews.Content: We loved every minutue of our stay. The hotel was clean, lovely and a great location in the center of it all in Dorado Beach. The staff at the hotel went above and beyond for us. Neilka one of the managers quickly became a friend of ours. The room set up was perfect for us and if we needed anything it was done righ away with a smile on their face. The beach was lovely as was the pool where we spent many relaxing days. The breakfast was delicious and the nightly manager's reception was alot of fun. We can hardly wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Rvrdncr
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed about this hotel was the complete lack of "hotel smell." As someone who is very sensitive to "hotel smell" (and the related "restaurant smell"), I was very impressed by the freshness and overall cleanliness of this hotel. I think it's primarily due to the beautiful atrium style lobby with lots of plants and water features. This also gave the hotel a great open feeling. You never find yourself in a cramped, stuffy hallway on the way to & from your room. We were traveling with our kids, 3 & 5 yrs, so the suite style of room was great. They could go to bed at their normal bedtime on the pull out couch & my hubby & I could still enjoy the balcony off our bedroom. Though I read the pool was open 24 hrs, we never heard excess noise. The pool area is wonderful for families of all ages. Having small children, we stayed on the kids side where there is a zero-entry to the pool as well as a smaller pool with fountains, and a small playgroudn in between. My kids LOVED this area! There's also plenty of shady spots around the pool if you've gotten too much sun. The beach is fantastic for small kids too since the rock reef breaks the waves well before they hit the beach. The staff was all very helpful! We liked that they had printed directions to all the places we planned to visit. We had a GPS, but it was nice having a "backup."
