Our day trips included Pinones in Loiza, Ponce, El Camuy caverns (be sure to hit Heladaria Lares after for ice cream flavors featured on Bizarre Foods with Andrew Zimmern), El Yunque rainforest (don't miss the 1/2 mi path back to the falls you can't see from the road - ask the guide at El Portal), Loquillo Beach, and the walking night tour of Las Cabezas and the bioluminescent bay - Laguna Grande. We tried not to eat at the hotel for lunch & dinner, but the 2 times we did, it was very good and seemed very authentic, yet they also had the trad'l kids' food. The breakfast was fantastic! It was nice being able to start our day with a hearty (free) hot breakfast! We would definitely stay at this hotel again. It was a fantastic value! We look forward to seeing the (much needed) parking deck and casino next time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Average facilities, above-average service,”
Reviews.Author: RickCAAM
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was an average place to stay for an above-average nightly charge. The service was excellent and people very friendly I should add. Pool was good... not great; the hotel shares the pool area and beach with a time-share condo called Aquarius and it was too crowded for my taste. It felt like a community pool at times. The parking area was very small and in a construction area which was inconvenient since we went out of the resort to explore other local spots. Entering the Embassy property was also a big mess since they share common grounds with a residential area called Dorado del mar. The golf course was in the middle of the community. The "ocean view' room was 95% roof top view and only 5% (far away) ocean view. I also noticed a $50 charge on my card ontop of my $240/night that went away 3 days after my stay (which freaked me out for a while). Full breakfast was excellent and included with the room charge. I must say that the lady in charge of the area deserves an award.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: itrade
Reviews.Content: I stay at Embassy Suites quite often, so I have a good feel for them. This one has a very good pool set up, good hot tub, a very good beach for young children (thanks to a large breakwater), and good service from the hotel staff. The layout is generally appealing, and there are several afternoon/evening dining and bar options. The parking situation was extremely difficult with parking spots next to impossible to find after 9:00 pm. The breakfast buffet was decent but I found it lacking - there needs to be more variety in the hot item potions; I was frankly disappointed that there was not more fresh fruit options. The manager's reception was rather disappointing with the same tortilla chips and popcorn ever single day. Some variety would be extremely welcome. I also found the room bed (a king) to be a bit less comfortable than what I normally find at Embassy Suites or at Homewood Suites hotels. I felt the hotel staff was doing their best to please the guests - especially given that the hotel was 100% full on 3 of the nights. The bellhops and concierge were invaluable at providing ideas for outside dining or tours or self-guided adventures. If you stay here, I would recommend a rental car. Its 40 minutes to SJU and about 20 miles, so your cab will be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation spot.”
Reviews.Author: AAGN1601
Reviews.Content: This is a Separate from the metropolis of San Juan hotel but not to far id say its about a good 25 minutes away from the airport, you feel the resort type ambience the minute you walk in trough the door. The hotel is very clean and very well kept considering that part of the hotel still has not been renovated in about 7 years ( they already started to update the rooms) so we give a Kudos to the Chief Engineer of the hotel it is very well kept. As for the surroundings the hotel is a beach front hotel very tropical like and there Staff in general is great but above all I have to mention a few people who are just spectacular and those are Isaiah (Front Desk) Moraima(Lobby Bar, this girl has a spectacular sense of service considering she is only been working there a month) Alexandra (blue Seahorse) Zoraida (pool stand), Garry (managers Reception, Funny Dude) and Ivelisse our Housekeeper is surprisingly communicative and helpful with every detail to make your stay as comfortable as possible. If you have a chance check this hotel out it is very family oriented and you wont go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: proudmommyof1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at this hotel for our anniversary. This was the best hotel that we have ever stayed at. They had great rooms. One thing I noticed is that the rooms were quiet - most hotels are noisy until very late at night - but this one was always very quiet and great for sleeping in! The breakfast was awesome - so much variety and very good food. I agree with another poster that they might want to extend the breakfast hours until at least 10:00 am because we had to wake up early just to make it to breakfast. It is in a very safe location and the employees were all helpful and spoke great English! That means alot when you are in a place that is primarily spanish speaking. The pool is huge and so nice. You can have tons of people in there and still find a little spot away from everyone. The beach is nice as well! Everything was clean and comfortable. The only negatives were that the rooms were cleaned really late. We had come back from a day out at the beach (very sunburned and really tired) about 3:30 one afternoon and really wanted to take a quick nap but they were cleaning our room and we had to wait for about 30 minutes until they were finished. Also the resort fee is really high (about $105 plus parking) and would have not been so bad if we had taken advantage of the things that it is supposed to cover.....but my husband and I don't drink so happy hour meant nothing to us and we don't play tennis so we didn't use the courts either. We did get a couple of free waters but we could have bought those for much less money somewhere else! So we kindof felt like we bought everyone else's drinks at happy hour and paid for their use of the tennis courts! But we would stay here again if we get the opportunity to visit Puerto Rico again!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: MarciaS8
Reviews.Content: This is the second visit to this facility and again, it is the best facilityat which my husband and I have ever stayed. The courteous and well-trained staff makes the difference. On both occasions we found the facilities, food, beach, surrounding area wonderful....and the Embassy Suites staff, from top to bottom, EXEMPLARY!!!! We will return there again and again.......

Reviews.Title: “rooms not ready”
Reviews.Author: shealittle
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 7pm and I had booked 2 rooms to our surprise both rooms were not ready. Dirty, garbage, beds unmade and that is surely not a good first impression after a long day. Also, we were disappointed with the Jacuzzi very small. Pools were great though! Gym was good and managers reception was also good. Breakfast was great! Though our bottles of water were hot! I enjoy are stay even though we had a couple of mishaps.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cincinnati_Girlie
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Embassy Suites in Dorado the first week of March 2010. This was our first time ever at the resort, and in Puerto Rico. We had the best trip! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous - the pictures look like what you see on the internet. The staff is fabulous. They told us the best places to go to eat, sightsee and shop. They were, by far, the most friendly staff I have ever dealt with on my vacations and business travel. I cannot say enough about them! The bartenders at the Manager's Special were great also! The pool is beautfiul, as is the outside bar. The beach area is a perfect location for a nice quiet day. We loved the free breakfast in the morning - the food was delicious and very fresh!!! All in all, we had a wonderful time. The location of the hotel is perfect - lots to do nearby, not too far from San Juan and many locations to eat. We have recommended this place to family and friends from the second we got back. We plan on definitely staying at the resort again. Thank you to all of the front desk staff and hotel staff! Everyone was very professional and helpful. Like I said, best vacation ever!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: sugarbee30
Reviews.Content: We came to Puerto Rico to celebrate me turning the big 3-0, so I was very careful about picking a place that I would enjoy. I read hundreds of comments about all kinds of hotels and decided to pick this one because it had consistently positive remarks overall. So here is what I really thought about it all... 1. The grounds are beautiful and very tropical looking - great for pictures. This hotel is in a compound of sorts which means that only people who are supposed to be on the property are there, which is nice from a safety perspective. 2. The hotel is very clean in the common areas. My boyfriend did the one finger swipe several times and never could find dust. They also have a hand sanitizer right at the elevator which I like because I am a little leary of germs with so many people around. It did take a while for the room to be cleaned - think 2pm to 3pm. 3. The rooms are nice. The sofa in our room had a big stain on it that looked like coke or some kind of drink. It could stand to be replaced. I loved the private room area and the bed was fantastic. I drifted away to heaven the first night in that bed after a long day of traveling. The fridge and microwave were a nice touch and will help you save money. 4. We had a view of the pool area from our balcony, which was nice. And if I crooked my neck to the side I could see the ocean. We had a meal on the balcony one day and that was cool. I spilled some juice on the balcony table but the cleaning people never wiped that down. 5. The breakfast was good each time we had it, but we missed it a couple of days because we partied the night before and it closes down at 9:30am. I feel like they should review the hours that the breakfast and happy hours are offered. I am on vacation, I don't necessarily want to get up by 8:30am just to make breakfast before it closes at 9:30. Also, if you do anything away from the resort, it is dang near impossible to get back before 5:30 when the happy hour begins. It does go on for two hours though. 6. You will not find a nicer staff in my opinion. Everyone was very friendly and graciously answered all of our questions. Giberto the bartender was my favorite and he made sure that we were taken care of on our trip. I don't know what we would have done without him! 7. We ate lunch at the pool hut - 2 orders of hotdogs and french fries and 3 alcoholic beverages ran us $41. No lie. It was a very big hotdog and the drinks were good, but good lawd! 8. Stay away from the Gift Shop! Can anybody say overpriced? And what got me the most was that they did not have one postcard that was not a picture of their hotel. Come on people! There is more to the island than where I am staying. Am I the only person who still sends postcards??? :) Things nobody will tell you but me... 1. You NEED a car - Dorado is nice, but is in the suburbs. There is nothing to do outside of the resort area. If you are looking for night time excitement you must leave Dorado. 2. Try a mofongo (Puerto Rican specialty) but BRING THE ROLAIDS! The food is a richer and they use a lot of spices and grease. 3. Take some mini liquors with you. And a trip to the local grocery will also help your pocket. Don't expect coupons or deals in America to apply on this island. The $10 Pizza Hut deal? Yeah right! We spent $33 on a large specialty pizza, a med pepperoni and a 2 liter Pepsi. And look at your receipts. They charged us for 2 Pepsis but I only ordered one and they only brought one. 4. Take advantage of the "complimentary" waters. It is hot and you will need it. 5. A GPS navigation system is a MUST! I don't know what I would have done without my Susan! I did not get good directions from anybody while I was there. The street signs are also in Spanish and beware of one way streets - they look a little different and are not adequately marked.. I ended up getting pulled over for driving the wrong way down a one way and being in the bus lane (which was headed against the one way and was not marked). Thankfully the cops just laughed at me and helped me turn around. Oh, and there are like 55 different sets of cops on this island. I couldn't keep up! And the police and ambulance always have their lights on, so don't be alarmed or move to the side until you hear a siren. 6. Take your Spanish dictionary. You will find a lot of people don't speak English once you leave the resort area. Thankfully I speak and read Spanish fairly well and was able to communicate. My boyfriend, on the other hand would have been lost without me. 7. Oh and expect to spend more money on the hotel than you have paid already. If you take a car you will be hit with a $7 per day parking fee. You will also have a $14-15 charge per day for a resort fee which includes your "complimentary" waters, internet services, access to the tennis courts, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, beautiful grounds, nice family getaway”
Reviews.Author: hockeyfamily20
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Puerto Rico and we're already planning our next! We are a family of five, our children are 15, 9, and 8. We decided to book here after reading reviews of several hotels in Puerto Rico. This property had the best reviews in our price range. We were very happy with our experience. PROS: *Friendly staff - Everyone we encountered was friendly - front desk at check in, breakfast staff, evening reception staff, housekeeping staff, restaurant servers, bar tenders, even the towel stand at the pool - It's been a very long time we've stayed somewhere where every employee was friendly - This made our experience so much better. We had asked for extra towels (there are 5 of us) from the girl who cleaned our room the first day and we were left extra towels every day of stay without having to ask again. *Room - We booked a room with 2 double beds - the boys shared a bed and our teenager slept on the pull out coach - This was very convenient - Most of the time as a family of 5 someone ends up sleeping on the floor - The pull out couch made our teenager very happy - We had a partial ocean view from our balcony and really enjoyed that *Breakfast - WOW! What an amazing meal we had each morning! Food cooked to order, so many choices, and the staff served it with a smile. Items were replaced quickly if they were getting low, there was never a time where they wer out of something. It was a wonderful way to start off every morning. Pool & Beach - Amazing!!! We could position our chairs and watch the kids on the beach AND in the pool. They are steps away from each other. Our kids were too big for the little kids play area (although they did go down the slides a couple of times) but I still thought that was a great touch. There were plenty of chairs, even during busy hours. The pool was clean and the beach offered a beautiful view. And the kids enjoyed playing the giant connect four game, too. We were on vacation to do nothing but relax, and this was definitely the place for that! Evening Reception - The nachos and salsa were good, the free drinks were nice, and the kids loved the popcorn. Dinner in the restaurant/cafe - The food portions were huge, and I felt the kids meals were reasonably priced - The food was good, the service was excellent. CONS (very few) *The Italian restaurant was closed for construction, so that left little choice for meals - This should have been noted on the website or mentioned at check in *Lunch service at the pool side bar/restaurant was very slow and the food was a bit pricey and only average *It took a very long time every day for our room to be cleaned - we would leave early, go to breakfast, and then spend until 1 or 2 o'clock at the pool and return to our room to find it still not cleaned *Dinner in the restaurant/cafe was pricey, but the kids meal prices were worth it with due to portion sizes *Items in the shop (sun block, etc) were VERY over priced *The additional resort fee added to the bill is a little high - It might be better to just raise the room rate a little bit. I think adding this additional fee at check out kind of leaves you on a negative note. All in all, it was a very relaxing stay for all of us a family. We had a great time and plan to come back again in November! I would highly recommend this property to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jkfhope
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to a tropical resort and we were not disappointed. The pool and beach were great, plenty of chairs and wonderful scenery. The free breakfast was great, and the free drinks were top shelf. The rooms were a little worn, but nice, and we were were given a room with a view even though we did not reserve one. The parking was a inconvinient for self-parking, but I would recommend a car because it really isn't close to anything. We had slow service at the pool side bar and grill, but the waiter gave us a free appetizer to make up for it. I had a massage at the spa which was wonderful. There was a large mix of people there from families to spring breakers. Overall it was a wonderufl experiece and we hope to return next winter!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better. Great value, great hotel and great service.”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTimeLarry
Reviews.Content: I wish all hotels were this nice and well run. I picked this hotel based on the numerous positive Trip Advisor reviews (esp about the manager, Marisol Colon) and am glad I did. We only spent two days here but we wished we could stay a week. We had planned to tour the island but the hotel was so nice we never left. The employees are friendly, helpful, courteous, respectful and professional. The hotel is clean, spacious, tropical and well decorated and landscaped. The rooms are clean, spacious, nicely decorated and the bed was incredibly comfortable. There were plenty of TV channels in English (although it was funny to watch old Gladiator re-runs with ex-Redskin, Joe Theismann being dubbed in Spanish). We had a great view from the room balcony (golf course to the right and ocean to the left) even though we reserved the cheapest room available. The exercise room is clean, spacious and nicely equipped. The pool area is incredibly well designed, landscaped and maintained with no debris (leaves, mulch or trash) anywhere. The pools are large â€œlagoonâ€� shaped with fountains and waterfalls and are refreshingly cool (not cold). The spa (or hot tub) is pretty large and warm enough for the 80+ degree weather. The kidâ€™s area is smartly designed at a far corner, away from the rest of the pool with a nicely designed beach type walk-in pool access. You access the beach from the pool area and the view is breathtaking; perfect coconut palm trees against aqua blue water with snow white surf crests and deep blue skies. I couldnâ€™t take enough photos. There are plenty of lounge chairs around the pool, on the lush green lawn and on the beach. Complimentary towels and bottled water are abundant. We ran into the manager the second morning; we saw a well dressed woman in the breakfast area helping people find tables, walking briskly in and out of the kitchen, and even cleaning tables. We introduced ourselves and complimented her on her hotel. She even graciously arranged a late check-out so that we could enjoy an extra hour or two at this great resort. Advise: If you want to save a few bucks, rent a car. Itâ€™s too expensive for cab fare and rental cars are cheap. My only Con: the $7/day self park wouldnâ€™t have seemed unreasonable if the driveway condition to the parking lot was in better shape. There was no sidewalk so you had to play hopscotch around the many rain filled potholes. It seemed as if the parking lot was an after thought since it was so uncharacteristic in comparison to the rest of the well maintained hotel. But you could pay double (plus tips) and have your car valet parked. Overall, I canâ€™t imagine a better value in all of Puerto Rico. Our experience couldnâ€™t have been better. We will definitely be back. We just hope that Ms. Colon is still running the hotel when we return.

Reviews.Title: “A Toddler's Paradise...and Good For Parents Too...”
Reviews.Author: Cincy_World_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed here for a week with our 20-month old. I think some of the more negative reviews may have stayed in one of the older rooms. We arrived late at night and were given a room that looked outdated and somewhat worn. The air conditioner had a very musty smell that is unfortunately common in many hotels that are located in tropical climates. I spend about 20% of my nights per year in hotels, so I sensed that this was a room where I did not want to waste a week of my time. I contacted the front desk and asked for a room change. They weren't able to make a change until the morning, so we went to sleep. We woke up sneezing in the morning from the musty air. We were contacted by the manager the next day around 8:30/9AM and offered a different room. This room smelled fine and looked like it had been recently refurbished, noted by the presence of flat-screen TVs (previous room had old tube TVs - see pictures, unfortunately I did not take any pics of the new room!). So, suffice it to say, problem corrected and we were happy room-wise with the rest of our stay. I would like to add that the hotel staff in general was very accommodating and customer service-oriented (although housekeeping seemed a little slow - we'd spend the morning at the pool, returning around 2PM and sometimes the room had not been serviced yet). It is true that the breakfast room can be very busy at times - there was a day or two where we had to wait quite long for the cooked-to-order (CTO) breakfast. Unfortunately, the "ready-to-eat" hot section is right in front of CTO, so inveritably if you just want to grab some scrambled eggs or pancakes, you have to politely push your way thru the line of people waiting for their CTO. The food is fine and pretty much the same as any other Embassy Suites. They seemed to have plenty of high chairs available although make sure you bring a wipe since some are not very thoroughly cleaned. We spent most of our time by the pool. It did not seem too crowded when we were there, since we could always find lounge chairs available. This pool is a toddler's paradise, because it has one section that is like a very shallow beach. The depth is extremely gradual and our toddler could walk-in about 15 feet before the water level was up to her neck (obviously, we were right there, but the point is that she could choose the depth where she was comfortable). There is also a separate kiddie pool with a fish fountain and a decent-sized playground. I remember some previous reviews showed a picture of a rickety old-school playground. That must be gone, since there is now a nice, modern plastic-based playground with a cushioned surface (the only thing I don't understand, and this goes for all plastic playgrounds, is that the slides are not shaded. Which means they get way too hot for use when it is sunny - and the Puerto Rican sun is strong.) Honestly, our toddler did not want to leave since she was enjoying herself so much (and it appeared that other families with babies/pre-schoolers were having a good time). Food at the pool bar was pretty good...it is very enticing when they fire up the grill mid-morning and you smell burgers being cooked. Most sandwiches seemed to be in the $8-10 range - I'd say the menu pricing (incl. drinks) was approximately the same as any mid-priced chain like Applebees. If you're a cheapskate, I guess you could drive to one of the many fast food joints at the entrance to the complex (about a 5 minute drive thru the golf course over many speed bumps). Besides fast food, there are several sit-down eating options outside the golf course complex - just ask the front desk for the list/map (BTW - there is a wonderful pastry shop/restaurant called "Sweet Ann's".) The beach is an artificial cove created by a breakwater. The view is great because the Atlantic seems to generate a lot of waves, so you see them constantly hitting the rocks outside the cove. Beach itself was OK, but if you're expecting sugar white sand and crystal-clear turquoise water, this is not your beach. To clarify, the water quality is fine and many people seemed to be enjoying it, but I have simply been to better beaches in south Florida, Thailand, south Pacific, etc. The manager's reception in the evening is quite good, better than many Embassy Suites that I have visited previously, with complimentary beer, wine, and mixed drinks. They have non-alcoholic selections (juice, cola, etc.) as well including "kiddie cocktails" but curiously, you can only get milk if you pay for it. Snacks were chips/salsa and popcorn. The TV selection was good, they have local channels as well as the American networks. Although the resort fee is annoying, it purportedly covers the "complimentary" bottled water tickets and "free" internet access. Hilton's web site clearly stated the resort fee up-front and I think that the total price paid was still a good value considering what is included (breakfast, mgr's reception, bottled water rations, internet). All in all - I would definitely stay here again if the price was right. If you're looking for a nice family place for relaxation away from the hustle and bustle of San Juan, this is it. One tip, though...if you have a flight before 10AM, I would leave about 3 hours before the departure time. The rush hour traffic can really crawl - we left about 7:15 and it took us 1.5 hours to get to the airport for a 9:40AM flight.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.......”
Reviews.Author: frehleycomet
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice. Yes it has a nice pool and hot tub. The beach area is small but clean. The hotel staff are friendly. My gripe about this hotel is the parking in which we had to pay $7.00 per day. Of course you think that this is included in your price when you book your reservation. It is not. As far as the room, if you enjoy looking out your porch and viewing a red roof then this is a hotel for you. We didn't even sit out on the porch to enjoy the sunrise because of the ridiculous view. 16 speed bumps to get to the hotel wasn't all that fun either. The only way I would stay here again is if it has better parking and next time I know about the 12% charge that won't sneak up on us at the end of our stay. I'm not quite sure if I would recommend this hotel to friends and family yet.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous setting, great value”
Reviews.Author: portlandorer
Reviews.Content: Superb rooms, beautifully kept, right on the beach, great happy hour (more than an hour of free drinks), fine restaurant, excellent breakfast, very pleasant staff, several free computers. Yes, there's an annoying resort fee and $7 per day parking (virtually everyone must drive here and there's no such thing as on street parking so that's also an annoyance), but given everything that you get here, it's a great value anyway. And it's just a short drive to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: mmbaum
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a family-friendly getaway and wanted to avoid the high costs and crowds of San Juan. Dorado is only about 30 minutes west of the airport and this hotel seemed to have everything we were looking for - great pool, it's own beach, free breakfast, suites with mini kitchen and private balcony, etc. We were very pleased to find everything met and exceeded our expections. The kids' playground and pool area was perfect, the beach was small, but we liked the fact that it was contained and safe for kids, breakfast and manager's happy hour were excellent added amenities. The layout and feel of the hotel were great and all accessible, which was great for using our stroller. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, especially the valets and bell staff. Our ocean view room was not available at check-in, but the hotel made up for it by discounting our rate for our whole stay and was great about helping us move all our stuff on day 2. From the hotel, if you have a car, it was very easy for us to get to El Yunque (about 1 hour drive) and Old San Juan (about 30 mins to the ferry at Catano). The only downside for us is that we are vegetarians, and the food choices beyond breakfast were slim to none. The pool bar had one veggie wrap and the lobby bar had a cheese quesadilla, but that was it. We eneded up going into town a few times for dinner, but a lot of the choices there were just fast food. We'd love to come back and are planning on it, but some healthy kids' food and veggie options would be great. Our kids pretty much lived on french fries all week. Rice & beans, veggie burgers, and more salads would be great additions.

Reviews.Title: “Beach bum heaven, bring: snorkel, old sneakers or water shoes”
Reviews.Author: beachbum99x
Reviews.Content: Excellent value; Food & beverage service on the private beach; Huts, palm trees, hot tub & lounge chairs in the courtyard; Friendly room service to your suite - with a private balcony; Experienced, friendly staff; mid-level, casual, & fast-food dining in the town of Dorado itself; Tennis & golf onsite; Good security; Business center; Car rental from the lobby and your American car insurance covers you in PR; Daily local newspaper in English; Good cell phone reception; Nice mix of families / boomers / retired folks / international visitors; Manager's reception has a nice bar; Safe neighborhood for walking with nice homes, condos, hotels, CVS & Walgreens too; Cokes are $1; free bottled water; Bacardi tour and the ferry to Old San Jaun in very close; We would gladly go again next year

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: saje173
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at Dorado Embassy Suites. We really enjoyed the hotel. As other reviews point out, it isn't a 5-star resort, but E/S provides value for the money. The service staff is friendly, efficient and doesn't hesitate to go the extra mile for guests. We asked for a late check-out, having an 8 pm flight, and they couldn't have been nicer about it. My few complaints would include the inconvenient parking--but I know this is a temporary situation caused by the construction of the garage and the casino; the old-school TV sets in the suites (I haven't seen a tube-style TV in a hotel in a long time) and most significantly, the breakfast, which, while complimentary and extensive, gets repetitious after 5 days. A little variety would be nice. But all of these are insignificant, compared to the lovely grounds, the pool and beach area, which are well-maintained, the evening cocktail hour, and the overall friendly and accommodating staff, which did everything possible to give us a memorable experience. The location is good, too--far enough from San Juan to be quiet and restful, but a quick half hour trip in, when you want the city's amenities. When the casino is open, I suspect many people will stay at the resort a lot more of the time! Renting a car is a "must"--the $65 cab fare to and from the airport makes the car practically a freebie.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Not a single complaint, look no further for a relax stay in PR close to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: JBFuentes
Reviews.Content: I am offering this review primary because I feel very impressed with the quality of service and product I received during my stay. I am a 39 years local from San Juan and decided to stay at this hotel I saw one time I went to play golf at Dorado del Mar Club. The Hotel offered me a great service during the 2 nights we stayed, and a great relaxing view of the Atlantic Ocean. Pools area, landscaping and fountains just invite you to stay outside the hotel. There are a variety of pools at the area. It is a "Hidden Gem" and a "Great Value". Maids, front service and all personnel service exceeded my expectations. The interior of the hotel is great. Nice sitting area around the fountains. For those looking for a casino, they are building one just across the street but at the right distance away from the hotel as to maintain the peaceful environment of the area. The beach area is very private and inviting and the water is tranquil. The sandy beach is separated from the pool area by a stone wall. The pool area is a little bit higher than the beach sand where you can seat and enjoy the view from above. Regarding dinning, there is no need to eat outside the hotel area. We enjoyed very much the evening 1 1/2 or 2 hours daily of free happy hour in the bar area. Fine dinning is offered. Hot Breakfast Buffet with served to order omelet is complimentary. During the day you can eat by the pool area and in the evening they serve more formal dishes inside. Price is very reasonable, even more economical than restaurants outside. We have a good time watching the people enjoying dancing with the karaoke man singing all kind of music very professionally. One detail we really like was the â€œartesanosâ€� selling fine local handcraft, jewelry and delicious typical candies from Puerto Rico. We saw two weddings and they have large activities rooms. Rooms are spacious - mine was a standard suite, with two areas - the bedroom and the living room with cink, microwave and sofa bed, and dinning table. Rooms are furnished with two TV sets. Beds are cosy. Complimentary bottled water is offer free as well as tower service at the pool area. I have not a single complaint and want to congratulate the management and the staff for such a nice representation of the tourist offer in Puerto Rico and inviting fine selected â€œartesanosâ€� to be at the hotel lobby. I think I just found my corner to do tourism in the island and we are going back to celebrate my birthday with some family and friends this April.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: bagcheck
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 1 week stay at this Embassy Suites in Dorado, Puerto Rico and absolutely loved our time there. My wife and I, along with our 12 and 14 year old daughters found this to be a great place to relax and enoy the weather, the pool, and the ocean. If you are planning an escape, we would highly recommend this hotel. But, you must understand what it is not as well as what it is. It is not the Ritz Carlton, so do not expect it. What you can expect, however, is OUTSTANDING service. We found everyone at the hotel to be very friendly, accomodating and quick with a smile. Luis at the front desk was a pleasure to talk to as well as Lynette at the pool bar. Everyone took time to give us their recommendations, whether it was regarding eating establishments, beaches, or local attractions. Everyone from the breakfast chef to the waiters and bartenders to the valets were extremely friendly. We found the facilities to be clean, the pool was very nice and clear, the beach, while small, was well maintained. We absolutely loved our stay and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to family and friends. Location - we liked the fact that it is not in San Juan and is, therefore, not as hectic. The only drawback is that there are not a lot of choices for restaurants, but we felt that is just a minor drawback. I would highly recommend you rent a car. It is not difficult to get into Old San Juan as there is a ferry about 20 minutes from the hotel that takes you across the bay for 50 cents per person and drops you off at the cruise ship docks. This makes it very easy to get into Old San Juan. Overall, we give this a 2 thumbs up!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LuisEdg
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the hotel 3 hours early for "check-in" and the room was already prepared. The room was very comfortable and clean. The pool area was very clean and the beach was also nice. There is a two hours period time 5:30 to 7:30 that include free beverages (some whiskey, tequila, vodka and others) and snacks. I found this hotel in general very pleasant to stay with the family and to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb facilities and service-great decision to say here!”
Reviews.Author: beau42m
Reviews.Content: This hotel has superb service and a breathtaking location on the Atlantic Ocean. The public areas are well landscaped with plenty of greenery and waterfalls/fountains. The beach is on a enclosed area protected by rock breakwaters. Not too deep. Just buy a $3 air mattress at the nearby Walgreens and float to you heart's content. Towel and water bottle service are provided for free at the the pool area. Restrooms in the pool area are clean and well maintained. The golf at the Del Mar course is kind of pricey by my standards, the course has plenty of slope which makes it fun. Also plenty of benign iguanas. Room service by the maids and engineers is great. Front desk staff are courteous and always call you by your first name instead of "Mr surname" once they learn your name. It's a Puerto Rican tradition, I read it on a sign at the airport. There is a nice outlet mall about 15-20 miles west of the hotel on Route 22 in a town called Barceloneta at exit 55. They have a Chili's and a Ponderosa restaurant. Plus all the name brand stores.The only con that we could say about our experience in Dorado, unrelated to the Embassy Suites, is the lack of value/quality in the local restaurants surrounding the hotel. They do have an Applebees nearby. Take a day and check out the El Yunque rainforest, it won't disappoint. My GPS system did not pick up a lot of attractions near and around Dorado. Have a good time. I would return and recommend this facility heartily to others! Samuel M, West Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and amenities - we would stay here again !”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysLikeToTravel
Reviews.Content: In early December 2009, my husband and I stayed at the E. S. Dorado del Mar for 5 nights. I had read these positive and negative reviews before we booked our stay, was aware of the issues and was a bit nervous. However, after having stayed at this resort, I would not hesitate to stay here again and to recommend this resort to other travelers - we loved it! The hotel is beautiful and clean, the grounds have lush vegetation, indoor atrium is bright with tables to relax at, and it had all the amenities we were looking for. The included daily breakfast buffet was convenient and very good with numerous choices, had great omelettes, and everything we needed. The free daily nightly Manager's reception was an excellent plus to wind down after an active day. We had a rental car and went to several good Dorado restaurants at night, as recommended by the front desk. We ate at Villa Dorada D'Alberto and our favorite for several visits was "Antojitos del Kitrinche". Sure, self parking at the hotel was a challenge at times due to the construction but this is a temporary inconvenience and the staff always and quickly offered valet parking to us. We did not find this an issue. The beach area is protected by a rock reef and is great for easy and safe swimming - a nice idea. It's not a long calm beach as some tourists expect, but that's because you're on the active north coast of the island with big waves. The pool was broken up nicely into different sections and we enjoyed it. Yes, there were kids but the security staff stopped any diving or unruly behavior. Our room was a clean bright beautiful 2-room suite with a great balcony and everything we wanted; we loved it. The free daily bottled water and coffee was a nicety. We were very fortunate to meet Hotel Manager Marisol Colon during our stay - she's warm and personable, is very visible around the hotel, is on top of things, greeted us several times during our stay, and will recommend or assist you during your stay if given the opportunity, as she helped us. The same positiveness can be said of every hotel staff person (front desk, poolside, maids, restaurants, parking) that we met - they worked hard, were very friendly, and tried to please us and make our stay enjoyable. We're just two ordinary but frequent travelers; this was our 1st trip to Puerto Rico. Numerous travelers in this forum had hotel complaints but they mentioned them after returning home so how can the hotel staff help you... ?! I'm sure there are some legitimate complaints about noise, long lines, crowded areas and unruly groups during the peak holiday vacation breaks, but this can be said of any resort at their busiest times. That's why we travel at quieter times and when school is in session. As at any hotel, there are small places and off-peak times that you can find to get away from the crowds. We did not have an opportunity to play on the resort's golf course but hope to next time. Reading back on these reviews - I think some travelers will always complain about any thing, especially if it's a little different than what they are use to at home so put those negative comments into perspective. And many of the travelers are vacationing during the busiest times of the year when everyone else is traveling too and the resorts are packed. Don't miss out on a great resort with great staff ! We had a wonderful relaxing vacation here, and we hope to return here. We were glad we stayed in a small town instead of in busy, crowded San Juan. Again, we highly recommend this resort. ...and the singing of the small Coqui frogs on the patio grounds each night was an added bonus !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greekadventurer
Reviews.Content: This could have been a great hotel, other than the fire alarms going off all night long. We stayed at the hotel for several nights and the first 4 nights were great, but when a group of high schoolers came into the hotel, the fire alarms were going off every two hours. Other than that, the food and drink was good. Pool is beautiful and location was great. Go outside of the hotel if you would like to have a nice dinner meal, at a fair price, with ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: VDJTraveler
Reviews.Content: Was definitely not impressed with this hotel. Being a Hilton Honors Diamond member I expected a lot more from the hotel. Could not get an oceanview room - had a view of the golf course and the construction going on. The room smelled musty - complained at the front desk but the other two rooms the hotel showed us also smelled musty. The wait staff at the restaurant was inattentive - probably because a 15% gratuity is automatically added to the check. Breakfast was a complete zoo - long lines for the made to order breakfast, buffet breakfast items were cold or not in good supply. Forget the managers' cocktail hour unless you want to wait in line 30 minutes for a couple drinks. The self-park lot was terribly small. Definitely would not stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing christmas break”
Reviews.Author: cstaley
Reviews.Content: 3 weeks before christmas we decided to try to get away. We found this embassy suites to be avaiable and reasonably priced. Unfortunately all rental cars were sold out but the hotel arranged for us to be picked up which went very smoothly($65) one way. Check in was easy and quick. The room was clean and had a microwave and refrig. The pool area is great the beach is small. This was a very relaxing family vacation with the teen kids. Golf courses across the street. Breakfast is included but absolutely the same everyday. The only problem with this hotel is its isolation. Their one restaurant for dinner has average food and a menu that is 1/3 of the menu on it's web site. Lunch is an entree and french fries.The town of Dorado is 1 mile away but you either need to walk or pay a cab $32( family of 4) for a round trrip(5 min ride, a total rip off). We I question the staff about the cab fare and I was told they have no say in the matter and do not provide any shuttles like most embassy suites. SO YOU MUST HAVE A CAR. There are not many good restaurants nearby but the chophouse is excellent. Overall, we had a great time except for the cab rip off experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Resort, Great Value, Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler24
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-day four-night stay at the Embassy Suites Dorado. We can't say enough great things about it and our first-time experience in Puerto Rico! Reading some of these reviews, it's clear some people are looking for the Four Seasons; this isn't a Four Seasons, it's an Embassy Suites with a laid-back, family feeling, great value -- including complimentary breakfast that would cost you $15 a piece at any hotel restaurant and a nightly "manager's reception" with free drinks and snacks that would also cost at least $10 a person anywhere else -- and most of all, an attentive, friendly, and caring staff. Our two-room ocean-view suite had obviously been done over recently and was clean, bright, and modern. The pool area was delightful and not crowded; there's a small beach with a breakwater that gives you a terrific view of the crashing surf, but is protected, so good for swimming and wading. There's a poolside bar and restaurant with excellent food, drinks and service for lunch. The location is not bad, near the town of Dorado, in a gated golf community. Outside the gates are all the comforts of "home" with a Walgreens, several chain restaurants, but also some nice local restaurants. You DEFINITELY need to rent a car at the airport; there is nothing in walking distance and your cab trips to and from the airport will cover the cost of a car for a week, I'm sure (Look out for aggressive drivers and incomprehensible traffic patterns island-wide). Our favorite restaurants were a local Benihana-type place, "The Chop House," a family owned casual steak place called "The Crazy Bull Steak House," and a lovely restaurant with outdoor dining called "La Terraza". All were recommended by the hotel, which provided detailed maps and called ahead for us. That brings us to the greatest selling point of the hotel, the incredibly personable and helpful staff. Everyone we dealt with, from our check in to the restaurant to the pool security could not have done enough for us. But special mention goes to General Manager Marisol Colon, who greeted us (we'd seen her quoted here on Trip Advisor) and made us feel like old friends, and to front desk manager Isaias Rodriguez. In additioning to making excellent food and sightseeing recommendations, we had a bit of a crisis on our third day: I came down with an ear infection. He directed us to a local "urgent care" medical facility, called ahead on my behalf, and I was seen by a terrific young doctor who prescribed antibiotics and a regimen for making sure I could fly the next day. (Thank goodness for that Walgreen's). I've traveled extensively for work and pleasure and have visited the Caribbean several times; the entire experience here was exemplary. If you are looking for wild nightlife or an activity-intense resort, this is not the place; if you would like a mellow, family-friendly resort with lovely rooms, a laid-back vibe, and a terrific staff, this is great! (Just hope the casino, which is under construction, doesn't change the character of the place!)

Reviews.Title: “Quite & Cozy”
Reviews.Author: fortininers
Reviews.Content: We select this hotel for our Aniversary over one near San Juan Airport Area. It was well worth of our 25 mile drive, as hotel appear to real quite and cozy. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Front Desk agent name Gustav who was above and beyond to take care of guest. Upon getting in our room, our room was decore by staff for our occation as well as fresh fruit platter was deliever to room as warm welcome which made me fill- I am at home. Neilka -evening manager on duty was helpfull on finding us restaurant as we request with direction. Evening reception is warm touch. Gettin in pool or going to beach is just outside of our room was real nice specially in 90+ temperatur. Excellant golf course. Israel - morning agent was great help in finding all direction that we need to do our sitseeing. Having printed direction at fingertip made our driving around Purto Rico much easier. Breakfast - Hot breakfast every morning with order to cook omlett was great - even if I had to wait in line for 10 minute or so.... it is well worth over precook breakfast. I strongly recomend for those who do not mind driving little and save lot! During our stay we interface number of employee in different area - from restaurant to pool to parking lot. Everyone is well trained to serve their guest. Finally we got to meet GM- Marisol Colon as we were checking out. Her personality made me believe why rest of her staff is so friendly and helpfull. Good Job Ms. Colon. Let see if you can keep Neilka quiet? Keep up the constancy and good work. ps: If you do drive from San Juan, I find Rt 165 is much better drive and feel sorter then Rt 22.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great staff and we will return.”
Reviews.Author: Etherlycc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Embassy Suites for 4 nights in November 2009 over thanksgiving. Although we arrived before noon on our first day we were checked in immediately and effiently with our requests for a high floor and away from the elevator both met. Having stayed in Embassy suite resorts before we knew what to expect and were not dissapointed. The staff were all very friendly and nothing was a problem. Breakfast was excellent, very efficeint (even when busy) and plenty of choice. The managers reception was the best we have had at a Embassy resort, again no problems even when busy. The pool area is very good and although we had no children with us the area was fine for all age groups well provided for. The beach is fine ansd loungers were never a problem. We also ate in the dinning room one night for dinner and the food and service were both excellent. Overall we had a great stay here and will not hesitate to stay again when we are in the area. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay most rememberable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LatribuNyc
Reviews.Content: I travel a bit, and stay at the Ritz Resort in PR and Key Biscane FL most of the time. I stayed for 2 days at the Embassy Dorado. Its Wonderful at this resort! Its only a 40 minute drive from the Airport, and Isla Verde.The Two room suites were very spacious and comfortable, The room view, the breakfast, and service was just awesome! Thanks Sammy and Staff. And with a new Casino coming soon! Look Out Ritz!!!! I had a wonderful time, and I will return.You can also get something fast to eat right outside the complex. "GPS" Hello! Look for it, and you will find it. I had no problem with my GPS and Internet. And the instructions are in English.;o) Some of the reviews I read are from people that are just a pain in the butt to please. This Resort is one of the best in Puerto Rico. If anyone needs info on this resort please contact me. MS Colon Wonderful job! See you in FEB 2010. GOD BLESS Nelson Perez Latribu Music

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: SeashoreTrips
Reviews.Content: For me the hotel location was excellent as I didn't want to be in San Juan. Also, I had a rental car and so never hired taxis etc. I was at the hotel from Tuesday until the following Monday. The hotel is up its own semi-private (gated) drive and you drive past/through the golf course. (I don't play golf so I can't say if it's a good course or not but it looked very nice.) There was some building work going on at the hotel because they're building a new casino as well as a multi-story parking lot. There was very little construction noise even though my room was a golf-course view room which slightly faced the construction site. The only minor problem was parking but that was handled as well as could be expected under the circumstances. I never had any problems with it. The hotel staff were always very helpful and accommodating. The complimentary cooked breakfast was extensive and very good and we sometimes also has a couple of free cocktails in the evening. I didn't sample the restaurant. The hotel did get full up at the weekend and the parking lot was displayed as "full" but as a hotel guest I didn't have a problem. The breakfast area did get very busy at the weekend but was managed well by the staff. If you want a quieter time, they have the busy/quiet times displayed on a sign. I did go to the pool and beach on the Monday (see photos) so I don't know how it was over the weekend but there didn't seem to be many (young) children running around so I don't think it would have been overcrowded. I often used the WiFi in my room and was getting DSL-type speeds (e.g. 0.52Mbps down and 0.25Mbps up). The suite was very spacious and for the two of us we had room to spare. I know it's probably a little over-the-top to give 5 stars for everything at the hotel but really, I didn't have a problem with anything and also the rate I paid was very reasonable. The local town of Dorado seems to have a bit of a night life but again, I didn't sample it. This was my first trip to Puerto Rico. My girlfriend recently moved back there - temporarily - to help look after a sick relative and so I had a great excuse to visit! The location was excellent for me as she's near Arecibo and so I didn't want to stay at a San Juan hotel (which is about an hour further away from her). Being a native English speaker (Brit) without almost any Spanish, I have to say that Puerto Rico was a very "easy" destination compared to somewhere such as Mexico or Spain because not only is there no money conversion problem (because it's all U.S. currency) but many of the businesses are familiar (e.g. WalMart, Home Depot, Burger King etc.) and many of the smaller businesses have signs just in English! (e.g. "Hair Salon", "Nails"). Of course, having a Spanish-speaker with me most of the time did sometimes come in useful because - obviously - not all the people speak English, although a good proportion seem to understand it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatGlynns
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suite while visiting family in Vega Baja. The staff was very attentive and the accomodations were very nice. Love the breakfast with everything you will ever want to have and the happt hour. The pool is very nice...While the beach was small I was disappointed that it was a little dirty ( not a Hotel problem as the beach is a public beach). I will recommend this hotel and will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel great View a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: caribla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the way if you have business in San Juan but with a car the commute is not bad. Much cheaper than staying at Isla Verde and I found getting into San Juan from Dorado much easier than from Isla Verde

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast but Outdated Interior”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravs
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is a bit of a disappointment. It has an outdated interior, and our room had evidence of water stains on the wall. The beach is also very small. However, the pool was quite nice, and the views of the ocean were beautiful. The rooms are very spacious, and the breakfast was excellent; the buffet had many choices, both hot and cold. This hotel definitely could use some updates, but we had an enjoyable stay nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “BIG MISTAKE”
Reviews.Author: lmorrow26
Reviews.Content: The Embassy looks beautiful on line but a whole different story when you get there. The room was sooooo old and outdated. The sofa was so dirty, floors not cleaned very well. The bed was hard, old hotel and not kept up with over the years. Has a nice pool and hot tub but forget thinking you will enjoy yourself, the hot tub every evening so full of kids we never was able to use it. We ended up renting a car and drove south and stay in another resort for the rest of the week and found a beautiful paradise, so at least the end of our trip was worth it. If you are looking for a nice relaxing place to go stay away from this place!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed from the start”
Reviews.Author: itruitt
Reviews.Content: I looked up this hotel on the web to see great pictures of this hotel, we got there and were very disappointed to find out that the hotel in under construction in the parking area, and adding a casino and more parking coming in 2010. Great, but in the mean time, the place to park and around the entrance is a mess!!! We got a partial ocean view that we paid for only to be place above the large and long hotel trash dumpster, which everytime we went to look at our small ocean view, got to smell the trash. Also, the pool area and beach area are very very small for the mounds of guests they try to accomodate too, yes, residents in the resort area and the beach/vacation club also get to use the pool and beach area, very crowded, and not very much to do at all. Also, hotel in most areas was dirty, dirty windows, trash in lobby and in elevators, broken lights in the pool floating. Just not a good hotel, good price, and nice and free managers reception nightly from 5:30-7:30pm and the made to order breakfast was also nice, and that was about it. We left the hotel early by 5 days and transferred to the El Conquestador that we would highly recommend in Farajado.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Geotrio
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a first time visit to Puerto Rico. We researched alot of hotels before choosing a more budget friendly hotel, the Embassy Suites with their advertised breakfast included and happy hour each day. However, we arrived on a Saturday on what we found out later was the equivalent of P.R.'s 4th of July celebration. I literally cannot describe how many people were packed into our hotel's swimming pool, beach area, and the hotel itself. Children running around the entire hotel screaming constantly, people getting on and off the elevators soaking wet, lines for the happy hour were long and if you went to breakfast anytime after 7:30 in the morning the lines were ridiculously long. It also felt like we were fighting for our food and tables every morning at bkfst. Not relaxing at all. We like kids and families but this was beyond anything we thought it would be. We did not know the timeshares/condos shared our pool and the entire week we were there they were constantly overrun with tons of people. The pool stayed open 24/7 while we were there but we only got in twice because there were so many kids in it and the water looked "murky". Never got in the beach/ocean at our hotel. Also, the hotel was definitely where people from Puerto Rico take their vacations, not a tourist hotel at all. On the plus side, if there was one, all of the staff was very friendly, the valet parking was extremely quick when requesting our car every day, and the room was nice and clean. Great view of the ocean from our room. However, for a first time visitor to P.R. I would not recommend this hotel. It could have also been that we were there the last week of July which like I mentioned, was a national holiday. Not a good idea because everywhere we went that week it was packed with people.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews from the last year and went to this hotel with caution and with an open mind. The hotel was easy to find with the help of GPS. Parking will cost you 7 dollars a day. It did not seem too bad of a deal, but it should be part of the room rate if you ask me. What did make me mad was on friday, saturday, and sunday the hotel becomes very busy and full with several events in the ball rooms. I was forced to park several blocks away along a golf course. For 7 bucks you should not have to walk several blocks away just to park along a road. I am glad it was a rental car because parking along a golf course can be very dangerous. I never had a single complaint against the staff. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. They always greeted me with a smile and asked what they could do for me. The room was just what I would expect from an Embassy. We had a great view of the ocean and the pool. The room was clean and comfortable. The only thing that concerned me was that there was a black substance around the airvents. It looked like it was mold. The managers special was great. Two hours of free drinks, popcorn, and chips. The bartenders were friendly and knowledgeable. The breakfast was always hot and fast. We ate at the restaurant one time. The food was very good. The bill for the 3 of us was 75 dollars with tip. We bought food and the grocery store down the street and saved a lot of money. The beach turned out better than I thought. I was expecting garbage all over from the past reviewers. This was not the case. The hotel must be paying attention and have since cleaned things up. The beach is surrounded by a rock jetty so there are no waves. During high tide we were able to snorkel over the weed beds. Other reviewers were right about a couple of things. The hotel becomes busy on fridays, saturdays, and sundays with locals. The pool is very packed. We always had plenty of room on the beach. It does get noisey in the lobby on the weekendswith bands and screaming kids. The pool turned out to very nice. I did not see the broken tiles that others reviewed about so they must have did some repairs lately. One word of caution....On the weekends they have several events in their ballrooms. The band/dj played until 1 a.m. I found this to be unexceptable for a hotel. We had spent the day surfing in Rincon and were very tired on saturday night, but we could not sleep do to the pounding of the music. This went on until 1 in the morning. When I complained I found out that all of the rooms were sold out. They did give us a voucher for room service, refunded the night, and refunded some of my resort fees. This helped to make up for the loss of sleep. At least they were willing to work with me. I recommend renting a car with GPS. Restaurants, shopping, and other beaches are not within walking distance. A great hotel away from tourists. Overall I was very happy of the quality versus the cost of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico: Embassy Suites Dorado del Mar Beach & Golf Resort”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from last weekend at the Embassy Suites Dorado. The hotel is magnificent facilities and we have never experienced such incredible service before. The pool is beutifull, our kids are 4 and 6 year and they enjoyed it. The pool attendants were wonderful and the pool restaurant have excelent service with great apetizers. I want to returne as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly0187
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it said it was family friendly. I was traveling alone with my two children ages 8 and 9. It has a beautiful lobby and my kids loved the pool. The complementary breakfast was fantastic. It had something for everyone. The poolside lunch area didn't have much on the menu and was a little expensive for what you got but it was okay. We didn't spend alot of time hanging out at the hotel but the time we did spend there was really great. The room was clean and roomy. The room had a small fridge and sink. The bed was and pillows were very comfortable. They charge a lot for parking and also for internet access. On the weekends they have some live music in the bar area it was fun. The staff was all friendly and spoke good English. The beach was nice and sheltered from the waves. No snorkeling here. My kids loved the Iguanas out on the golf course. I would stay here again with my kids and family. It is out of San Juan but the drive is not that far.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: bquan_9
Reviews.Content: After reading several mixed reviews of this resort, I went with an open mind and realistic expectations. Upon arrival, first impression of the grounds were favorable, although we were turned off to the fact that the resort is in the middle of residential property. The golf course is not well maintained, but playable none the less. We checked in with ease; staff was pleasant. This is a family friendly hotel, so couples or adults who don't want alot of screaming kids running around, should go elsewhere!! We got to our room, and were disappointed with the view. We paid alot for a partial oceanview room and we got a room overlooking the employee parking lot, with the ocean to the left. For the money we paid for this room, we could have gotten a full ocean view in Mexico (which is where we would have gone if it were'nt for the Swine flu epidemic!) After we were settled in our room, we went to take advantage of the manager's reception. I must say, that the 2 hours of free drinking made up for alot of the resort's shortcomings. We arrived on Friday afternoon, and there was live entertainment every Friday and Saturday in the hotel bar which was nice. The full service free breakfast was very good and also made up for the resort's shortfalls. The waitstaff was pleasant and very accomodating. Now, on to the pool area... The resort's pool is in desperate need of repair. There were broken tiles (which could pose a safety issue as there were lots of kids at the resort). The pool could have been cleaner, but with the sweltering temperature, we took advantage. A couple of feet from the pool is a small beach which is public. The beach grounds were dirty and not maintained. There were lots of shady characters there, and we did'nt feel safe, which was a turn off for us. The beach was very disappointing!! The resort has a poolside bar that serves food as well. The bar area was overrun by crows and pigeons and lots of bird poop! We tried to overlook it, but it's kinda hard when a bird is taking a dump on the empty seat next to you!!! In spite of that, we still kept an open mind. Be careful when it comes to ordering drinks, there are no prices for many of the drinks listed on their drink list. My husband and I were hit with a $75.00 bar bill for 2 pitchers of Sangria!!!! Needless to say, from that moment on, we waited for the free drinks from 5:30 to 7:30!!! The food at the poolside bar was nothing special as was the case in the only resturant at the resort; which by the way has about the same menu as the bar. There are local restuarants within 5 miles that are authentic cuisine, as well as some familiar fast food and convenience stores. If you can read spanish, rent a car!!! Taxicabs are ridiculously priced; $45-65 from the airport and anywhere else you want to go. We took an excursion to Old San Juan and it cost us $90 round trip!!! Keep in mind if you rent a car, the resort charges $7 to park in addition to the 10% resort fee that they tack onto your bill upon checkout. We prepaid for our trip, but upon checkout, they charged us an additional $70 in resort fees and taxes!!!! In summary, for the money we paid for a 4-nite getaway, we really should have gotten more for our money. We had better expectations for a resort that has the Embassy Suites/Hilton name. The Hilton Corporate headquarters should be ashamed embarrassed to claim this resort as their own. We have stayed at Hilton and Embassy Suite hotels in the U.S. on numerous occasions and have always been satisfied with our accomodations. We would never have expected this resort to be in such deplorable condition. We will not recommend this resort to anyone. This resort does not deserve to carry the name of Embassy Suites!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your have earned Dollars”
Reviews.Author: Crewella
Reviews.Content: Well the free breakfast was good! Ok now on with the review. This place is far from San Jaun and cab ride one way is $70.00 but that depends on how many of you there are. We rented a car for that reason got a rental for $116.00 for the week but when I got to the counter I was told that I had to buy collision for another $98.00 can you say rip off! Ok so on to the hotel. Got there 3:30 pm they gave us a room right away which was great until we got into it. It was dirty smelled horrible and was in need of some serious TLC. Didn't want to dwell on the room we had a long flight and just wanted to get to the pool and relax. We go down to the pool first thing I notice is that it is in disrepair. Tiles missing or broken all around the sides( nice scratches on kids back) water not clear and plenty of stuff floating around in it. Now there was something I couldn't ignore random young men roaming around and in the pool. What I didn't know was the beach which is Gross by the way is public!!!!! Now from what I was told people on the not registered hotel guests are not allowed to use the pool. What a crock! So you pay up to $200.00 a night and they use it for free no wonder you have to pay a resort fee but god knows what your paying for they certainly don't use the money for the upkeep on the place. Bottomline we did not feel comfortable or safe. Now back to the room we went back to the room so we could change and go to Burger King so we could spend $20.00 on food for 4 instead on $80.00 at the resort. So we changed and go out while I'm out I buy a few things to put in the fridge we get back and I open the fridge it smells like someone left fish in it!!!!!! The smell resonated through the whole room I'm not kidding When I called for a new one they said they would be right up that didn't happen I waited while the boys checked out the hotel. Two hours later still no one showed up so we left to got get dinner. When I came back thinking I would have a new fridge I opened it and bam no new fridge just the smell of dead fish! I had one of the boys unplug it and put it in the hallway. I called the frontdesk and they said they would take care of it. They did and that was that. I put my water away but threw out the mill because it was sitting out for a while although on ice I didn't trust it because the airconditioning was not working all that well. At 3:00am I wanted a water it was very dry in the room I opened the fridge it was bearly even cool so I turned it up and went back to bed. The next morning engineering comes to the room about the fridge he asks where the other fridge is I told him we put it in the hall he seemed very irked by that then gave me attitude because I turned the fridge up to coldest setting. All he kept saying was there would be a block of ice in the back and that it's a lot of work to chip it off and not good for the fridge. By this time I had had enought we had been there for 17 hours! I called the travel company we booked through and they were more than happy to help. I spoke we the hotel manager on duty and informed her that I was not comfortable and felt unsafe and all she could say was well come down to my office and we can discuss it. By that time I was done with this place! Upon checking out I was told I would have to pay the resort fee and taxes and parking, the least they could have done was refund my entire nights stay including the charges I mentioned. As it was all I wanted to do was leave. They were willing to put me in the other San Jaun location but I choose re Dorado location because I had teenege boys with me and didn't want them getting into any trouble. Drinking age is 18 in Puerto Rico. I moved to the El Conquistador in Fajardo it is very nice beautiful grounds , staff is friendly and professional. Only kicker is I am not getting a refund for hotel portion of my trip for 30 days so I had to spend another $900.00 for this hotel for the rest of the week. Now have read that it is expensive to eat here those rumors are all true it is very expensive but so was the Embassy Suites they wanted $20.00 for pasta. Same at El Conquistador but the resort is 1000 times nicer and safer! All and all the one night I spent at Embassy Suites Dorado was one night too many!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother - with Puerto rico in general”
Reviews.Author: Klavins
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just okay. The staff were very pleasant; and the hotel itself was just okay. The resort fee was ridiculous, and the parking fees are ridiculous. You absolutely MUST have a rental car because there is only one operating restaurant and it's not much to talk about. "Cab" fares from the hotel are absolutely outrageous - We had to pay $16 one way to get a ride about 1 mile or so from the property to another restaurant - restaurants in the area are all pricey and the only other options that will be provided are US chain restaurants (KFC, Taco Bell, etc). I would think that Embassy Suites could at least provide complimentary parking OR complimentary golf cart rides to the entrance of the property (which is a LONG walk from the hotel). This trip will be our last to Puerto Rico - for more fun, more beauty, and more to do at a lower cost, go ANYWHERE in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: lola35Ma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice for people with young children. The breakfast was good. I would not get the eggs or the hash browns only because I found them to be cold. So ended up getting the bagels or english muffins which was fine. At night, if you eat at the restaurant be patient with the waitress because the service is very slow. But the food was good for hotel food! The food near the pool area is ok. You really do not have a choice because that is the only place to eat when by the pool. On the weekends, the hotel opens the pool and beach to the locals (which I didn't like at all!) so I would suggest booking for Monday thru Friday and be gone for the Sat. and Sun. locals!! If you get sick of the hotel food you got to eat at Moreno's. It is about 5 minutes by cab.

Reviews.Title: “Room improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: fishingcarlos
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Embassy several times. Unfortunately, it's the only hotel in the area, so if you need to be here, you're really just stuck with this one 'choice'. They bank on this, because the property has declined significantly over the years. Others have described the pool and beach area accurately. I'll just add that the beach is very dirty (with manmade trash), and shoes should be worn at all times. I don't come here for vacation, so my review is more geared toward the inside rather than the outside of the hotel. Staff is pleasant and efficient. Room service is slower than necessary, but it is island time and I allow for that. The main issues I have are with the room furnishings. There is one lamp in the living area now--the floor lamps have disappeared. The fixture that was over the dining/work the table has been replaced with a flush mount ceiling light and there is a laser like work lamp on the table...all with very very low voltage bulbs (yes, they are 'green' but I can't see anything in the room!) Coffee tables have been removed, no pillows on the sofa. Very uncomfortable living quarters. The bedroom is better due to the extra natural light. On the up side, the carpet and mattresses were finally replaced a couple of years ago---but in the humid climate it was very overdue. Overall, it is a dark, uncomfortable space---something that could be fixed with proper lighting, furnishings and detailed cleaning. Other than a quick breakfast, I've not eaten in the hotel restaurant, but get room service. It's ok but very expensive. The restaurant across the driveway is now closed due to casino construction. Locally, Morena's is good and I really like the Chop House (asian) in the Paseo del Plata shopping center about a mile away. Hilton, you need to pay some attention to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoTigahs
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel. As previously noted, the parking was a hassle; but, we always found parking....some are complaining b/c they didn't rent a car and transportation was expensive....I think that may be due to lack of research. We rented a car; so, getting around wasn't a problem. We liked coming back to our sanctuary. The complimentary breakfast was great....on the day we drove to the rainforest, we made PB&J sandwiches from the offerings on the breakfast buffet and brought them with us (along with fruit). It is easy to hop on 22 and get to where you want to go, also a short coastal drive to Bacardi. The best is the 2 hour Manager's reception! Free drinks for 2 hours. The staff helped with a driver (Angel) the night we thought we may have a few drinks at dinner and didn't want to drive. The staff also helped with a nice restaurant, La Morena. The beach is my only complaint--it has a burn pile on the side of it which isn't attractive. There did seem to be a lot of nonguests around the hotel pool (not sure why it is gated with this happeing). There was also a number of fast food/convenience stores right outside the property gates.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for beach vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Lrmrtn
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of negative reviews on this hotel so I wasn't sure what to expect, but overall, we were very pleased with our stay. It is true that the parking situation is not ideal since the area is under construction. We were always able to find spots but had to leave our keys with the attendant even though we self-parked, in case they had to move it. I had read in previous reviews that the pool area was loud and overrun with children. True, there were a lot of families but they were not disruptive. The pool area was very crowded on the weekends from the timeshare, but we never had a problem finding chairs and were not inconvenienced at all. They do have a right to use the pool after all. The beach area is small but it was fairly clean and the water was calm enough to swim in due to the rock breakers. The room was a suite so it was spacious enough and clean. We even received a free upgrade to an ocean view room. Breakfast was good for a complementary breakfast. You could choose from omelets, eggs, potatoes, pancakes, etc. But the line for the omelets gets really long if you get to breakfast after 8. Overall we enjoyed our stay and thought it was worthwhile for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great golf”
Reviews.Author: rochette
Reviews.Content: The Dorado Del Mar has very interesting and challenging holes, many with forced carries. This is not normally a busy course so we were able to breakfast at our leisure and walk to the course and tee off. I would recommend calling for a tee time if you plan to play on a Saturday morning. There are discounted rates after 12 noon and again after 3 pm. There are 4 other courses, the Hyatt Dorado East and West courses and the Plantation and Sugarcane courses are just down the street and were fun to play. We preferred the Dorado Del Mar at the Embassey Suites for golf. Many more interesting holes and less expensive. For sightseers, the location is midway between the Rio Caves and the Rain Forest. You can easily get into Old San Juan via the ferry at Catano for 50 cents each way. The ferry is about 20 minutes away from the hotel.
