The Barcardi Rum factory is also in Catano which offers free tours. The hotel offers a great breakfast buffet and nightly drinks in the bar - complimentary! The rooms were ok, clean and comfortable but the bedroom portion is at the rear off the balcony with the living room/kitchenette as you enter. It should probably be reversed. The front room was dark and unwelcoming. The pool area is comfortable for all, with a separate childrens' area, grassy areas with lounge chairs facing the beach or ocean and of course the sandy beach area. There were too many children using the hot tub. I would have preferred that the hotel limit the hours that children could use it. (There is only one) The hotel is currently adding a casino building and high rise parking facility but I don't know when it's suppose to be ready. There is no evening entertainment except on Fri. and Sat. pm. (One restaurant is currently closed) The ocean is too shallow to do anything with. You'd have to wade out quite far to be impacted by the waves. Some people were snorkling which would work. Overall, this is a nice hotel away from it all but still close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: bgg99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not worth the money we paid and is far from the airport, a $62 cab ride. it has one functioning restaurant, (the italian place Oregano was closed )so we could only eat in the one place they had open. When we checked in the desk clerk made no mention of this fact and told us Oregano was open. The pool area is not bad but the bar area(sea horse) has disgusting upholstery seating that has bird crap all over it . As well forget about getting a drink pool side served to you. Not once did a server come by asking for drink orders.We could never go in the jacuzzi as was filled with as many as 10 kids all the time and none of the staff seemed to enforce the 15 min rule posted not to mention there parents were feeding them in the jacuzzi which is pretty nasty. Also the locals use this place as a public pool freely as noted lots of non hotel guests hanging about and were obviously not staying at the hotel. Its great to pay $200 per nite and have the local riff raff with you using it freely! The room needs some serious updating and had a musty, damp smell to it. It was also dirty and appeared to not have been vacummed and the towels were very poor quality. The Dorado area has nothing going on at nite. You should really stay in San Juan proper near or at one of the big hotels and pay the extra money. Upon the day of checkout we got trapped in an Elevator as the power in the hotel went out and were stuck in there for 10 minutes. The staff is nice, no complaint there but slow and un-attentive. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Lightie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in total. The resort is about a 30-40 minute drive from the Airport and it cost approx 75 dollars! The suites were very spacious and the Balcony view was beautiful. The Beds were very comfortable and the room was spotless. The spread of food for breakfast was amazing. There was something to suit every taste. Though I would say to go early. On our first morning we arrived down at 9.30 and it was packed.... The Beach is a very small area and there are very few places to lay in the shade if you are wary of the sun...I was surprised at the amount of rubbish on the beach..(Beer cups, Cans etc...) The pool was very big and the location of the beach bar is ideal. The restaurant food was ok, we took some time with our starters and as a result, our mains came out luke warm! Wasn't too impressed with this! The gym is well equipped, three treadmills, two cross trainers a reclining bike and free weights. Its air conditioned too and there are towels and water (it is open 24 hours). There is a games room in the basement also. I would say that this resort is suited to families and young students mainly. I thought it was a little overpriced, but maybe that is just me! Also, be sure to check your itemised bill on departure, I was charged for parking in error, however, there was no quibble!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sledge518
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Dorado, and first stay at this resort (7 day stay). Loved the grounds, semi-secure entry (manned front gate). The property is shared by several other smaller communities that were quite nice, and quiet! We rented a car from Enterprise with no problems. Driving in PR is interesting to say the least (don't under stand why everyones is in such a rush!) however renting a car was niace to have the freedom to come and go as we please. We enjoyed a day trip into Old San Juan, and several nights our at local resturants. The food at the resort is all the same, and gets old after a longer stay. Service is good, I wished that the bartenders were a little more friendly. The pool was great, and beach (public) was enjoyed by all encluding our 4 year old. Ya there is some cups, and misc items left laying around, but instead of complaining, just pick them up! There are children here, and it does get busy, however having that in mind its fun whatching our child interact with others! This resort is not high-end by any means, will meet your needs. Parking is tight, construction is on-going, but not a bother. If your going with a family, this is a great place, if you younger and looking to party, not really your place. If your looking to be pampered, not here.. If your just looking to get away, and want sun, pool, waves at the ocean, and nice tropical breezes through the many plam tree's and drinks, then enjoy it's plentyfull here!

Reviews.Title: “Better than most in PR”
Reviews.Author: Geoexplore99
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites is in a great location, approximately 30 minutes west of San Juan. The rooms are relatively big, but were a little run down with a damp carpet. The scenery is very nice, with a small cove and beach. The food options are fairly limited and the quality is avergae to below average. Free breakfast is a plus. Puerto Rico is not my favorite place in the Caribbean, but this property is one of the better places on the island. Staff are friendly and the resort offers free drinks for 2 hours each night (including liquor).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: dstyes
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights (2/15/09-2/17/09) - my wife had business locally, and my son and I played in the pool while she worked :-) The hotel was very nice but showed some age and perhaps a little storm damage. Beachfront had some erosion and some seaweed, but hey it IS the ocean, right? The pool area was very nice, with several tiered pools and plenty of deck chairs, floats for kids, etc. The suites were very nice and clean, but a little dated in decor. Housekeeping missed making the room up one day, and I had to call to have that taken care of, and that's the only reason I gave them 4/5 on service. There's a complementary hor breakfast buffet - get there early (7-8AM) to avoid the rush, otherwise you'll have a hard time getting seated. We will visit this resort again, and will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie44
Reviews.Content: After reading several "so-so" reviews about this location I had a somewhat low expectation. Overall our experience was a pleasant one with a good ocean view from the 7th. floor. The staff was extremely helpful and worked very hard to accommodate us. The parking was crowded and difficult as there is construction of a casino in an adjacent lot. The beach offered pleasant seating areas however the swimming area is restricted to a very shallow area protected by a breach wall. The weekend evenings are lively however, if you are planning for a quite stay you won't have one. The DJ is quite loud and can be heard throughout the facility until about 10 PM. All in all this is still a good value for what you are paying. It is convenient to golfing, just walk across the street. Ron

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: noisemaker
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort. Was there for a seven-day vacation in February and loved it. The hotel is clean, well-lit, and well-maintained, even though it's a few years old now. Big, comfortable beds. The staff is friendly and very responsive. Delicious breakfasts and above average dinner options in the on-site restaurant. We found the lunch and dinner cooking a little unpredictable; some nights dinner was exceptional, while the same dishes on other nights were blander and clearly made with different ingredients. The beach isn't great; it's fairly small and somewhat rocky, but it's private and makes for great sunbathing if you're not into serious surfing, etc. The pool and courtyard are nice also, though usually crowded with kids. Dorado is a nice suburb with a few familiar places to shop/eat and also at least one very fine restaurant (El Ladrillo) near the city center about a mile from the Embassy Suites. We were careful not to leave the resort on foot after dark, as we understand that PR has a pretty widespread crime problem, but we never felt unsafe on the property. I golf only recreationally, and didn't play the Rodriguez course during my stay, but I did walk it with my wife several times. It did not look to me like it was in great shape, but maybe the standards for upkeep in PR aren't what they are at similarly-priced courses on the mainland. We saw lots of iguanas and turtles, though. If you're in PR for a few days or longer, this is a great central location for day trips to San Juan, Arecibo, El Yunque, etc. Definitely rent a car, as it's affordable and safe. (There's a Vias rental agency just a few blocks west of the resort's main entrance; they'll even pick you up, though you could easily walk there. We rented with these folks and had no problems at all, but check your gas and tire pressure before heading off on back roads.) Get a good map and know your cardinal directions in Spanish and you're in for a great time. We'll definitely come back to PR, and would definitely consider the del Mar Embassy Suites again. The only reason we'd look elsewhere would be to explore some different parts of the island. Overall, a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Lulu_BB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Dorado del Mar for eight days, and we really liked it. Pros: clean, friendly staff, great breakfast (get the french toast!), nice pool and beach area, pretty good dinner menu. We enjoyed the "manager's reception" each night. Cons: only one restaurant on-site (the hotel claims three, but they all have the same menu), fitness center could use an update, and our room overlooked a parking lot. We stayed at the resort for several days and hung out by the pool. We then rented a car for three days and explored the island -- there's lots to see within an hour's drive in to both the east and the west. You do need a car if you want to get anywhere -- there isn't much except Walgreen's and a few chain restaurants in walking distance. We used Vias car rental, which has an office near the resort, and were very happy with them. We got what we wanted at the Embassy Suites -- the accommodations were clean, the sun was wonderful, and we were mainly left alone to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Dorado del Mar”
Reviews.Author: PandJFlo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were very nice. Two room suites. I was very impressed with the service of the hotel employees. The beach was nice, but we spent most of our time by the pools. Breakfast was included in my package and it was great, a buffet with made to order omelets. You want it, they have for breakfast. Buffet, fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, the works. While your at the pool your card and room number gets you bottled water for free (nice touch). I definitely will stay there next year. The parking situation is a bit much, but they are building a multi level garage. After a day of enjoying the sights of Puerto Rico with our niece, it was nice to be able to come back to the hotel and relax in our room. 2 T.V.'s, microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. Plus the sofa is a pull out couch. Our balcony was nice and it was awesome to wake up in the morning and do some reading there. Beautiful sunrise.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Toddlers”
Reviews.Author: MedSail
Reviews.Content: A really great place to go if you have young children. The Embassy Suites gives you the extra room and they have cribs. The layout is superb for small children. The main pool is nice with a sloped entrance for the kids. Better still, next to it is a play area with slides and a tunnel, and next to that it the kiddie pool. It gets better - just across from the main pool is the beach. So its all together. My 3 year old went from the kiddie pool to the climbing frame to the big pool to the beach and back for 4 days! One problem - you have to watch the beach - I am guessing its a public beach and so ES do not maintain it. I was constantly watching for bottle caps and broken glass. A lot of litter. A shame because its a nice sheltered cove and could be really nice. The free 2 hour happy hour is great also. I would have liked more snacks - but my daughter loved getting popcorn. Then the free cooked breakfast every morning was great. Yes there is a 12% resort fee - so just over $20 a day - but I felt it was well worth it for what we were getting. We were there for 4 days and strayed outside the hotel only once to go to a very good (and good with kids) Italian restaurant Trattoria something in the shopping center 1 mile from the hotel. It looks bad from the outside but the food was good and the service friendly. Luis, a local taxi driver took us and picked us up in his taxi for $16. My daughter cant wait to go back and we will. I used to stay at the Hyatt Dorado when it was open - and it was one of my favorite hotels in the world. However I think this ES is a great option for a water holiday with little kids for a few days. The hotel staff were extremely pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But..............”
Reviews.Author: Justice911
Reviews.Content: Nice size room but my carpet in the room was very damp. I wasnt sure if it was the humity or what. Beach was nice but needs to be cleaned, Walking barefoot might pose a problem. Had issues with being charged everynight different charges due to a hotel computer glich. Hotel staff informed me this has hapend to many other guests. In addition, there were no signs directing you to the hotel from the airport. I got lost on the way there and wasited time trying to find it. Hotel was pretty close to the Bacardi tour and fairy to Old town San Juan. Hotel staff were nice and very helpful. Hotel isnt as big as you see on the photos. One side of it belongs to the vacation club. I agree with most reviewers not much to do in Dorado I spent most of my time outside of Dorado with a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “It's all right as long as you know what you're getting!”
Reviews.Author: coolcaesar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Dorado Del Mar recently while on a four-day vacation in Puerto Rico. I read all the recent reviews on TripAdvisor and thus had a good idea of what to expect. Advantages of this hotel include: located in a safe, quiet, pleasant luxury suburb of San Juan; small private beach with breakwaters to ease the waves and lots of rocks at each end to keep out the riffraff; very quiet and peaceful at pool and beach on weekdays; gorgeous, soothing and well-maintained landscaping and architecture; well-equipped fitness center; and wonderfully delicious complimentary breakfast (which is a real cooked-to-order breakfast rather than just continental as at most hotels). All staff encountered were courteous and pleasant. Disadvantages of this hotel: Mandatory 12% "resort fee" and $7 parking fee (why couldn't that be just rolled into the room rate?); huge crowds of raucous local Puerto Ricans on weekends at the pool and beach who are apparently staying at the Aquatic Club time-share on site; awkward parking situation; the concierge is never in; speed bumps galore coming to and from the main highway (at least eight, I think); cranky computers and printers in the business center; and large but shallow kid-oriented swimming pool that needs refurbishment (it has a few cracked and/or missing tiles here and there). No sign of the Chilean soap opera. Guess they finished filming! As for the room itself, it was well-maintained and clean, with only the slightest trace of a musty smell, and in excellent shape. The bed was warm and comfortable and the furniture looked practically new and in good shape with no obvious scratches or tears. The only major problems noted with the room were a tiny bit of rusting seen on the tiles in the bathroom, a mediocre-quality sealing job on the edges of the walls and fixtures in the bathroom, and a psycho A/C system that seemed to be capable of only various degrees of cooling (cold, very very cold, and ridiculously freezing) and was unable to provide heating or just a straight-through fan. Bring a cozy sweatshirt to stay warm at night. Anyone visiting this hotel in the next year should be warned that the parking lot clearly visible on Google Maps or Windows Live Maps satellite photographs to the southwest of the hotel has just been torn up. The hotel is building a real parking garage (apparently to ameliorate its chronic parking shortage). Unfortunately, this means that you will either have to park in the tandem parking in the temporary parking lot built to the southwest of the old lot, or they will direct you to park on one of the golf course paths on the east side of the hotel, where the hotel employees also park. Also, as many people have noted, try to avoid getting a room facing towards the southwest because that means you will be facing the noisy giant two-story tall air-conditioning unit that keeps the whole complex well-chilled, as well as the construction site for the new parking garage. Fortunately they gave me a room facing the east, so that wasn't a problem. As others have noted, the problem with most of the east-facing rooms is that you don't get much of an ocean view, but that is actually a good thing because the hotel complex is so close to the ocean that anyone actually facing the ocean runs the risk of being kept awake by ocean waves constantly crashing loudly on the breakwaters (at each end of the beach). Another issue is that in the winter, with the sun rising low in the sky to the south, the sun shines on the beach and pool area only from about 7 in the morning to 4 PM in the afternoon. After 4, the pool is in a deep shadow created by the hotel itself and the only area with sun is a small area of the beach at the west end, which gets sun through to about 6 PM. Finally, there's the issue of the distance from the city. Obviously, because the resort is 10 miles from San Juan, you will either have to rent a car or use taxis. If you don't rent a car, you will be stuck in the resort most of the time, which may be a problem because the Embassy Suites is rather small compared to the super-resorts where one wouldn't mind spending an entire vacation (the gigantic Hilton Waikoloa Village comes to mind). If you do rent a car, then you get the dubious pleasure of navigating Puerto Rico's insanely wild traffic. Keep in mind that staying in Dorado outside of the city means having to get up at 5 AM to fight San Juan's morning rush hour traffic to catch a 8:15 AM flight back to the mainland (unless you live somewhere close enough to PR that you can take a later flight). And the morning rush hour in San Juan starts at 6 AM, which implies you can look forward to sitting in bumper-to-bumper traffic all the way to the airport on the last day of your trip. Overall, I had a good idea of what I was getting into (no hotel is perfect), and I thoroughly enjoyed my vacation at the Embassy Suites Dorado del Mar as good value for money. Puerto Rico has the highest homicide rate in America and I enjoyed being able to retreat to a beautiful hotel in a safe, quiet neighborhood at night after exploring the island during the day. But if you need (1) a larger, deeper adult-oriented pool for real swimming/diving, (2) an actual beach for walking, not just lounging around all day, (3) a white sand beach with turquoise water rather than an ordinary brown sand beach with blue water, (4) a hotel that includes all fees upfront in the room rate, (5) a hotel that is in the city, (6) a hotel that is far, far away from the city, or (7) a hotel that doesn't have a crazy number of speed bumps and makes you park on a golf course, then you might wish to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great!”
Reviews.Author: saw1964
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay! The rooms were large, clean and in good repair (the sofa's were a little tired). We had a most beautiful view of palm trees with the sound of a fountain in the background. The breakfast was excellent! Nice variety of fruits, standard breakfast fare and eggs/omelets made to order. We were there during Thanksgiving and the buffet they served was a nice mix of the traditional turkey and stuffing and lots of regional fare. Manager's complimentary happy hour was crowded, long lines for drinks, but that's no surprise really. The staff was friendly and helpful. We are planning on making this an every other year family vacation, no need to look for other hotels, this one was great!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of organization”
Reviews.Author: edrub
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a class reunion weekend celebrated at the Embassy Suites. The reservations were done around 10 months ago through one of the classmates who volunteered to make all arrangements for everyone participating. When I arrived Friday with my family, I went to the front desk, the employee found my name on the computer, and then I was sent to the Aquarius, which is next door. Finding a parking place was nearly impossible, which is odd considering it is supposed to be the group parking lot. To my surprise upon entering Aquarius, there was a long line. After one hour of waiting in line, I contacted my friend who made the reservations and she said that I was not the only one from the group who had problems with the reservation. She proceeded to talk with the manager on duty, who gave her a couple of different reasons of why they where having problems with the group reservations. After three hours of waiting in line (everyone waiting was already in a bad mood, and also having problems with their reservations), we finally had our room, but I already missed part of the evening that I expected to share with the classmates who I have not seen in a long time. As I met some of my friends they also expressed their problems with their reservations. Some were told that there was no room available and they had to wait until later that day. Others were sent to Dorado Beach, which was at a driving distance, to spend the night and come back the following day to get their room. They waited most of the day and some did not get their room until late that Saturday afternoon. As I was getting ready for our class dinner, I received a call from a hotel employee and was told that their records show that I was supposed to be there for only one night. I explained what happened with the reservations and the group that I was with, and the caller put me on hold for a very long time and never got back to me. The following day we received an envelope with the hotel statement inside, but it did not show the $150.00 that I gave as a deposit for the reservation. When I went to check out, I pointed it out to the front desk employee, and she and the manager had me waiting another hour while they checked. The classmate who made the reservations had to get the copy of my check and reservation document in order straighten the situation. It seems to me that they have to upgrade their computer system, or possibly fire the computer programmer. This will probably save them money as well as keep them from losing more clients. The service on the hotel was OK, but our stay was prematurely dampened with all this reservation problems. Needless to say, my recommendations to friends and family will be poor.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach Value”
Reviews.Author: NeenahGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites over Easter weekend after a planned check out from the Hyatt vacation club down the road. Hands down the Embassy Suites wins for amenities and price. The great - the protected and private beach was safe even while other beaches in Puerto Rico were closed for unusually rough surf this past March. The pool has a variety of depths and play areas, some are even shaded, to accomodate large numbers with varying degrees of swim skills. Rooms were clean and comfortable with unobtrusive and attentive housekeeping. Concierge desk is helpful as is the front desk staff. Fellow patrons were friendly. The good - Plenty of beach chairs, great breakfast, attentive staff and a family-friendly pool. Clean, spacious and in an incredible complex. The ferry to Viejo San Juan is a short drive away. There is easy access to the highway system and the restaurants in town are gracious and good. The mediocre - Our room reservation was for an ocean view; we ended up in a room that overlooked a parking lot, then a neighborhood and finally the ocean. The staff corrected the mistake after the first night. Ocean front rooms have king beds only with pull out couches making it a tough decision....do we get two beds or make the kids sleep on the pullout for the sake of a spectacular view? The noisy - The open atrium is rockin' until 11:00 on holiday weekends. The suite bedrooms were quiet enough, but the living rooms were too noisy for kids to sleep on the pull out couches. Be prepared to join in the fun. Bottom line - You'll want to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This might be a nice hotel for vacation, but not great for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Fortwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for five nights for business. It is somewhat difficult to find the entry since the address does not appear in the GPS, and the map appears on the google map is incorrect. I highly recommend reviewing the direction to the hotel before setting out. The bathroom relatively clean with a few mold spots on the celing. The chairs had lots of stains on it and looked dirty. The room was relatively quiet although it could get quite loud on Friday night when they bring in a band in the evening. The room stayed very cold no matter what I did to the thermostat. The internet connection was problematic. It does not allow VPN connection. I was disappointed in this since they charge for in-room wireless interent connection. The food choices are not so great at the hotel, and I found parking to be very inconvenient and difficult. It seems like most of the guests are having really good time, so I think the property is really good for vacation. But I found it somewhat dissapointing for business purpose. I tried this hotel because it was recommended by the people I was visiting as an alternative to staying in San Juan to reduce commute time, as it will cut down about 20 to 30 minutes of driving if you had to go to the western part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time!!”
Reviews.Author: DBJJ2008
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 10 days at this resort with my son and husband and we had a fabulous time. The hotel was extremely accomodating and all the staffers were extremely friendly. We made plenty of friends. The rooms were very nice and clean and the linens were very fresh. The only negative thing I would have to say is the Spa treatments weren't really worth what I paid. I had originally booked a spa treatment on the beach and I thought, they had a separate section (which they don't) like a real spa, but they don't. they wanted to give me a massage on the beach with everyone around us. I guess I should haved booked it in my suite, but didn't think I would be comfortable there. Anyway, I had it indoors in the fitness facility which was not quiet at all. A massage was meant to be relaxing and tension releasing and I found it extremely difficult to relax with the sound of the treadmill just outside and hotel guests talking up a storm and laughing. (should have just cancelled it!). Anyway, they do not have a spa, so it wasn't worth it. Other than that, the food was great, they had nightly entertainment, and the Manager's cocktail hour daily was fun. Overall, a really nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just poor!”
Reviews.Author: todebald
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in this hotel, another 2-week stay. Unfortunately that one was not up to the price paid. I had requested a golf-view room; I got one, nice although overlooking the two huge air conditioning hotel fans which are constantly working and particularly noisy. So I requested another one and was granted a room on the 3rd floor right above the ballroom. Extremely bad location, and unfortunately no other room available! Parties were going on Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc. with music playing until very late in the night, in fact early in the morning. Terrible when you are there for business. Neighbours in adjacent rooms were particularly noisy, which demonstrates poor room insulation. It was almost impossible to enjoy the pool which did not open until 8am (it was supposed to open as soon as 7am) and would be instantly crowded by hordes of bawling kids. In addition, the internet connection never worked in my room and was never fixed although raised to the hotel staff; and you get to pay for it every day! Breakfast quality is hardly average, and personnel at front desk were overall not really caring. Also, avoid using the laundry service, as my shirts were delivered with damaged buttons! Finally, the food in the restaurant appears to be overpriced; and so is parking. Is that because mid-May was just a bad period? I'm really unsure and was overall quite disappointed. It is unlikely I will stay there a third time, although the hotel location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Embassy Suites standards”
Reviews.Author: luvs2bike
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous other Embassy Suites, but this property did not live up to the standard I have come to expect from Embassy. The room was nice but nothing special, the same with the lobby. The parking lot is unpaved and shared with a golf course. The pool is shared with a timeshare resort and is packed with kids. The beach is puny, not at all what I expected from the pictures and description. A wedding was going on in one of the ballrooms, and the music played until past 2 a.m. The comp bar was very busy every night and very slow. The breakfast was good and the front desk was very helpful. The hide a bed in the living room was pathetic. My son and his wife ended up putting the mattress directly on the floor the second night. Overall, we were quite disappointed, especially considering this is supposed to be a "resort".

Reviews.Title: “Our 40th Anniversary Stay was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: bbdubois
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 40th annivesary at the Embassy Suites Del Mar Beach and Golf Resort. We could not have been happier. Upon arrival the staff was courteous and helpful. In our room was a beautiful flower arrangement, wine, posters of welcome and congratulations on our 40th, a beautiful picture frame, and hearts on our bed. We had a oceanview room on the 6th floor that had a beatutiful view. The pools and beach were wonderful. We enjoyed the daily breakfast that was prepared as we asked and the manager's reception in the evening was great. While we were staying the Puerto Rico National Honor Society was having a convention. To find 200 or so very respectable young people who dressed very nicely and were very quite was reassuring to us of our younger generation. Keep up the great work Embassy Suites. We will look to stay in your facilities in future travels. bbdubois@msn.com

Reviews.Title: “Dining Options”
Reviews.Author: 4q2
Reviews.Content: I stay at this property regularly on business. The facilities are good and clean. The pool/beach area is nice. The staff is helpful and courteous. The golf course is not great but very good for a resort course. There have been a couple of reviews that mentioned poor local dining options. I disagree but know the area well. My favorite is La Terraza, an outdoor restaurant just west of the hotel. Downtown Dorado has El Ladrillo which is well known for their outstanding Spanish features and also houses a local gallery. There is a Tratoria (Italian) in the shopping center just outside the Dorado Del Mar gate that is very good Italian food. I don't think those would disappoint anyone and may not be on the hotel "list." I'm sure the staff would assist with reservations or directions to any of them.

Reviews.Title: “A very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: msnroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: I will never stay there again - more problems than you know how to handle. While I would admit it is a beautiful hotel, let me tell you about the problems: 1. Parking lot - wait two hours to get through the gate. Attendant was MIA 2. No hot water one day 3. A/C broke in room 4. Filming of soap opera - pool closed, parking restricted, etc. - a major inconvenience 5. Restaurant closed early - after 14 hours of flying, could not get food or drink 6. Poor food the next day when I could finally get something to eat. 7. Business center - one printer broke, other out of toner 8. Wireless internet kept going out - the hotel said they were working on it, but three days? Never again, and I stay in hotels over 190 nights per year, over half at Hilton properties like Embassy Suites

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: teaman7478
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 had a perfect vacation in Dorado. We rented a van, which was key. We enjoyed a snorkeling trip and trips to Old San Juan as well as other hotels in San Juan. Restaurants were average, but the pool & beach are perfect for a family. There are activities for the kids each day. There is a game room and ping pong. The weather was perfect. Warm, but a constant tropical breeze. The staff was always courteous. If you need to pick anything up, outside of the gated complex is a drug store, as well as numerous fast food restaurant chains. The manager's reception was a perfect way to end the day at the beach. We look forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort in Dorado, PR”
Reviews.Author: bh2469
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the resort. It was a very beautiful property with a lot to offer. While I wasn't able to enjoy any golf during this trip, the course itself looked great. The private beach area is very nice, and the pool area is fantastic. The room was large and the included hot breakfast buffett in the morning was good.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomOhio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and peaceful. The pool is very big although it was often full of kids. The beach is lovely and there are plenty of beach chairs for every one. The hotel lobby is typical Embassy Suites. The location is far from the hubub of San Juan which can be nice but really leaves you with only a few options for activity unless you want to deal with traffic and waste a good bit of time in your car. Also very limited choice of restaurants and no real shopping in the area. Great golf course though. The hotel has a three restaurants, one closes at 5:00pm, one isn't open on Mondays and Tuesdays, one has a pretty average menu--good but nothing to get excited about. There used to be some casinos in Dorado but they have long since closed--despite what some websites and guide books may tell you. If you stay here you will need a car or really want to just get away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good family value”
Reviews.Author: camroline
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day stay at the Embassy Suites with our two children, ages 9 and 6. Storms in the Northeast kept us there for three extra days and the hotel staff was very accomodating in extending our stay. When we arrived late at night we were told the Embassy Suites was overbooked and we were moved to the Aquarius/Golden Sands rooms that are adjacent to the main hotel. The rooms in this building are larger than the Embassy Suites with more substantial kitchens (full sized fridge, dishwasher and a two burner stove). As Embassy Suites guests, we were still able to go to the free breakfast each day and the hotel happy hour in the evening. We ended up preferring the larger room and quieter building. The only con was the housekeeping services were basic - I would have liked a more thorough cleaning each day - two days the housekeeper didn't even show up. You need a car if you plan on doing anthing in Puerto Rico besides sitting at the hotel pool. We rented one at the airport when we arrived along with a GPS which was a godsend. We visited the rainforest (beautiful), the Arecibo Observatory (we could have skipped this ), Languillo Beach(dissapointing, crowded and dirty) El Morro and Old San Juan (great day) and took an all day catamaran trip on the Spread Eagle II (not a joke) to Icacos, an uninhabited island off Fajardo - the trip was beautiful, but if you have snorkeled before you will find the fish/reefs a dissapointment. The other days we stayed at the hotel and used the pool which is perfect for kids. The beach sand is coarse and not white, but most of the beaches in Puerto Rico are like that except for the off islands. There are very few places to eat in Dorado and the places that were recommended were lousy. The Italian restaurant at the hotel, Oregeno, was the worst. The food took nearly two hours to come out, and one hour into our wait they came out to tell my husband he couldn't have the pesto pasta because they were out of pesto. My sons chicken strips were RAW in the middle. The hotel restaurant in the main building was ok, but don't expect to eat well on this trip. Lots of fried food with very few options for children. The pool bar was perfect for a late lunch in our bathing suits and the waitstaff was terrific. We saw them filming the soap opera at the hotel, but there were never any areas closed to guests. Overall, the value of this hotel is good. The people were very nice and bingo every afternoon was a big hit with the kids! This trip was not as "pampering" as others I have taken, but a smart choice for our family especially having a suite rather than a single hotel room in a major resort. If you keep your expectations reasonable, you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dorado Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripsiino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The front desk staff was very pleasant and friendly. The hotel was very attractive. The location is great. Its a great place for families and kids. They have a lagoon pool a kids pool and a protected bay that keeps the waves minimal. The service at the poolside restaurant was very slow. One day when we ate lunch there we must have waited an hour to get our food. I think the waiter must have totally forgot our order because 30 min after we ordered he came back and told us our food would be a while. We also didn't get service of any sort for the first 15 minutes we were there and had to go to the bar and ask for service. The breakfast and happy hour are great bonuses. We did have a problem when we did some laundry on site and the maid who was cleaning the laundry room had used bleach to clean out the dryer. Our entire load was ruined. When we complained to the front desk they waived our resort fee which was nice, but that didn't really cover the loss of some of our favorite clothes, and some brand new things we had purchased just for the trip. Otherwise we had a pleasant stay and the room was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Friendly Location”
Reviews.Author: BigMacII
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to the Dorado area: one at the old Hyatt Dorado Beach (prior to children) and the last two at the Embassy Suites. As we have two your children (ages 30 months and 9 months), the Embassy Suites again lived up to our expectations. The family had a great time, as my sons loved the pool area and the abundance of other kids. Transportation: As this location is 45 minutes from San Juan without traffic, I would highly recommend renting a car. Also, the restaurants in the hotel are somewhat limited so it allows freedom of choice for dining options. There are major roadways that resemble the US road and street system. The symbols are the same but the language is in Spanish. The speed limits are posted in Miles but everything else follows the metric system. If you can drive in NY, Boston, or Philadelphia rush hour traffic you will be ok on the roads. Location: Dorado is a sleepy ocean town without much nightlife and no casinos at this time. The hotel is in a gated community in the middle of a golf course. Hotel Facilities: Standard Embassy suites room with added bonus of balcony. We were thankfully upgraded to ocean front/view room on top room that had a great view of the small beach and medium sized pool area (pool side bar, restaurant, playground, baby pool, and numerous lounge chairs). The gym is outfitted with new Precor? equipment and does focus on the aerobic stuff with limited barbells. Also, there is a game room and coin laundry in lower level area. The beach is small but really hotel use only as access to the area is limited. The beach is protected but does get rocky about 10 or 15 ft out from shore. Extras: Happy hour 5:30 to 7:30 and free breakfast is a great touch. The breakfast is a great bonus with youngsters. The General Impressions: The staff was very friendly, welcoming and helpful. It is very family friendly resort (small kids). There are area restaurants and stores for food and supplies, as I will admit the restaurants are somewhat weak. As my son is very picky, we utilized the Applebeeâ€™s, Langhorne (Bayamon), and Chiliâ€™s (near Aricebo) as he seeks familiarity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in Dorado”
Reviews.Author: MFar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were visiting friends in the area. The hotel is fine, but it is an Embassy Suites hotel. It is not going to be a 5 star establishment. We found the English speaking staff to be very friendly and the hotel offers a wonderful breakfast. The pool area is great for the kids. What we did not like about the hotel is that it was far from many of the activities that we wanted to do. Also the hotel does have a beach, but it is not that great. There are many other better beaches in the area that one should drive to.

Reviews.Title: “wasted money, vacation...misleading information - awful”
Reviews.Author: ludlu
Reviews.Content: Given the photos on the Hilton/Embassy website one might assume that the hotel you see is the hotel you get. It is NOT. The right portion of the photo is not the hotel at all -some said it was a timeshare property. The hotel extends behind the wing you see in the photo on the right. What you get on the back side is a view of dumpsters, parking lot and beyond the homes in the distance you will see the ocean. Upon arrival and immediately upon entering the room we were shocked and disappointed. I returned to the front desk and told the staff about my numerous calls and that this was not at all what they described or what they advertised on their website photos. I lodged numerous complaints because in planning I thought I was careful and had personally phoned the 800 number and the hotel itself making sure to clarify what it was that we were seeking. Ocean, ocean view -the beach- we live in a landlocked community and wanted the beach. I was reassured that the room would have at a minimum a partial ocean view and we would be accommodated. The first evening the manager more or less told me too bad, the next morning the am manager offered to move us to the other side. There we looked over a gated community and if you sat in the right corner of the patio the beach was visible. If we could have returned to the airport and gone home w/o $$ penalty- (5 travelers) we would have. We especially wanted to leave after the day we spent traveling on a "dry run" to the other side of the island to set up our snorkeling and night swim outings. A long trip from Dallas this was to be our big family "island" vacation. The "oceanfront" beach offered is a miniscule bay with moss/scum on the bottom of much of the area you can walk. Likely due to the lack of movement within the man made cove. That drive to the other side of the island to do any of the things one might want to do, snorkel, deep sea fishing, ferry to other island or swim in the evening with glowing fish - well the traffic is worse than metro DC, Dallas and any other city we have lived or traveled to and the drive took us 3.5 hours one way. We were advised at the hotel that it was worse during the week. The breakfast buffet was the highlight. The servers wonderful. I have not eaten eggs since returning though. The all inclusive happy hour in California included frozen non-alcoholic drinks for the kids, not here they charged 3.50 or more for them. This is a desolate area of the island and if you want to eat anywhere but this hotel - forget about it. A deli/bakery in town is delightful but that is it. Yes they have KFC, Burger King etc. not what we went to an island to eat and even there you better be bilingual. One of our best vacations was on family business but was at the Embassy Suites in Oxnard, CA. That hotel is beautiful; staff treats you like you are in a 5 star resort. Trust that all Embassy Suites are not equal and do your homework better than I did. Also, be prepared, Puerto Rico is quite dirty and the people are not particularly friendly. Quite a shame. Too many islands too many choices I recommend you make a different selection!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place - Great Service- Will stay again and again.”
Reviews.Author: dee2929
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here and will do it again! 01/04 to 01/10 The minute we arrived, my sister and I were greeted with smiles and "Buenos Dias", by courteous valet attendants and bell captains. Parking is $7.00 per day, Valet parking is the way to go. $14.00 per day, but you don't have to worry about finding a parking space. The car is parked inside in a garaged area. The front desk staff was very pleasant and since we arrived early and our room was not ready, suggested we leave our cell number and head out to the pool area where thereâ€™s a stunning 3 tier pool and a gazebo bar over looking the ocean. We got a call in no time and our room was very nice, clean and had all the needed amenities; small refrigerator, sink, and cabinets for snacks. I did forget to ask for ocean view... I guess we canâ€™t have everything. We had a king size bed and a pull out sofa bed, both very clean and comfortable. A hair dryer and Ironing board were also provided. We had two television sets, one on each room with cable. There is a door in between rooms for privacy if needed. The Beach is public, but it has not real access for others so it is shared with just a few. Yes there was a soap opera being film as it has been for a while, we were not inconvenience in anyway by filming. The staff was very helpful in accommodating all our requests, from directions to recommendations on restaurants and places to visit. The times for the restaurants are posted and can be obtain ahead of time to plan on eating in or go to a local restaurant. There are two restaurants, one in the hotel and the other across the street. The Oregano restaurant is not open on Mondays and Tuesdays. Both served great food at reasonable prices and great service. I recommend â€œThe Ladrillo" in the center of town for dinner (a little pricy, but worth it). You do have to ring the buzzer for them to open the door. Don't dine here if you are in a hurry, sit back and enjoy! Breakfast is free every morning and offers many items to choose from; cold cereal, pancakes, French toast, donuts, fruit, and eggs cooked to order, pastries, bacon, sausage and an omelet station etc. The line can get long so plan ahead. There are laundry facilities in the basement area next to the game room and workout gym. If you are visiting San Juan on your first night staying here, I recomment hiring a driver. San Juan It is approximately 30 minutes away. I hired a driver for $65.00 each way (worth every penny) we got dropped off and called him back when ready (didn't have to worry about drinking and driving or getting lost the first time around) You can also hire a driver to take you around the Island. I recommend Guavate on the weekend. They have a local fiesta every weekend, vendors, crafts and traditional food and music. It is in a mountainous area, not for the faint at heart. I paid $165.00 for round trip for both (he stayed with us the entire time and made sure we were comfortable, approximately 4 hours, also explaining the different foods and customs) Again worth every penny. Not every tourist experiences this. The driverâ€™s name is John Benuchi and the hotel can provide his number. I used a rental the rest of the time and the two times I hired a driver instead of driving my self, I was not charged for parking. If you would like additional information on my stay and photos, please email me at dee@massopenhouse.com. I visited the Bioluminescent bay in Fajardo with Kayaking Puerto Rico and Scuba dived in Aguadilla at Cable Beach with Aquatica. I also visited briefly Camuy and Ponce. I will be glad to share my experience. I would stay at this hotel again and again! If you are looking for someone to kiss your feet at every turn, this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for great service from nice people at reasonable prices, you found it!

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl48
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd like to say that this was not my first stay at this property. My friends and I were return guests because we'd been so impressed with the property during our first stay. When it opened in 2003 we had been among some of its first guests. We had a great time then and very much looked forward to returning. What a difference 4 years makes. As has been mentioned by a number of reviewers here, a soap opera was being filmed during our entire stay. If I'd been alerted to the fact that the property would pretty much be monopolized by the cast and crew, I'd have chosen another property. There were times when the lobby, the restaurants, the beach, or the pool were not available to us. We also found that the restaurants and larger bar in the hotel closed at 5pm! That was definitely not the case during our first visit. There was no experienced, capable concierge available during our stay. Another disappointing change from our first visit where the concierge was knowlegeable and helpful. Apparently, all their contracts with such vendors as major car rental companies, and tour operators have been severed. We had to rent a car and drive to excursions and sites ourselves. The staff at the pool charged with dispensing towels, cleaning lounge chairs etc., needed more than retraining. They needed to be fired. They were downright rude. When we requested towels the young man on duty said in spanish to his two female co-workers "Toallas grandes para las gordas." Translation: "Big towels for the fat girls" Unfortunately for him, 3 of the 4 of us are spanish-speaking. Add to all that the furnishings are shabby at best, the beach was absolutely filthy and they've added a playground area around the pool for children that was also filthy and needless to say that as a seasoned travel and a travel agent, I'd never recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A FIND!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travellfor3
Reviews.Content: Our family spent the week of Christmas here and we had a wonderful time!!! We've stayed at the Westin Rio Mar near the rain forest side of the island and also the Ritz Carlton in San Juan another time. We enjoyed ourselves just as much at the Embassy Suites Dorado and at half the price!!! The staff was wonderful and they worked so hard to accomodate you. Every morning there is a buffet breakfast with a chef who will make whatever omelet you want and this is included in your room rate. They offer complimentary happy hour each night from 5:30 to 7:30 with great beer and wine and the bartenders couldn't have been nicer, especially Jose!!! The rooms were just fine, nothing too grand but also nothing to complain about. Most importantly, our king bed wa very comfortable and our 10 yr old daughter said her pullout queen bed was also very comfortable. Each room has seperate bedroom and living room w/pullout and a fridge and microwave. Although we never used our room except to sleep, shower and change. There is a good golf course right on the property and the most beautiful course 5 mins. down the road at the Dorado Beach club that is open to the public to use. The pool is wonderful and the property grounds are beautiful with palm trees and manicured shrubs all around. The beach is small but great for swimming as the water is very calm due to the jetty that is very far out. Food was simply ok, except breakfast which was great. However, there are so many resteraunts around the area that it didn't matter. Definitely rent a car. All in all we would absolutely come back again. If it is a Spa and being waited on hand and foot then this is not the hotel for you. If it is a beautiful relaxing vacation and having to go get your drinks rather than being served them you will love it here. Never crowded and never had a problem finding a chair!!! Also, you get an hour of tennis court time free each day included in your room rate. We paid $56 over at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Good and not so good...”
Reviews.Author: Phaser
Reviews.Content: Went on a 3 day business trip with my wife and then a 1 day pleasure stay. The hotel overall was nice although it is showing some of its age. Some areas near the hotel were nicely designed/landscaped/maintained. BUT, other areas had a 3rd world appearance, e.g., an employee side entrance/dock and my pet peeve the guest parking lot. Parking was $7/day but guests should be paid to park there! It is absolutely 3rd world atrocious, could never pass in the US especially an Embassy Suites and ESPECIALLY an Embassy Suites that requires paid parking. To go from the parking lot to the hotel required not stepping in sizable potholes, tripping over broken/uneven pavement, soiling and wetting shoes and luggage. Check-in was disappointing--I have been a Diamond VIP for years yet am still aggravated that attention isn't paid more closely to upgrade requests per online reservations...in fact, automatic upgrades should be the norm for Diamond VIP (but isn't) despite my communication to Hilton--too much variability between hotels0. After checking in to the room, I proceeded to go back down and politely inquire for my original request of an ocean view and was graciously given another room but still an unnecessary hassle. The pool is one of the best features of the hotel (NOTE I am not much of a pool fan). It is large and sweeping with 3 different areas/levels with cascading from one to the next, with shade from palms interspersed. Water quality was very good with no obnoxious chlorine smell (which actually is an indicator of possible by-product of bacteria kills). The small beach is fairly nice with great breezes and surf since it is located on the windward side of the island. Of particular note was the entire lack of mosquitoes and bugs. [Let this be a warning--see my yet to be written piece per our stay at the Hilton in Ponce on the leeward side (southern) of the island 2 days later.] The breakfast was typical Embassy Suites level. However, a dinner meal turned out to be disappointingly bad. The manager's reception has booze but nothing of note to munch on, although the Caribbean band set up near the pool was great. The fitness room was being refurbished and I was VERY disappointed in the temporary digs with lack of equipment and not cool enough--only 1treadmill was operating--NO EXCUSE. Our room overlooked the plaza/pool/beach but noise was not a problem. The band usually quit around 11PM. We had problems with a sluggish shower and toilet drain which required maintenance 3 different times. Overall attitude and service was good but not great--I guess I am too used to great attitudes and service from Mexicans (don't bash me, my wife is a Mexican). Getting to the hotel is not easy but was tolerable in my trips between it and Arecibo about 55 miles away to the west. For 3 nights Tue.-Thur. we paid (my company) $139.99 + 7$/day parking + the usual and unusual fees/taxes. Our 4th night Fri. was $149.99 plus out of our pocket. Overall, my wife thoroughly enjoyed her time at the hotel and I did too although I have higher expectations of quality/consistency of Embassy Suites

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Over40travelclub
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Puerto Rico. Puerto Rico is warm and friendly. I booked a week's stay at the Aquarius Vacation Club through Interval's International Getaways. The location is great as the resort is located near the ocean. However, the Aquarius Vacation Club rooms are horrible. The interior and exterior of the resort is old and outdated. I had a good view from the room that I stayed in, right off the beach area. But the carpet seemed to be the same that was origially installed when the resort was built...very worn, disclored. The linen was dingy, dull and spotted. The drapes were spotted as well. The exterior doors were water stained. Mildew was in the ceilings. The floor in the bathroom was not cleaned. [hair around tub area and dirty floors] The shower curtains were dirty at the bottom from laying on the bathroom floor that they never seem to mop. Could have been an extremely nice vacation but the place was a hole in the wall. The resort offers nothing. All the amenties, restaurant, bar, gym are in the Embassy Suites adjacent to the resort. And dont think that you will be given the same privileges as the Embassy guest. That's right don't expect free breakfast nor the happy hour if you are a guest at the Aquarius Vacation Club. The two places share a pool, beach and common areas. I changed my room after check in but it did not make a difference. Even though I was advised that the Aquarius Vacation Club was completely booked during my week's stay, It was not up to the standards that I expected. It is worn and unkept

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: daisytcam
Reviews.Content: spent the last week in August in Dorado with my sister and niece and we could not have been happier with the look and location of the hotel. I did not give it an excellent rating only because we were limited in restaurant choices on the property (could have been due to the slow season) but the italian rest. was closed so we only had one to choose from for dinner and that is where they hold the breakfast buffet at so nothing fancy. They do have a strip mall right at the gate of the property with a mcdonalds, burger king, kfc etc. and the 24 hour walgreen right across the way is a godsend. lol The hotel is immaculate inside and out, very helpful staff everywhere we went and the pool overlooking the beach ws sheer bliss. From what little we could see of the golf course, it was beautiful. Rent a car if you are staying there as it is away from the sites. We got an excellent package with priceline and since i know the island, i would stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Filming soap opera, everything closed”
Reviews.Author: edgar9867
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but right now they have been filming a soap opera for 8 months and will continue to do so until the end of March 2007. Pools have been closed, beach has been closed, lobby completely blocked. No activities allowed if filming close to pool, beach or lobby. Last day there they actually closed the outside pool bar/restaurant for filming. You are notified about this at check in and not before. So far a restricted vacation this is the place to go. Ladrillo restaurant in town was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer45
Reviews.Content: I was suprised by the issues at this embassy suites hotel since I had always been happy with other embassy suite hotels. During our stay, the pool, beach and other hotel grounds were crowed with locals who had purchased a time share that is contained on the hotel grounds. Not only where there no chairs for hotel guests, the pool was crowded and the time share representatives were circling the area pushing their sales pitch to weary guests. Hotel guests had to pay for daily parking-not free with your room. Our room was not cleaned by houskeeping until approx. 7:00 in the evening. Although some of the staff were friendly, many were not. We had no internet service during our stay, no room keys, and never recieved an itemized bill as promised. I have stayed in many hotels on the lovely island of Puerto Rico, and would never stay at the Embassy Suites, Dorado again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh....”
Reviews.Author: azifeyekare
Reviews.Content: This trip was not all bad, but the negatives do out weigh the positives.First, you do need a rental car to get around, but be wary of the drivers, because they will cut across a 4 lane highway without signaling once. On the positive, the hotel is very beautiful and we had a wonderful view of the Atlantic. The staff is very friendly and polite for the most part and the cheesecake was to die for. On the negative side when we checked in at 4:30pm, we had to wait an additional 90 minutes because it wasnt ready. They were filming a Chilean soap opera right above us, so every morning we would wake at 7am to banging and noise above us. I have to agree with the other reviewer that the place felt like it was overrun with locals. It was packing with local business people from Merck and the hotel seemed to cater to them first. Several times, the Paradise Cafeteria was closed off to host their events. On Thursday night, the Merck people had a reception in a conference room that we could hear on the 4th floor. When we called to the front desk, they acted as if they didnt know what we were talking about and told us that they checked with the room right below us and didnt hear anything. Hello? Anyone in the lobby could have heard it. So my girlfriend and I decided to get dressed and join the Merck party. Why not? They were too wasted to care. Their was no conceirge the entire week. We had to enlist the help of local waiters to plan our trips to Cuomo and El Yunque. Be advised that the Blue Seahorse bar closes at 5pm. So if you want a frozen beverage or food and you are by the pool, you have to dry off, get dressed and go inside to the Calypso bar. And the manager reception does not include frozen drinks. The bottom line was that this experience could have been alot better. The hotel is beautiful, but management needs to get on the ball.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Embassy was great!”
Reviews.Author: Becky826
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5. Our stay at this resort was wonderful. Their complementary breakfast was great. Pool and entertainment was also good. The staff is very friendly and helpful. You definately need to rent a car to get around to outside restaurants. The room was clean and beds very comfortable. Only down side was the beach. It was not very clean. Good for tanning only or maybe a quick dip. I definately recommend it to families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Dependable, Comfortable, Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: TK_DC
Reviews.Content: If you are a fan of Emabassy Suites (I am) then you wont be dissapointed. Good breakfests, free happy hour and two room suites. Not posh, but comfortable and nice. Nice beach, nice pool, freindly staff. Family Friendly! The only downside is that the drinks (when it's not happy hour) are pricey. You'll need a car to get around to local restuarants: Avoid La Terriza, but thumbs up for the Tratoria and the Zen Garden. Another plus is a Walgreens and a 'Grande' supermarket right outside the property. Last note: They are currently shooting a soap opera on location. Once and a while, it was momentarily inconvienient.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Overview on Embassy”
Reviews.Author: MyaOl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice. Itâ€™s a suite so you get two rooms. One is a dining\living room with its on kitchenette (microwave and mini fridge), The other your bedroom. Overall the rooms were clean. Not spotless but good enough. Beach is public so it was not as clean as I would have liked to see it. Although itâ€™s public, thereâ€™s really no access to outside people. The reason I think its made public is because the hotel is linked to a time share called Aquatics so you get the people from there as well. The beach is very small and narrow. The water was calm. The down fall of the time share is that you get more people than you need to while you are vacationing. Beware that you will get asked to join. If you sit and listen to them talk for about three hours (yes three hours) you get a $100.00 gift certificate to a restaurant and a two night stay at another location. Breakfast is huge. Choice of eggs, bacon, hash brown, sausages, omelets (cooked to order), farina, pastries etc.. Manager Reception, free drinks at the bar from 05:30-7:30pm. Be ready to wait in a LONG line. There is also popcorn and nachos for the kids. Nice atmosphere because itâ€™s near the pool and they usually have live music. The restaurant across is horrible. Itâ€™s called Oregano and itâ€™s a wanna be Italian. Great service but not the best food. But hay it was free with our voucher. RESORT FEE Allot of travelers complained about an additional fee on this web site. I learned that if you book through Travelocity itâ€™s already included in the price. If you book with hotel.com or expedia- the hotel charges you once you arrive. You may want to contact the hotel direct to confirm what carrier charges what. Parking. We had to pay $7.00 a day to park our car. Most if not every hotel I ever stayed at, parking was included. As a guest, I donâ€™t see why you should have to pay to park your car. Surroundings You'll find within a 5 minute DRIVE, a taco bell, KFC, McDonalds, Wendyâ€™s etc.. There is also a supermarket and a Walgreenâ€™s within the same distance. Old San Juan is about 30 minutes away and so is the airport. Overall nice time, itâ€™s all about what you make out of it. So as long as you are surrounded by good friends and family everything else doesnâ€™t really seem to be that big of a deal. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Embassy at Dorado”
Reviews.Author: mayapr99
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Emb. at Dorado. It was a perfect stay. The staff was helpfull and friendly. The hotel was spotless, the rest was gourmet, try the crusted sea bass on mango sauce. The beach is protected and very clean. It is a hotel for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SCChuck
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a lot to offer. The rooms are spacious and clean. You should have a view of either the ocean or golf course. The complementary breakfast (cooked to order) and manager's reception (free drinks) really added value to this vacation getaway. The pool was very nice, but often crowded and the beach was protected and calm. There are two different hotel restaurants for dinner but one is closed on Sunday night and the other is closed on Mon-Tues nights. The food was good and reasonably priced at both restaurants. The poolside grill was also very good and we found we could share their large Cuban sandwhich and fries and have more than enough for lunch (after stuffing ourselves at breakfast). The only real downside to this hotel is the $65 cab fare from the airport or downtown. All we wanted to do was relax at the pool and beach so the free drinks and breakfast quickly paid for the taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience At The Embassy”
Reviews.Author: vliza
Reviews.Content: We Just arrived from our summer vacation at the Embassy Suites Dorado, my Husband my 2 year son and me. I dont have anything bad to say about the hotel the experience was wonderful. The staff is very attentive to the guest's needs, room was spotless, the pool was wonderful and the weather was awesome. We went to the outlets in Barceloneta which is probably 20 min. from the hotel and to the Arecibo Lighthouse which is a little bit further but totally worth the experince. The food at the hotel is really good, (we had dinner one night and lunch one day) a little on the pricey side. The breakfast was really good follow the hotel advise and go before 8:30 or you'll find long lines, and to top it all the manager reception with free drinks and appetizers. The experience was wonderful, I really recomend this hotel, expecially if your going on a family vacation, there was a lot of running kids :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lopez277
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Puerto Rico a few weeks ago and stayed at this hotel. I must say...we had a wonderful time. I travelled with my two girlfriends and just needed to get away from our kids! We arrived a few hours before check-in and were accomodated quickly. We found the Staff to be attentive and courteous. We rented a car, so we travelled a bit around the island. The hotel staff was helpful in recommending restaurants and locations nearby. We felt safe in the area. Not too far from San Juan but just far enough to relax. Happy hour was a hit!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but limited”
Reviews.Author: unicorn3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two kids (22 & 14) just returned from a week at this hotel. (We encountered several days of rainy weather, but I won't let that affect my hotel review.) Overall, the hotel was fine--room clean, staff friendly and helpful, nice pool. However, there are some definite limitations I wish I had know beforehand. First off, the beachfront is very small, perhaps the equivalent of a block long. Second, anytime you want to travel to the east (e.g., Fajardo, El Yunque), you have to pass San Juan going and coming, and the traffic is awful. Third, there are no water sports or other lesiure activities at the hotel, except for golf and tennis. On the plus side, the breakfast that is included was fine and filling, and the free happy hour drinks from 5:30-7:30 were also much enjoyed. For dinner, however, the on-site restaurants were so-so. In our two visits, it seemed we could either get good food or good service, but not both at the same time. However, the front desk recommended a number of good restaurants nearby. Also, they provided preprinted index cards with directions to various tourist attractions, which was very helpful. For those who are not confident drivers, be advised that driving in PR can be a challenge. Drivers rarely use signals, often tailgate, and love to cut in and out of lanes. On the other hand, we never saw a single accident, so it appears that the natives are accustomed to this style of driving.

Reviews.Title: “I'd say average beach resort”
Reviews.Author: Tripp'sDad
Reviews.Content: Due to the new passport regulations we booked this trip to Puerto Rico. Overall the resort was fine. Family of 4 enjoyed a week's vacation of fun in the sun. The hotel was clean and in nice condition although some of the grounds needed better care. Around the perimeter of the resort we noticed more trash under bushes than one would expect. My wife and I were a bit disappointed with the beach because it was so short. We like to take long walks on the beach. The pool area was spacious and we never had any problems finding chairs. The hot tub did get a little crowded on a few occassions, but it was manageable. I thought the pool side bar was a bit expensive. $6.50 for a Pina Colata with rum, $5.50 without. Breakfast and afternoon receptions were perfect. The golf course was in great shape. The adult rental clubs were top quality however they didn't have any junior rental clubs for my son. They did piece together 3 or 4 very old pieces of junk so that he could join me. We took cabs everywhere we went. Typical round trip ran $16. We encountered a wonderful cab driver, Louis Rosado - [--]. He provided wonderful history of the island, culture, buildings and people. He was very reliable. $60 fare from the hotel to the airport. I'd highly recommend his service. We'd call him, or have the restaurant call when we ordered dessert and he be there when we paid the bill. Staff (and infact all locals we encountered!) were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overrun”
Reviews.Author: get-out-of-the-cold
Reviews.Content: Overrun sums up this place pretty well. This is a nice property but it is attached to a time share and believe me, these time shares get used. It looks like lots of locals buy them and use them with their extended families. This place was packed. A number of times I looked over at the hot tub and there were so many people in there that every seat was taken and people were standing in the middle. Fortunately the pool is big enough to absorb the masses. Getting a chair can be kind of difficult but we could always get one. It is also expensive. Expect to pay top dollar for drinks and food by the pool. And don't forget the 8% resort fee on top of the 9% tax rate for your room. The servce was very good. The breakfast was outstanding and they can really handle the traffic well. I never stood in line long. The free drinks from 5:30 to 7:30 nightly were great. The lines for food and drinks probably weren't as busy because the timeshare people cannot take part in that. The property was clean and nice. The rooms are spacious and clean. The parking situation is kind of crazy but workable.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: chris92
Reviews.Content: Stayed there the first weekend in March. The Good: Nice room, great balcony, good pool, decent beach, hot breakfast included, clean. The Not So Good: My reservation said all taxes included & low and behold an 8% tax at check in (resort fee). The reservation was made through the Hilton website. The food at the pool bar & the restaraunt was sub-par. Drinks were around $7 (8oz) & strictly poured. The bartenders are in no hurry to get that drink to you quickly & yes I did tip. My room wasn't made up until after 4:00 every day. You'll need to rent a car (beware) or take a taxi to do anything outside the resort. The Low Down: I guess it was almost worth the money. We stayed for 3 nights and were definitely ready to go. Driving in PR is nuts. Get the insurance if you go that route & avoid rush hour if possible. If we were to go again, I would get something closer to San Juan or another place that had better choices of restaraunts near by or in the hotel. Though, El Ladrillo was very good. About $100 for two.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: papi1096
Reviews.Content: Family friendly. Stayed 1 week in Feb 2007 during school vacation. 2 adults 3 children. A little difficult to find. Hotel at the end off a private road in a gated community. Beach front property, private beach, hot tub and swimming pools, suites are roomy and very clean. Hot breakfast included. A little exspensive paid about $300 a night. At ck out was charged another fee some type of room tax that was not included in the room rate. I think it was about 8% of room rate a night. also parking is 10 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: NYLiam
Reviews.Content: We booked a house in Rincon for 5 people and were victums of a bate and switch ( be very careful renting a house outside the continental US as you have very little recourse should you fall victim to an unscrupulous real estate agent). Anyway, here we are, last minute, 5 people. Thank god for the Embasy Suites in Dorado. We'd stayed there our first night upon arriving in PR so knew of it's existence. Because we were 2 adults, 3 college age boys we needed 2 suites at very least. We were able to book 2 suites, oceanside with partial view and the sound of crashing waves to lull you to sleep. For the price of the rooms it was quite nice and I'm a fussy person. Newly decorated. Comfortable bed with soft sheets . Open bar by the pool everynight from 5:30-7:30 (top shelf). Cooked to order breatkast or buffet every AM. The hotel has been newly upgraded. Staff were very friendly, courteous. For $189. night I was quite impressed by the accomodations. I thought I would never be comfortable in this class of hotel but was pleasantly suprised. It's located inside a gated community. Dorado is small town, PR and an easy drive to the ferry in Catano. Would recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding and stay at the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: heleneroper
Reviews.Content: I was married at the Embassy Suites on Dec. 8, 2006. My now-husband and I worked with a travel agent who made all the arrangements for us. We had about 50 people come with us for the wedding - and everyone loved it! I was a bit apprehensive after reading the reviews on here, but I can honestly say it was a beautiful, perfect experience. Most of our guests stayed in the hotel proper - and I would definitely recommend that, as the few people who stayed in the other part were not quite as happy with their rooms or service. We thought our room was very clean, very well serviced and had a great view of the ocean. We never smelled anything musty or had any problems. When we rang for something to be brought, it was brought almost immediately. The breakfast was a great perk - and we didn't encounter many of the problems other posters have talked about. The manager's special (2 hours free drinks) was a wonderful way for us and our guests to begin our night. We (and some of the guests) arrived on Monday and other guests arrived throughout the week. We were married on Friday. After our reception ended, the wedding party moved out to the lobby where there was a live band - we partied until 3 am! The only downside was that there was not a wedding coordinator who worked with me on the day of the wedding; luckily, I'm very laid back and was able to work around this. Not all brides would have been this way. We were married on the beach overlooking the ocean and in my mind, it doesn't get any better than that. I definitely believe that everyone who was with us would not hesitate in booking a trip back here. I will say that the weekend got very crowded with kids in the pool, etc, but up until that point it was perfect. Also, a car is probably a good thing to have. We walked to Pee-Wee one night and it wasn't a bad walk, but not everyone would be up for that. We also made friends with one of the taxi drivers and he made sure to assist us, taking different groups to Old San Juan, San Juan, and some of the local restaurants. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone who asked me.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover3
Reviews.Content: This place looks good in pictures, but after you deal with the service & maintenance issues, you'll have a different impression. Our group waited HOURS (yes, more than 1) to be checked in (this was after the check-in time!), encountered horrible service at all of the bars & restaurants (not only incompetent but rude), and the facilities were not well-maintained.
