The photos provided look nice, but they're probably at least several years old. Everyone in our group is easy to please, yet we were all ready to leave after just one night's stay. Luckily, we were able to find rooms at a different resort outside of San Juan, and the trip was saved!

Reviews.Title: “It is not a resort”
Reviews.Author: Danaljes
Reviews.Content: I went to the Embassay Suites and I expected a resort. When I walked in the door, I felt like I was in a motel. The lobby and the room smelled very musty. The hotel was full of locals and we left after an hour. The pictures on line make this hotel look much better then it was. If you are looking for a motel, it would be fine. This property is not a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Dorado Del Mar Was Decent”
Reviews.Author: WanderingPencil
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Dorado Del Mar between Christmas and New Year's. Overall, it was a great way to spend a vacation. The hotel was clean and well-maintained and the staff was friendly and accommodating. Our room was also clean and generally well-maintained. We stayed in a king suite. The king bed was very comfortable and seemed to be fairly new. I cannot say the same thing about the sleeper sofa in the living area where our daughter slept. That was sadly in need of replacement. As a sofa, the cushions were flat and "rock-like". When the bed was opened the mattress was also hard and lifeless. Housekeeping (or maintenance) was very accommodating and brought up another sleeper sofa mattress, which helped for the time we were there. The breakfast buffet included with the room was generally decent, really typical breakfast buffet type food, but perhaps could have been warmer. The restaurants associated with the hotel were okay. We ate there a couple nights, when we didn't feel like heading elsewhere. "Oregano", in the golf course clubhouse across the driveway, had reasonably priced Italian food and tasted much like a Fazoli's or Olive Garden may. The food at the restaurant in the hotel was okay, as hotel food goes. Not great, just okay. The beach in front of the hotel was pretty nice, but could have used just a little more maintenance. Since some guests apparently couldn't be bothered with picking up after themselves after finishing their food and drinks, there was litter that could have been cleaned up. Maybe if they had a few more garbage cans, people would get the message? But, on the other hand, the pool and hot tub were very nice. The Dorado Del Mar golf course was an enjoyable lay-out, but the sand traps could have used some sand. I expected the traps to be wet, as there was scattered light rain daily while there, but they looked like they had not had any sand in them for a long while and missed the upkeep I would expect from a course that charges $108 a round. As a side note, we made a couple of trips into Old San Juan, about a 35-40 minute drive away in our rental car. We visited El Morro and ate at "Buren". I can't tell you what the address was, as we came across it as we were wandering around, but the food we had was excellent and would recommend giving it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing week, even at high season”
Reviews.Author: pickatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an exchange with RCI. While our stay was technically at the Aquarius, this building formed an L shape with Embassy Suites. The Embassy Suites building runs parallel to the beach, while the Aquarius timeshare building runs from one side of the Embassy to the beach. The pool sits in the middle of the "L". We were in room 2174, and loved the location and the view. We were on the ground level, with a great view of the pool and also a view of the ocean. The patio had a small table with 4 chairs, which were in the shade most of the day and nice for eating meals out of the sun. Our trip was with our family of 4 - mom, dad, 14-year-old daughter, and 13-year-old son. Beds were small (doubles, not queens), and not real comfortable. We woke up with back aches most mornings, and the kids fought when going to sleep & when waking up (as most teens do - especially when forced with such "togetherness"). The rooms were okay, and clean. However, there was hardly a kitchen to speak of. As the photos show, there was only a microwave, and a tiny fridge. We were provided with 2 dinner settings, and when asked, were promptly provided with 2 more. With no dish soap and no washrags, however, we ended up doing dishes in the sink with a face towel and liquid hand soap. The kitchen also provided a mini coffee maker and coffee for the first day. We bought more coffee and filters (the regular shape, not cone) at the Grande market, which was a grocery just outside the resort entrance - very convenient, and had beer, etc., too. Not much came in small sizes, though, so you may want to bring small sizes of jelly, seasonings, etc. if you plan to eat much in your room. We checked in on Friday, and finally got maid service on Tuesday. With some asking, we were able to get towels exchanged sooner, as they did not dry even when hung up, and were not real desirable after a couple days. Our phone in the room never did work the entire week we were there, but this was only a minor inconvenience for us, fortunately. Other than that, they were helpful when we asked for more towels, dishes, etc. Also, bring soap - they only have those refillable liquid dispensers for hand soap, shampoo, and shower soap, and nothing suds. The pool was great, and pool chairs were abundant - even for us late risers. No problem finding chairs even at 10am or later. The pool was clean, but a tad cold. Nice for cooling off in, but a little chilly for me to hang out in. The beach was ok. There were signs to watch out for amenones, but we never saw any. The beach is sandy and big enough for the crowd, with lots of chairs as well as a volley-ball net. The beach area was protected with large rocks further out, and there were no waves to speak of (nice for little ones, but boring for the teens). Overall, it was a pleasant stay. Would have been nicer to have more kitchen facilities, more chairs for just hanging out in the room, and definitely better mattresses on queen-sized beds. However, I guess we can't have it all with a studio. Check in and out were easy. The women working the front desk were very friendly and helpful. English was widely spoken at the resort. Two other things worth mentioning. It was nice to finally stay somewhere that doesn't threaten to charge $50 for a lost pool towel, but the $7 per day charge for our rental car parking was a bit much. Overall, I would recommend this resort, especially to families. There were lots of little kids here.

Reviews.Title: “OK for families but there are problems”
Reviews.Author: jimny
Reviews.Content: I spent Thanksgiving week 2006 with my family at the Embassy Suites in Dorado Beach, Puerto Rico. The hotel is a typical suites arrangement, with breakfast and a cocktail hour included in the price of $235/night. The breakfast food is passable but certainly not restaurant quality. The only food arrangement worth noting is the Blue Seahorse bar/grill at the pool, where lunch is available from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. The food here is tasty and the portions are large, and an idea is to eat a large (if mediocre) breakfast and then do dinner at the pool bar/grill before it closes. The hotel has a very nice beach and a beautiful series of interconnected pools. There are pool toys and floats that can be bought or rented, and many people simply stay at the water all day. Other activities include tennis ($10/hour) which I did twice, and golf (which I did not do). The two tennis courts are in mediocre condition and not terribly well maintained. Noise is a big problem at this hotel. Once or twice a week there is a band playing in the center atrium until nearly midnight, and there is no escaping the sound. This is an odd situation because there are so many young children as well as several golfers who want to play early in the morning when itâ€™s cooler. For private events the hotel has a ballroom; be sure your room is not over that facility because the noise and vibration from the music are astonishing and will make you very unhappy. The local shopping is all fast food and typical of low level U.S. shopping centers (e.g., the nearby strip center has a Western Auto), and it is over one mile away. You must rent a car near the airport; do not consider using a limo service to the hotel (as some guests did) because you will be totally stranded. This is a particular problem at dinner time, because there is only one restaurant (upscale) open every night and an Italian restaurant open Wednesdays through Sundays. The best attraction in Puerto Rico may be the rain forest (El Yunque) but it is nearly two hours away past San Juan. The roads and entrances are poorly marked and you should assume that most of a day will be spent going to/from and at this activity. By the way, the directions provided by the hotel were mostly wrong; instead, get a map. Of course, the architecture of Old San Juan itself is fascinating and worth a day trip, although many of the lovely homes have been turned into tourist shops. In summary, the Embassy Suites Dorado Beach is marginally acceptable for the price and for those looking for a family friendly resort. Many of the staff understood this mission; some did not and that made for a few unpleasant moments. If you want sun and water, this may be a reasonable choice. If you want more activities, access to fine dining and culture, luxury or quiet, this may not be your best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mscuilla
Reviews.Content: The resort is a great place, especially when you take into account what you get for your money! The rooms are great spacious suites for the great price. The pool area is great and real close to a good, not great, beach area. The beach is not as small as other reviews stated. The golf course has a great layout with the back nine being much better than the front. My only comnplaint was they had an outing one day and would not let any guests go out! Saturday morning is very busy and I could not get a tee time early even though when I called from home they said the course would be empty and to just walk on. The course is also over priced, but I guess not for an island resort course. The resaurants at the resort did not look that great (although we did not opt to eat at them), but we got great reviews of other places from tripadvisor's other reviews and loved El Ladrillo and El Marinos. We got a recommendation about a place Alberto's and found it to be average at best. But the other two places were great. The breakfast was awesome. Some people criticized it, I don't know why. They cooked hot omelets or eggs, fresh pancakes and had waitresses asking if you needed anything - just ask for them to reheat your food and it was done. Fresh fruit, cereal, bagels, pasties, french toast, etc... I figure about a $40 value for free. Also the cocktail two hours was great - free cocktails (everything but frozen drinks). Really a nice deal to get a few drinks before dinner and keep from spending another $40 a night at dinner on drinks. We would definitely go back, especially with our yound kids. This time was a nice romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Azahares
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days and 3 nights at the Embassy Suites in Dorado in Early August 2006. The resort is huge and at first we were very confused trying to find parking. We tried to check in without realizing that we were trying to check-in at their vacation club (Aquarius). The woman was very nice and pointed us toward the hotel check-in desk. Check-in was a breeze even though there was only one person at the front desk. The manager on duty immediately walked up to us and helped us use the electronic kiosk for check-in. He was very pleasant! When we told him we parked our car near Aquarius and were wondering how to bring our bags in he said no problem and immediately called the bell-hop who went with us to our car on the other side of the property and brought our luggage upstairs. The room was beautiful, clean and very spacious. We had a view of the golf course and from the right side of the balcony couls see the ocean. All the staff we encountered is very nice and very accommodating to say the least. We had purchased a bottle of wine on our way to the hotel and on the first night ordered room service and requested a bottle opener without a problem. The breakfasts were very good and on Friday afternoon we were going to go off of the property to have a cheaper lunch and due to a convention or something we opted not to leave because the parking lot was a nightmare! We were afraid to give up our spot and it didnâ€™t help that there was a car blocking us anyway. We opted to have lunch at the Blue Seahorse Bar & Grill. Yes, itâ€™s expensive but itâ€™s hotel dining. We also ordered take-out pizza from Oregano one night and it was also very good. Other than the parking problems, there are really no other complaints because the hotel is absolutely beautiful! The pools and the beach are spectacular. Donâ€™t be afraid to drive to San Juan. We spent a day in Old San Juan and had lunch at La Bombonera. We also went and had dinner at Pikayo in the Museo de Arte in San Juan. It was a magnificent 5-star dining experience, worth every penny! The service was impeccable as well. We highly recommend it (the Embassy Suites has a sample menu in their book filled with menus in the lobby). We will definitely return to Embassy Suites Dorado on our next trip to the island!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families”
Reviews.Author: 54kerry
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (including a 3 year old and an infant) stayed at the Embassy Suites in Dorado in March 2006. We have traveled rather extensively, and were content with our accommodations and the property in general. The room itself was absolutely fine - spacious, with a nice balcony and a water view. It worked very well for our needs. The hotel had a very nice pool area which we all enjoyed, including a nice wading pool for the kids. The beach area was perfect for our little ones, though the lack of waves might bother some. We generally went out and about during the mornings and returned to the hotel mid-afternoon to relax at the pool & beach, which worked out very well - the pool and beach were rarely crowded. The location of the hotel was good in that typically we didn't get stuck in too much traffic when we were headed out (either to El Yunque, San Juan or Arecibo), versus others we know who have stayed closer to San Juan who've experienced a lot of frustration with the traffic. The ferry from near the Bacardi factory made the trip into Old San Juan an absolute breeze (at least once we found the ferry terminal). Our primary complaint with the hotel was the food, as also mentioned in other reviews. The restaurant within the hotel was very bland and uninteresting, and the Italian restaurant across the street wasn't very exciting either (and quite frankly, when in PR I really don't need to eat Italian food). The breakfast was convenient but unexciting - the lack of fresh juices and fruit was surprising. We did venture out a few times to other restaurants in the area, but none I'd really recommend. The most "authentic", interesting food we had was in Old San Juan at a little luncheonette called Cafe Manolin - inexpensive, tasty and very friendly service, filled with locals. But we never found anything similar in the Dorado area. That said, if we needed to be in the Dorado area again, I'd return to the Embassy Suites, especially if we had the kids with us - you just can't beat the convenience, and overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Embassy Suites, Dorado Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: becky47
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Embassy Suites in Dorado. We chose it because it was away from the city and could accomodate 3 adults with ease. We had a room with a view of the ocean and we could hear the waves at night. The staff is the most professional we've encountered at an Embassy Suites. Whenever we had a concern it was addressed immediately. The grounds are well maintained and immaculate. The sound of the couquis at night are relaxing. The breakfast is excellent. The first day there my daughter and I relaxed on the beach while my husband swam in the ocean. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the first night and our waiter gave us great tips on where to eat on the island. The parking was fine. Even with several conferences my husband always found parking. This hotel was a great base to explore both sides of the island. It usually took us no more than 1/2 hour to get to Old San Juan and about the same time to get to Camuy Cave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: tomsak
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family vacation to Puerto Rico. 4 of us, 2 preteen girls. We stayed here on 8/1-2 and then switched over to the Westin Rio Mar by plan. See that review separately. This hotel offers what many families have come to love about Embassy Suites...a large clean suite where the sofabed can serve as separate sleeping quarters, the fridge and microwave, 2 TVs. It is a "resort" but don't expect, well, the Westin Rio Mar. The breakfast buffet is fine, gets very crowded at prime time (9am), but well below the standards of many U.S. Embassy Suites locations in terms of the variety offered. For a Caribbean island, I would have at least expected some fresh fruit (nowhere to be seen) as well as fresh juices. The OJ came out of a mixer nozzle warm and was undrinkable. Add your own ice from a bucket touched by the hands of hundreds. The Manager's Reception was fine and on par with most Embassy Suites. They charge $7 for parking which is a bit much. (Definitely rent a car wherever you go in PR for flexibility and excursions). $10 charge for wireless Internet as well unless you are a Hilton Honors member. The grounds were very nice, good pool, nice clean beach but small and protected by rock jetties. This cuts down the waves for the littles ones but detracts from the ocean feel. However, it is quite a nice setting. There is not much else to do at the resort, no scheduled resort activities. The golf course looked just OK, too hot to play in my opinion. You don't get the trade winds here to the same extent as in Rio Mar which is more exposed to the easterlies. The staff was very nice, friendly and accomodating. About the locals...for a mid-week stay, the place was indeed very crowded at the pool with local Puerto Ricans on vacation. There is an attached time share building called Aquarius which must pack them in and they get to use the hotel facilities. Americans were most definitely in the minority. It does calm down at night. Bottom line, for the slow season, you can work a much better deal at the Westin Rio Mar and experience a true resort vacation. I am just glad we stayed at the Embassy Suites first before the Westin as my family would probably still not be talking to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Livin-in-the-moment
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Embassey Suites Dorado June 17th through June 24th 2006. I booked this hotel because of the great price but was a little worried about some of the reviews I had read on this site. I took a chance and WOW. It is a beautiful hotel. The free breakfast was excellent, the room was very nice, the staff were all very friendly and helpful, and the pool area and beach were just beautiful. Cons.... You must rent a car to stay here. Parking is a little hectic at times but we always managed. You cannot find a better place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the KIds”
Reviews.Author: okislander
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant experience at the Embassy Suites Dorado Del Mar. We selected this resort due to its close proximity to golf courses. We also were traveling with our two boys ages 4 and 1. The pools were wonderful for the children and the spacious rooms were a plus. The beach was a bit of a disappointment due to the seaweed but the boys enjoyed playing in the sand and we didn't have to worry about them being knocked over by large waves. The free breakfast and the managers receptions were nice and we were always able to find a place to sit. Drinks at the pool bar were very good and reasonably priced for a resort. My favorites were the Mudslide and the Dorado Vice. Now, for the negatives. During the weekend the pools were very crowded with locals, the clientele was not what you would typically find at a resort. On Mondays all restuarants in Dorado are closed except for the fast food. Restuarant choices in the area are limited but we did have a great meal at La Morenas. There is also no good shopping in the area and San Juan is at least 45 min drive. While in PR we did visit the El Yunque Rainforest and El Morro. We enjoyed them both. The rainforest is a bit of a drive (about 11/2 hours). I would recommend visiting both if you have time. According to the golfers in the group, the Dorado del Mar course was "okay" but they really enjoyed one of the courses at the Hyatt. Although the Hyatt is closed, the golf courses are still open.

Reviews.Title: “April vacation week”
Reviews.Author: GROFREE
Reviews.Content: Found this website extremely helpful in deciding to stay at this property so I thought I would return the favor and post a review. Overall, this property was great. We were there during Massachusetts April vacation week, which also coincided with Easter weekend. We arrived on Good Friday, a major holiday on PR, so a lot of things were closed. Check in had the potential to be slow but my husband is a Hilton Honor member so we got to use that line and it made check in a little quicker. The property was sold old for Easter weekend. It was about as crowded as you could get. We tried to hit breakfast by 8:30 and never had a problem getting a table. Mostly it's a buffet, if you order an omlet or fried eggs, that will be the hottest part of the meal, everything else is pretty much luke warm. Having read the reviews we went to the pool after breakfast and reserved 3 chairs. By noon on Sat and Sun. I'm not sure there was a lounge to be had. The rest of the week was busy, but not like Easter weekend. We ate at El Ladrillo, as recommended by others, and it was a great dinner. Expect to pay $100 for dinner for 3. Our other favorite restaurant was Morena, again $100 for three. Atmosphere was terrific, presentation superb. Take a right out of the gate and take the road along side the Gulf station. We actually ate at Morena twice, picking it as our favorite restaurant for our last night on PR. Manager recommended Las Brasas, Argentinian steakhouse. Don't waste your time, no atmosphere and the food was mediocre at best. PeeWees was a good lunch spot and had dinner there as well. La Terraza was very good, but not as good as El Ladrillo or Morena. Oregano was ok, we went there on our first night. Other restaurant at Embassy Suites seemed to always have a themed buffet for $25-$28. Not a big buffet fan. Never made it to the Hyatt, casino seems to be closed at this point. Ask at the check in desk for a map of the area. They have one with all the local restaurants and grocery store...we didn't get on until about day 5, when we asked for a restaurant recommendation. It would have been very helpful earlier in the week. Bacardi rum tour was fun, better than we expected. Comes with 2 free cocktails. Old San Juan, a good day trip. We experienced a lot of frustration with the traffic. Tried to get several places and got stuck in traffic for 60-90 minutes and would give up. The manager's cocktail hour 5:30-7:30 was more than welcome on those days! Found everyone to be very friendly. Most people spoke English without a problem and were helpful when we forced our 16 year old to use some of her Spanish! I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: gvf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Spring Break and I have to say that I have visited many places throughout the U.S. but this was one of the BEST!! Puerto Rico is a BEAUTIFUL island with MANY things to do and see. We were only there for four nights and that was definitely not enough time. You defintely want to RENT a car if you want to see other parts of the island getting around can be a bit challenging but be patient. The hotel offers directions to every attraction. But be ALERT because signs are not posted clearly and traffic is CRAZY!!!! Our hotel was a bit distant from many attractions but it was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of San Juan. Being from a big city myself I definitely did not want to be anywhere that reminded me of home. And yes parking at the hotel is $7 a day but who cares you're on vacation. It's not an all-inclusive resort so don't expect all the perks. The hotel is primarily a FAMILY hotel. So if you are on your honeymoon I do not recommend you stay there. There are kids everywhere. Which was great for us because we have a 7 and a 9 year old. The hotel was CLEAN with a beautiful beach that was very safe for the kids. The pools were GREAT. The restaurants were quite PRICEY but that was expected. It was nice to have the complimentary breakfast which offerered EVERYTHING and it was not crazy at all. We were seated immediately and we always arrived after 8am. The managers special was a TREAT as well. It ran for two hours which was plenty for my husband and I. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel to any FAMILY. Overall it was a WONDERFUL experience my family LOVED it and we would deinitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 4 night stay at the Embassy Suites and I can't say enough about it. We went with our 2 kids (2 1/2 and 9 months) and it was a perfect place for us. The price is extremely reasonable and includes breakfast and a manager's reception. The breakfast was more then adequate, I don't know what some people possibly expect. They had everything from eggs and pancakes to yogurt and cereal. We never hit the crowd because our kids are early risers, so we were usually eating by 8:30 am. Besides, you're on vacation, so take it slow! The pool and beach are perfect for kids. We weren't a bit nervous about letting our 2 1/2 year old run from the kiddie pool to the zero entry larger pool. And the beach is so calm that he had his freedom there too. My 9 month old napped in the shade of his stroller and then took a dip in the pool with a floatie we brought from home. You can rent floaties by the pool for $15/day or $5 for an hour. Then we would eat lunch at the pool bar and return to our spacious clean room for afternoon naps (the kids, not us). For dinner, you can order in from Dominoes Pizza or Pizza Hut if you choose or eat in the hotel at Oreganos- decent pizza, pasta was eh. We also took car service to a local restaurant (Il Ladrillo) which was delicious and to the Hyatt Cerromar which has a Johnny Rockets (good for kids) and a delicious Chinese/Japanese restaurant. The manager's reception was outside by the pool. Mostly kids getting free Shirley Temples, but we took a glass (more like a plastic cup) of wine here and there while my son had ice cream from the store in the lobby. We really enjoyed our vacation. Everyone was extremely friendly and accommodating. If you're a family- go, go, go. If you're a couple looking for a romantic vacation- look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice secluded place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mv99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our recent (but short) trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Dorado for 3 nights. The hotel is relatively new and located in a private residential area on Dorado Beach. It was a nice get away from the hustle and bustle and cold weather of New York City. The hotel is a Embassy Suites hotel - the lobby is open with greenery and waterfalls; the suites are clean and spacious; and though our room didn't have a full ocean view, we could still see the ocean from our balcony which was nice and relaxing. The hotel is very family oriented, so expect kids of all ages. The pool area is really cool and the beach though small area wise was more than enough. Plenty of sun, drinks, and food, they even provide massage service on the beach!! All of the hotel staff, with the exception of the concierge, were extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge was very pushy and tried to sell us hard on renting a car from him. We didn't want to drive during our trip so we passed. My wife and I are vegetarian and the waiters/waitresses at the restaurants were more than accommodating with the lack of vegetarian items on the menus. They tended to our every want and concern. The "made to order breakfast" is more of a buffet rather than what ever your heart desires, but it's still a nice touch. The Italian restaurant in the golf complex across from the hotel was also very good. We actually ate dinner there two out of three nights. But be aware, it's closed on Monday and Tuesday. The hotel is secluded from the rest of San Juan, from the rest of Dorado for that matter. It is difficult and can be expensive to venture out of the resort if you don't have a car. If going to Old San Juan, I recommend taking a taxi to the ferry port ($35 dollars to ferry port and 50 cents for the ferry) and taking the ferry to Old San Juan. The whole process of taxi to ferry and back was actually very easy, because the ferry drops you off right in Old San Juan. The hotel's taxi driver, Louis, is great. Also, be aware the rain forest is approx a 2 hour drive from the hotel. All is all a very nice and relaxing place to stay if that's what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Dorado, PR- excellent trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from a week at the Embassy Suites Dorado Del Mar, Puerto Rico on MArch 7 ( flight home was a nightmare thanks to Continental, but that's another story) I can't say enough good things about the hotel and staff- it's a perfect place for anyone looking for a low key, relaxing vacation in beautiful surroundings- beach is small but more than adequate if you just like to float around and cool off, pool area was large enough that you could actually swim around without crashing into people and the hot tub in a corner of the pool secluded by plants was never that crowded. The staff kept our room immaculate - i would say to try a room on the upper floor as the weekend entertainment can get very loud- but if you close your inner door, you won't hear it- although there were quite a few families with young children, we must have hit a week where the hotel wasn't fully booked because we were able to find quiet areas to retreat to. Free Breakfast could be busy but that varied and we were even able to grab one of the few tables on the little balcony area overlooking the gorgeous courtyard on several mornings. If you ask the cooks to throw the lukewarm pre-cooked meats and potatoes on the grill as they cook your made to order eggs, it greatly improves the meal- The free cocktail hour was a nice littel break after a day in the sun, sefvice was good and drinks were premium brands. Not for big drinkers though- 2 per person limit- which was plenty for us. Everyone working there, from the front desk to the kids who helped set up chairs and give out towels, seemed to really enjoy their jobs and get along with each other and would help with anything we asked. the restaurant across from the lobby, Oregano, had a good variety, good value and the food was better than we expected. Go into town to El Ladrillo for a treat- the local art on the walls is an extra plus- a little pricey but well worth it. There are stores close by outside the complex - no problem finding things you might need- plenty of familiar chains around. if you go to the Bacardi plant, ask about the ferry in CAtano and take that to Old San Juan for 50 cents- don't drive! the traffic can be brutal and there's no place to park- you can grab a cab once there or walk up to El MOrro- Just be careful if you drive not to miss the turn off as you get close to Dorado- get good directions, as there is no sign for Dorado going west from the airport once you get off the main highway- exit for Dorado is right after toll - if you aren't looking for lots of action on the premises, this is a great place to use as either a relaxing hideout or a central location to travel to other nearby tourist sites. but we found the grounds and hotel itself to be so inviting, we didn't leave to do any sightseeing for 5 days! Don't bother going to the Casino at the Hyatt with the free shuttle - disgusting, smelly and run down- not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: magzsr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 02/03-02/20. Excellent staff all around. local restaurants Mangiare,Las Pedrillas,not sure of spelling and Mare,not sure. were very good. Relaxing no wave beach,pools and hot tub great. skip the $15.00 breakfast. Had a room that was supposed to sleep 4,cant happen. Too small for 4. Went to the caves,took the ferry to old San Juan,spend the day. Bacardi rum factory. Mostly relaxed on the beach sipping adult beverages soaking in the sun. great vacation

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico and we Loved it. The hotel was clean and all of the staff were helpful and friendly. The complimentary breakfast is all you could want. If you like to drink you can save money between 5:30 and 7:30 free drinks! I would recommend renting a car. You are on vacation so travel at off peak times and the traffic is fine. I golfed every day right at the hotel. The greens are terriffic and the layout is very nice. The 10th hole gives a great view of the Atlantic Ocean. I was first to tee off, if you like to golf early,7am. The course was not crowed on any day. You have to eat at the El Ladrillo restaurant right in Dorado, it is great. The waiters and staff are wonderful, they played a guitar and sang a few songs for our anniversay. It was delightful. It used to be a train station and now a great place to eat some local food and see fine art. (-)elladrillorestaurant(-) The rain forest El Yukai is 45 mins away but worth the trip. I would stay here again great golf, nice beach especially for kids because it is isolated and protected. 30 mins to Old San Juan, take the ferry from Catano it is local and fun. Roads are marked but directions will help. Have agreat time and try some Mufungo!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: agatsal
Reviews.Content: Family of four with two teenage daughters stayed at Embassy Suites Dorado during Presidents week. Overall - above average experience. Great value. Well priced spacious suites. Suites are clean/fresh/well decorated. Despite of full hotel - never felt 'crowded'. Only exception - breakfast time - there could be 10 minute lines for made-to-order omelets etc. Grounds well spaced. Nice pool. Small beach. Extremely pleasant staff. Easy check in. Helpful front desk. Wireless access on grounds (poolside, lobby etc.). Parking adequate. Two restaurants (in hotel restaurant - overpriced. Other one - good food/well priced). Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “would mostly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious one bedroom on the eighth floor of building two, with a nice balcony overlooking the ocean, pools, courtyard and mountains in the distance. Very nice to sit out there, especially since the laptop computer worked with a fast wireless internet connection - it did not work consistently inside the room itself. The staff was quite pleasant and polite, parking was sometimes tight - once we returned and there were no spaces to be found at all, even in the employee lot. Other days it was almost full, so we found a spot right away. Breakfast was OK, way too crowded and haphazardly organized and laid out. The breakfast staff tried but seemed overwhelmed. Perhaps it is better at 7 AM as the sign suggests. The ocean beach is quite good for little children as the man-made breakwater keeps the water calm - keep in mind the water is only about three feet deep at the deepest and most of the bottom is rocky and a little rough on the feet. Overall we liked it better than El Conquistador, where we stayed last year with the constantly out of service funicular driving us crazy.

Reviews.Title: “great experience...... from father and son .”
Reviews.Author: RobRochester
Reviews.Content: From Rob and Robby,Rochester,N.Y. My son and i stayed here the week of february recess and it never seemed crowded at all. everything from check in to check out went very smoothly . Some reviews mentioned the problems with parking and the so called cheap breakfast,but let me tell you,the parking is fine,if you rent a normal size car or a full size like we had there will be no problem at all.The ego people that rented the escalades,hummers,and luxury convertibles,like we saw ,well there you go . Each morning the fully cooked to order breakfast was one of the best i've ever had,you never went away hungry or dissapointed. The grounds are kept in top shape and the pool and beach were exceptionally clean .The crew goes out of their way to set you up with the chairs and towels and picks out the best spot to lay out. The two room suite was large,clean,updated and had a wonderful view of the ocean and pool area. No mold or bugs that people wrote of in their reviews .The woman who cleaned our room took great pride in her job ,especially cleaning up after a teenager..... The staff was very friendly and always wore a smile on their faces.If you play golf like we did all week ,you wont be dissapointed .Bring the camera for the tenth hole and the view of the ocean is breathtaking. We can't say thank you enough for the perfect vacation , and i mean absolutely no problems at all. On a final note i must say the staff,guests,and new friends we met, made this vacation one of the best,so thank you to all who stayed there through the week of february 25th. We have traveled all over the caribbean , and if we don't come back here next year ,i know we won't have the same experience somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Work The System For a Good Time”
Reviews.Author: dpara
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to the Embassy Suites in Dorado was quite an experience. Navigating the roadways was a challenge and we got lost a number of times. But on this, our second trip here, we felt like old hands and were able to hit all the right twist, turns and unexpected freeway exits to arrive at the hotel a mere 30 minutes after picking up our rental car. A quick drop off of kids, luggage and mom was followed by an equally quick return of dad and car when the hotel parking lot proved to be full. In a smart, but more costly move, we elected to valet the car our entire stay for quick entrances and exits. Check-in was smooth once we were able to obtain the attention of a desk clerk. Lines predominate here and at the concierge desk as neither seems adequately staffed. Once through the line, we were whisked up the glass elevators to our ocean-view suite on the fifth floor with a lovely panorama of the pool area and ocean. A wonderful breeze wafted in and we drank in the 84 degree weather before quickly changing and heading to the pool. We spent the majority of our time here as our children preferred the pool to the beach area although we did mange to build a few sand castles and attempt to snorkel the calm, walled in bay-like beach. The hotel boasts four pools: three joined by a series of water falls with a childrenâ€™s pool off to one side. Parents can feel comfortable letting little swimmers navigate all pool areas as none exceed four-feet in height. And while floats and pool toys (and umbrellas!) can be rented for $15 a day, we had elected to bring our own (make â€˜em blow-up ones for easy packing). Our days passed easily enough just hanging out at the pool on our rafts. Thatâ€™s because we are old hands at more than navigating Puerto Ricoâ€™s roads. We are also old hands at navigating the Embassy Suites system. Like the front desk and its lines, things take time in all areas of the resort. We knew to order lunch from the poolside restaurant at least 45 minutes before we thought the children would get hungry. We also knew to hit the local grocery store (just 5 minutes outside the resort area) to insure that we had snacks and the makings of peanut butter and jelly sandwiches for those times we didnâ€™t gauge our childrenâ€™s needs correctly. We also knew our room would not be made-up until late in the afternoon. And, we also knew to avoid the hotel for evening meals (or risk never eating dinner at all). We also knew to hit breakfast early so there was no need to wait for a table. And speaking of breakfast, the one offered by Embassy Suites has everything you need for a good â€“ but not great â€“ meal: made-to-order omelets, breakfast meats, cereals, breads and rolls and an array of non-chilled juices (but accompanied by a big bucket of ice to offset that problem). While the main attractions at this hotel are the beach and pool area, it also offers a small game room (with many games out of order while we were there) and a gym. Massages are also available and, of course, the ubiquitous Embassy Suites Managerâ€™s Reception with free drinks and munchies presented every evening from 5:30 â€“ 7:30 pm. You need to enter this hotel in a vacation frame-of-mind. Make the system work for you. Enjoy what there is to offer -- sun, pool, beach, warm and balmy weather, free drinks -- and donâ€™t stress about the rest. The Embassy Suites Dorado makes a perfectly acceptable vacation for a family with young children as long as you can work the system to your advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: victoria1970
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful short getaway in the Embassy Suites Dorado in January 2006. We arrived 3 hours before check-in and we were quickly checked through without a problem. The 2 room suite with a door between the living room and bedroom and two TVs was appointed nicely. The view from the terrace was spellbinding. The pool area was large and inviting with shaded areas. The only problem there was that despite their being 4 pool areas there was no place to swim with the water over 3 ft. The beach was pleasant and the hotel is only 5 minutes away from lovely Dorado beach. Breakfast was fine and the happy hour was a pleasant diversion. All in all, we loved it and the value was unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Dec. 27, 2005 for 3-nights at a two-bdrm villa which is part of the Aquarius timeshare resort adjacent to Embassy Suites hotel (rented through Embassy Suites). Check-in was a disaster, arrived for 4:00 PM check-in, did not get into our room until about 6:00 PM. The hotel itself is very nice, but the aquarius room was pretty run down, carpets need to be replaced, bathroom toilets were plugged during our whole stay, musky smell...needs upgrading. The breakfast buffet was nice and quicker than I thought it would be with as full as the hotel was during the holidays. We had lunch/dinnner at the hotel which was good, service was bad though for our lunch, our waiter went on a 1/2 hr break while taking care of us, and left no one covering for her. The ground are nice, but you don't have a lot of room to walk around, not much beachfront property. Not even one hammock to lay down on, just two hard wood benches to sit an enjoy the ocean view. Also forget getting a beach chair, unless you go at like 7:00 AM, they were all reserved by people placing a towel and book on them and no one to be found using them for hours, just people reserving them which stinks. I would not stay at this place again, much better places in Puerto Rico to leave you hard earned bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LarryNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property Christmas 2005. I am not a huge embassy suites fan. Although you get good value for your money, I always find the properties lacking in some intangible..they seem generic i suppose. Void of character. However, I must say, i was impressed with this hotel. Considering the price vs other Puerto rico properties, it can be considered a true bargain. While planning this trip, i found most other big name hotels sought $300-$500 a night, while ES was only $225 including breakfast (which was just ok-but-free, so who could complain) The location of the hotel in Dorado was not very convenient to the rest of the island. you are 7 minutes from the highway, then a total of 30 minutes to san juan, 1 hour to the rainforest Luquillo area. there really is nothing close by, so if you like to explore, be prepared to drive lots. the pool area was beautiful. It consists of an above average inifinity pool looking out to the ocean. bravo. the view will take you far from the winter up north, and put you into tropical bliss. my only complaint here is the lounge chairs..just the basic strap type, and cushions would be nice. the beach: very serviceable..not the most beautiful, but i dont think anyone would find the beach here a drawback from enjoying the property. the ocean is calm. the staff were mostly pleasant. many would go out of their way to greet you, and were helpful. this place seems very well managed on new years day when the hotel was fully booked, they had extra staff to accomodate the masses. impressive. the rooms were standard ES size, but in very good condition as the hotel is relatively new. not many quality dining options in Dorado, so once again, be prepared to drive to SJ or other areas. In Dorado, A la brassa, steakhouse just ok, nothing special, the italian restaurant on the ES property better, but again, just OK. In conclusion, if you want a beautiful property, and a very very reasonable price, and dont mind driving to see the island, you will be very happy at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, our family enjoyed our stay at The Embassy Suites in Dorado. Pros: 1) nice, unique beach 2) clean and comfortable rooms 3) friendly staff Our rooms were spacious and clean - no complaints. Housekeeping came whenever we asked and was very accommodating. Friendly staff! The beach is more of a lagoon, as others have posted. Still, it's nice. Also, the poolside cafe has good food! Cons: 1) location 2) unprepared for busy holiday season The hotel is about 30 minutes away from downtown San Juan. Thus, we weren't as close to restaurants and evening activities as we would like, but there are plenty of taxis available to travel back and forth between the hotel and downtown. With six people, we typically spent $120 for round trip. Rent a vehicle early if you feel comfortable driving. It's worth the money, especially if you take excursions to Fajardo and the rainforest. Other than the location, our biggest complaint was the hotel was understaffed for the holiday season. I typically waited 30 minutes to an hour to talk to the concierge everyday. Also, no one working at the hotel, whether in housekeeping, the front desk, or valet, ever answered the phones. However, I suspect the hotel operates much smoother during lighter weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites from December 21 to December 28. The 2 bedroom suite had ample room for my wife and me and our 3 teenagers. It was clean although the furniture was somewhat uncomfortable. The beach and pool are quite accessible and very nice although as the hotel got busier there were not enough beach chairs. It is a great place for a relaxing beach vacation although there is not much else to do - my teenagers were bored after a while. Also the beach is very protected with no wave action at all. Hotel service was fine except our kids were late sleepers and we sometimes had to remind the cleaners to service our room in the afternoon. Breakfast hours (ends at 9:30 during the week) are more in line with a hotel serving business travelers than vacationers. Resort restaurants were ok but limited -you definitely need a car to get around to eat in other places. Service in the poolside restaurant is horribly slow. All in all considering the price vs alernatives I think it offers good overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very polite and went out of their way to help us with anything we needed. The Bellman, (in particular Pedro and Steve) went out of their way to get us transportation when it appeared there were no taxi's in the area on Christmas night. They drove us (and picked us up 3 hours later) to our retaurant in their own car.

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotel and timeshare”
Reviews.Author: Fabs
Reviews.Content: Hello, just got back from Aquarius timeshare. This is a very good hotel if you just want to stay at the hotel and have ok food. We are food junkies and ok is not good enough. We rented a car and went out to eat every day.Most of the time we stayed local and had good results. Pee Wee's was ok my family loved it, I thought it was too much like fast food). La Terrazza was very good (paella was the best I have EVER had). Most meals for a family of 4 (remember we are foodies and that means 2 appatizers and dessert) was around $150 with tip.THE best meal we had was at Villa Dorada D'Alberto at Dorado public beach and that meal was only $80. If we had more time we would have went there numerous times. In old San Juan we ate at Barrachina village, it was so good we went back again for lunch one day.They include the tip no matter how many are in your party so make sure you check the bill. Don't go to Burger King unless you speak fluent Spanish, they speak NO english. We ordered breakfast and ended up with whoppers and fries. The hotel was very nice,it was clean, the staff was courteous. Weekends are very noisy,local timeshare owners flood the place on Saturday and have loud parties all night long. On Monday it empties out and is paradise again. Just plan all your excursions on the weekends and it won't bother you. We were told that the water isn't as nice in the winter,when we arrived it was murky and you couldn't snorkle. By the time we left , the water was clear and there were fish everywhere.Bring your own snorkles,the hotel charges $25 dollars a pair. We would go back to this hotel again. Any questions feel free to contact my e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello...Embassy Suites Dorado. We had a bedroom condo on the groundfloor. Perfect for going to the pool and the beach. We only hung out at the hotel, was not in the mood to drive 1 1/2 hrs to San Juan, rain forest or any of the shopping. The grocery store is 2 miles from the hotel. Hotel is 26 miles from airport and took us 45 minutes. Tourbus was late and was $75.00 per direction. No much to eat in Dorado area, some restaurants out on the main road, PeeWees and Mahi Mahi was good and prices no too bad. Okay, but some problems. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Aquarius Vacation Club part of the Embassy Suites (timeshare) This is a great family hotel. The pool is magnificent and the view of the ocean is beautiful. I sat out many a morning with my infant daughter and a cup of coffee enjoying the ocean and pool views. The only down side was that as a timeshare guest you have to pay $14.95 (very high price for buffet) for breakfast and there is no where in town for bfast other than Burger King or McDonalds. Walgreens is across the street and open 24 hours and supermarket down the road. I highly recommend staying here. The staff were super nice and very attentive. We had a great time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings but will never stay again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 4:00 didn't get a room until a quarter till 5 (and that was because we complained.) There was a family who was waiting before us for a room they didn't get one until closer to six. We got to our room, and it had ants running up the wall. When we called, they sent someone up with bug spray. We had to call again to get a room change. One night we called for towels at eight o'clock we didn't recieve towels until eleven o'clock at night with pounding at the door and that again was after calling them three or four times. We met other people staying in the hotel and they had said they had ants in their room. We asked them what room they were in, they were in our old room. I don't think we will rush to stay there again. Beautiful grounds,very centrally located, but service not so good in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice About Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from 8 nights at the Embassy Suites in Dorado. We stayed as timeshare owners. After reading other reviews AFTER we booked our vacation, I was prepared for less than an Excellent hotel, but was still disappointed. We rented a car based on other reviews. A car is a must as this hotel is not within walking distance of any stores, restaurants or attractions. This hotel is not near anything, except the Hyatt which has a casino. Driving is an experience! Be prepared for cars changing lanes without signaling and basically cutting you off. When we arrived, the parking lot was totally packed and disorganized. The parking lot is not sized to accommodate the golf and hotel guests. Also, to our total amazement, we were charged a nightly fee of $7 to park the car. We have never incurred a charge for parking a car at any timeshare location prior to this one. Upon check-in, our room was not ready until 6:30 p.m and that was after complaining to the manager. The pool and beach area are very nice and great if you have children. The pool is max depth of 4 ft. in one small area only. The pool has 3 levels and all are viewable from the seating area. Though the beach is on the ocean side, they have built jetties which allow the waves to break further out. The water is very calm and safe. The food at the hotel is expensive and we were not impressed. The rain forest was a great place to visit and Old San Juan. Both are a drive away. Aside from these two attractions, and the casino, we did not find much to do. The hotel had some activities for the children, but not every day. There is a large supermarket down the road, but you definitely need a car to get around. The kitchen is not well equipped so be prepared to cook in saucepans. The sofas need to be replaced. I would not recommend this place to anyone. If you are going to Puerto Rico, stay in San Juan unless you lenjoy sitting by the pool and beach all day.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean surroundings!”
Reviews.Author: Ella078
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a gated community surrounded by a golf course. Very clean everywhere. RENT A CAR if you are planning to stay there. The shuttle was only available to go to the Embassy Casino in San Juan, and only a couple of nights a week. The two restaurants on site were the only good food we found in entire Puerto Rico. A little costly, but not much options except the fast food places outside of the resort (you would have to drive out of the resort in your own rented car, hotel doesn't take you out). The pools were nice. 4 different pools. The free drinks and free breakfast were great. People are very friendly. The only problem we found was the direction cards that the travel desk gave us, there was always something missing, and we ended up getting lost. If you don't speak Spanish, it's not easy to find the way around. Overall itâ€™s great for a family. All of the rooms are suites with a living room and a kitchenette. The beach was ok, a little rocky going deep. Pools were better.

Reviews.Title: “Outside Great,Tower room fine, side wing room poor -parking is a disaster”
Reviews.Author: mcymse
Reviews.Content: Ratings: 1-2 star Check-in : Poor, ALWAYS a line. Parking: TOTAL DISASTER We rented a car since it is located 25 min from airport (without heavy traffic) and wanted to tour island. Parking is a total disaster. First you must get a ticket from a machine, then try and find a spot. IF there aren't spots, told just double park someone and then walk back to entrance to leave keys at payment booth. So yes--we often found our car double parked. The parking situation is totally out of control. It got worse every day especially on Saturday before cruise departures. Would NOT stay here again just based on this problem. Facilities: Gorgeous inside main tower, pool area great, cove, beach area pretty to look at. Son tried using beach- rough sand, very rocky. Cut foot on rocks, Appears created to just say they have a beach. Don't book this hotel based on having a beach. Pools are more family friendly-did have a shallow pool for children separate. Ice machines-often empty, ice tasted horrible. Thankfully our room had a refrig. with filered water & ice. Breakfast: Good spread, cooked to order also. Actually have a sign posted: 7am GREAT breakfast,8am ok breakfast,9am-fair This was so true---we awoke at 7am to get food, by 7:30am filling up and 8am lines. We had hoped to take some food up to our sleeping teen son--were told no food left buffet area--it would be charged as takeout. I spoke with manager of area-and explained should I waste the food I put aside on a plate for him? They agreed one time and gave me a takeout box. Internet: A free terminal next to front desk, guests asked to limit to 15min. Rooms: If get main tower room -same standard as all Embassy's. "Aquarius" vacation suites: Larger, our Air conditioning was just ok, not as cold as main tower and humid in room. We had constant trouble with lock and having to call engineering. Was told being an outside room the rain ruins the computer card in lock and have to replace often. Also side wing access is not attached to main tower, no stairs-aways had to use a erribly slow elevator. Pool & Beach: Pool gorgeous, well landscaped, palm trees, tables, chairs, relaxing area especially chairs over looking beach. Beach: good to view, water quality dark, murky, very rocky. Not a useable beach except to sit in a chair on, perhaps play in sand- do not come for beach facilities. We arrived at 11pm on a Thursday night pre-cruise. Despite requesting main tower, non smoking a year in advance, "the main tower was sold out" but we would be upgraded to a better wing, larger room etc. OK- This area we learned was called "Aquarius" which they try to sell as vacation club. It is larger room with full kitchen versus a mini fridge. It was quite larger than a standard Embassy Room. However it was in a separate building requiring pulling luggage past pool, taking a super slow elevator (even if we wanted to use stairs to second floor there aren't any except a firescape down). There are two versions also of these rooms- interior hallway wing -DO NOT get as everyones cooking permeates hall and noisy as we saw the trend of families bringing all their extended family members and piling into a room. We were fortunate to have the wing with outside hall doorway. It also had a lovely view of the ocean. The next morning we got a call telling us to check out, bring luggage and move rooms, or they could get our luggage later and move it for us. NO Thanks--we discussed with front desk and were given permission to stay in the special room for our 3 night stay. We just had to put up with door lock not locking, or locking us out, A/C not as cold as main tower. Maid Service: Friendly and no problems. Engineering Maintenance: Very helpful and prompt Overall: The hotel presents itself as wonderful to look at but has problems it needs to address. Would NOT return or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: keysgirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fun filled 10 days in Puerto Rico which included a four day stay at the Emassy Suites Dorado Del Mar Beach & Golf Resort. We had our 3 kids with us and another family who had 4 kids with them. We all agreed that it was the perfect hotel for a fun family vacation. The 2 suite rooms are very spacious - and the fact that they have 2 televisions in each suite made our lives very easy too. The daily cooked to order breakfast was wonderful. The omlett station was a great way to vary your breakfast each day along with all of the other choices that were available. Everyone got what they want each morning. The beach was wonderful - put your chair in the water, read a book, listen to music and relax! The protected lagoon area was great with the kids since you didn't have to worry about the breaking waves or the currents. The pool was big and beautiful with lots of room for the kids to swim. The front desk staff was very friendly and very helpful, however the Tour and Travel Desk Staff need some work. They must have had a special on Kayaking trips because each time we asked about tours etc, the answer we got was "how about a kayaking trip?". We ended up just using the free internet in the lobby to look up directions, times, and information. Due to the location of the hotel, we had several choices when it came to food and beverage. You could eat at the hotel, or just outside the gates were chain restaurants like (Church's Fried Chicken) or when you drive out of the hotel, take a left and go down to Dorado Beach area for the local restaurants. We found the Walgreens that was across the street to be a daily stop for us. We stocked up on a styrofoam cooler and ice for the car and filled it with water and soda and snacks for our daily trips around the island. Overall our stay was excellent and we would gladly return to the ESDDMB on our next trip to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: AlRodrigo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aquarius Vacation Club and had a excellent stay. The check in was quick and very courteous. When we walked into the room everything was in place and clean. We stayed in a two bedroom, which was comfortable. The villa had all kitchen utensils, with washer and dryer. The pool area is clean and has shade areas for guests who do not want sun all the time. It has a small beach area which is suitable for kids, no waves due to the rocks surrounding the beach. This hotel and Embassy Suites share the common areas facilities. Every employee that I came in contact with was very courteous. This is a timeshare hotel, and basically you are on your own and do not have the aggressive sales pitch I have encountered in other timeshare hotels. Apparently they respect your space. The hotel is near golf courses and beach areas in the town of Dorado. At the entrance there is a shopping center with supermarket, fast food restaurants and full service restaurants. You are within an hours drive from the Arecibo Observatory, which was an interesting visit. Also San Juan is within a 1/2 hour drive. Overall my stay in this resort was good and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Will Go Again”
Reviews.Author: KaneRene12
Reviews.Content: Despite some negative reviews, my boyfriend and I booked a week here. The hotel and staff were great! Our housekeeper even came in and washed our dishes even though we had a dishwasher! The only downside is the lack of transportation to San Juan. However, if you rent a car, which I would suggest anyway because there are so many wonderful places to see in Puerto Rico, you'll be fine. (Just use extra caution as Puerto Ricans often forget to use their turn signals!) All in all, I would recommend to anyone and I will be going again!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites in Dorado”
Reviews.Author: kmh316
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week at the Aquarius Club-Embassy Suites in Dorado and had another excellent time. We rented two units: a 2 bedroom and an effieciency. While the effieciency was small-2 full size beds a small sink, refrig. and coffee pot it was fine for my me & my husband, and 2 yr old son. My parents, brother, his wife and sister stayed in the 2 bedroom with no problems at all. Their unit was very comfortable and clean. They had what they consider the pool view but was not much of a view. The pool and beach are beautiful and maintained very well. We did have a car, but decided to take the 20 minute walk (one way) every morning to the Panderia (next to Payless Shoes) and had an excellent breakfast everyday instead of paying $15 per person at the hotel. Two complete breakfast came to approx. $10-13. However, you do need a car for anything else you want to do outside the resort. It was prom weekend while we were there, so the hotel was packed with locals. But it was okay. Everyone is so nice. Anyway, I could go on and on about the wonderful time we had at this place that I'm just going to highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JH33194
Reviews.Content: My family went to Puerto Rico in 2004 for a week. We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Dorado. It was very nice. The staff was wonderful, the pools and beach were beautiful, the fitness room was fantastic. Everything was great. The restaurant in the hotel was delicious. The free made to order breakfast was something we looked forward to every morning and the free happy hour in the evening is great! Free drinks for the adults, free pop and popcorn for the children. The pool side bar and grill had pretty good food and great scenery. The rooms are wonderful! Every room is a two room suite. There are no inside rooms, all have a view of the beautiful Puerto Rico. Driving distance to any shopping area or other restaurants was not to far. The golf course was nice but we did not use it. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Puerto Rico!

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites Dorado del Mar Beach & Golf Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 201 Dorado Del Mar Blvd., Dorado 00646, Puerto Rico
